0.name: Court Of Endar
desc: "   You are in the High Court of Endar.  It is a simple room, reminiscent of
times when Endar was much smaller than it is now.  Above the judge's bench
there is a large crest.  The furniture in the court consists of a large oak
bench, which the judge sits behind, two small desks before that, and far
behind those, several long benches for the public.  In one corner you can
see a small barred box, in which to contain dangerous prisoners.  Along the
other wall, there are several chairs, for the jurors, in the few cases that
they are needed for.  There is an atmosphere of solemnity about this room,
a sense of justice, of great things that have happened and have yet to
happen.  At the moment the room is reasonably empty, the silence is paramount,
the echoes of previous trials echoing through the room.
"   The crest consists of a dolphin and a golden crown.  Circling the mosaic
there is written, Justice to All, All are equal in the Law.

1.name: University (Under Construction)
desc: "   The University is obviously only partially built as yet.  The front has
been completed but none of the classes or the meeting halls.  There is a
large construction site in front of you, cordoned off by fencing.  There is
a sign attached to the fencing.  Looking about you can see that this will be
a mighty building once it has been finished.
University Plans
|       |                 A   Garden Walkway
|   F   |                 B   Ecomonics Dept.
|___ ___|                 C   Law Dept.
______________|       |________         D   Thaumaturgy Dept
|   D | C | B |    || A      G  |
|___ __|                 F   Art and Literature Dept.
|      |                 G   Entrance Atrium
"   It is a simple board upon which the city authorities place notices
in which to inform travellors of the laws of the city.  There are several
posters on the board, some old and yellow, though a new one is firmly posted.

2.name: The Pier
desc: "   You are at the end of one branch of the pier.  This is the terminal for
the ferries in Endar, the ferryman's guild rules state that all their
ferries must dock here.  There is a great energy about this place, people
from different regions disembarking either for a short stay or perhaps to
do business.  All the new arrivals are pointed towards a board, just outside
the ticketmaster's office.  Now and then you can hear good solid sea curses,
as sailors struggle to control unruly passengers and their more unruly
luggage.
"   It is a simple board upon which the City Authorities post notices to
inform travellers new to the city of the laws and regulations.  There are
several posters on the board, some old and yellowing, though a new one is
firmly posted to the board.
"   To all new visitors to our fair City
We wish to inform you that in Endar we do not accept or allow any
rowdy behaviour, that includes drunkedness, theft, or attacking our
fine citizens.  If any person, irrespective of class or race, is
found by one of our guards to be so engaged, punishment will be
delivered immediately, at the discretion of the guard in question,
usually death.  Their decisions will not be subject to appeal.
We hope you have a pleasant stay,
City Ruler,
Hy Dolcain

3.name: The Pier
desc: "   You are at the end of the pier, where it expands out to form a wharf
which extends along the harbour front, leading back towards the square.
The pier and wharf are crowded with stacks of chests and crates, waiting to
be moved further into the city, or onto the waiting ships.  Over the sounds
of the waves lapping against the wooden supports of the pier, you can hear
the sounds of a large number of people.  Every now and then you have to
jump out of the way as a burly sailor walks by, pushing you aside, or giving
you a leery grin.

4.name: The Wharf
desc: "   You are at the water's edge, just beside you the pier starts, with its
neverending bustle.  It is a little quiet here from the market place as
the townfolk know not to get in the way of the surly sailors.  There is a
signpost nearby indicating the main tourist attractions of this fair city.
A small poster nailed to the signpost flaps gently in the wind.
"   WANTED
Crystal Ring, will offer generous price
Contact me at ......
The rest has been torn off
"   North   Northern Sea Wall
South   Southren Sea Wall
East    Central Square
N.East  Tourist Office
S.East  Post Office

5.name: Wharf
desc: "   You are just at the edge of the market, looking out over the harbour.
Along the wharf's edge you can see fishermen fixing their nets, and cleaning
their lobster pots.  There is the gentle sound of the boats knocking against
the wooden pier with the waves.  The sailors look busy, it seems wise not
to bother them.

6.name: Harbour Market
desc: "   You are in the middle of the bustling market.   You can hear the merchant's
trolleys rattle as they cross the cobble stones, crying out their wares.  To
the centre of the market you can see an impressive statue of a dolphin, with
benches around it for people to take their rest.  Behind you there is a tavern
called the Dolphin's Inn with a sign swaying above the door with a picture
similar to that of the statue.
The pubs logo is painted on the sign, that of a dolphin and a young boy, with
a tankard of beer between the two.  Well painted, though now a little weather-
worn.

7.name: Harbour Market
desc: "   You are at the northeastern corner of the market, there is a little more
room here, as there are no merchants haggling nearby.  Beside you is the
Tourist Office, with a steady stream of people entering and leaving, clasping
cheap notes and maps of the region.

8.name: Harbour Market
desc: "   You are at the edge of the market square, where Market Street meets the
Square.  Looking around you can see a profusion of shops and merchants.  This
is obviously where most of the trading in the city takes place, and by the
looks of it, where most of the population can be found as well.

9.name: Harbour Market
desc: "   Here in a corner of the market, keeping out of the way, you look
closely at the crowds.  There are beggars a plenty, and successful ones too.
It seems as if they are being treated with more care than beggars deserve.
As always the merchants seem to be doing a roaring trade, roaring being an
apt description of their sales technique, but they too are very strongly
built and looking at the speed with which they catch the odd street urchin
trying to steal something from a stall, fast off the mark as well.
Looking around you can see inns, tourist offices, fish shops and to your
side a grocery shop.

10.name: Harbour Market
desc: "   You are in a busy market, the hustle and bustle is near deafening.  There
is a strong reeking smell of fresh fish from the shop behind you.  To the
north you can see a tall statue, and further beyond a pub that looks very
tempting, if only the smell of fish would ever leave, this would not be a bad
place to spend a few hours.

11.name: Centre of Market
desc: "   You are in the centre of Harbour Square.  This is where all the business
is carried out, and by the sounds of it payment in coin other than gold.  The
old women are haggling at the price of fish and the merchants at the cost
of the latest imported silks.  Now and then you see the odd group of road-
weary adventurers trudging through the crowds in their armor, or a lone
silent one slipping his way through.  All this is lost though in the milling
crowds.  In the centre stands a lone statue of a dolphin and boy,
a small plaque holds the tale.  A map of the town is embedded here.
This statue was erected in the reign of Hy Raerl and commemorates an ancient
promise between the dolphins and Endar, that no dolphin will be killed by
an Endarian in Endarian waters.  This treaty arose after a dolphin was seen
fighting off the sea-predators, saving Hy Raerl's son and then carrying the
young boy back to the Wharf.  Since then dolphins have been beloved of the
people of Endar
A Great Lighthouse   I  Merchants Quarter    a   Old Boatieh
B Mages Tower        J  Guilds Quarter        b   Harbour Inn
C City Gate          K  Central Square        c   Food Stores
D Sunken Ship        L  The Castle            d   Royal Inn
E Piers              M  Artisans Quarter      e   Bank of Endar
F Slums (beware)     N  Temple of Oneness     f   MerLuins Shop
G Harbour Market     O  Great Library         g   Last Chance Inn
H Dark Temples       P  Cathedral of Hope     h   Endarian Times

12.name: Wharf
desc: "   You are at the southwestern corner of the market, it is quieter here.  There
is a strong smell of fish from the fish shop and the leftovers from the gutted
fish.  A path leads south to the sea wall, it looks dark and slippery.

13.name: Harbour Road
desc: "   You are at one end of Harbour road, just as it meets Harbour Market.  There
is a great energy about the market, with its noise and constant movement.
To one side you can see the entrance to the Tourist Office, and towards the
other end of the street you can see the Square, with its bell-tower, and
paved surface.

14.name: Harbour Road
desc: "   You are on Harbour Road.  It stretches from the market to the Main Square.
It is a very busy road, with strangers fresh from the ships, citizens
returning with food for their families, or merchants, with their bodyguards,
laden with cash.  On either side of the road, you can see large residences,
some of which are occupied by the highest members of the nobility.

15.name: Harbour Road
desc: "   You are at the junction of Guild Row and Merchant's Row, looking down
the streets you can see a host of large buildings, with guards present to
prevent any trouble.  To the other end you can see the bright housings of
the merchants, jewellers, armourers, and many others.  There is a constant
presence of the Law here, for this is where most of the wealth of Endar is
generated.  There is a signpost here with directions.
"    North   -   Merchant's Row
South   -   Guild's Alley
East    -   Central Square
West    -   Harbour

16.name: Harbour Road
desc: "   You are at the one end of Harbour Road, at the entrance to the Square.
The standard of the road has improved over the rough cobbles that you can
see near the harbour.  Here the road is paved with smooth flagstones, a
great deal of money, time and effort went to pave this road and the Square
ahead.

17.name: Central Square
desc: "   You are at the Harbour Street entrance to Central Square, the square is
smoothly paved with large flagstones, though here and there you can spot one
that has cracked over the years.  In the centre of the square you can see a
large tower with fountains at its base, near the tower there is a signpost.
From here you can see the Royal Mile and Wall Street, as well as some of the
shops that are scattered around the square.  The square is not as busy as that
of the harbour that you can see behind you, but it is hectic enough.

18.name: Central Square
desc: "   You are in the middle of the Square.  The traffic is immense, there are
thousands of people passing by.  There are several fountains around the base
of the tower, with people sitting alongside the edge.  Standing near the
entrance of the tower, so as to avoid the worst of the crowd, you look around.
There is a signpost nearby, but one of the four directions seems
to have been broken off.  The clock tower rises out of the square, towering
over all the buildings in the city, except the castle to the north, and the
spires of the cathedral to the east.  It is amazing to just listen to the
people around you, you can hear accents from Pharsica to Glacia, Chressicaa
to the Spectral Isles, all bartering from the roving merchants that are the
lifeblood of Endar.  A large map of the town is embedded in a marble stone.
"   North - Castle
East  - Artisan's and Scholar's Quarters
West  - Harbour Square
A Great Lighthouse   I  Merchants Quarter    a   Old Boatieh
B Mages Tower        J  Guilds Quarter        b   Harbour Inn
C City Gate          K  Central Square        c   Food Stores
D Sunken Ship        L  The Castle            d   Royal Inn
E Piers              M  Artisans Quarter      e   Bank of Endar
F Slums (beware)     N  Temple of Oneness     f   MerLuins Shop
G Harbour Market     O  Great Library         g   Last Chance Inn
H Dark Temples       P  Cathedral of Hope     h   Endarian Times

19.name: Central Square
desc: "   You are at the Harbour Street entrance to Central Square, the square is
smoothly paved with large flagstones, though here and there you can spot one
that has cracked over the years.  In the centre of the square you can see a
large tower with fountains at its base, near the tower there is a signpost.
From here you can see the Royal Mile and Main Street, as well as some of the
shops that are scattered around the square.  Main Street leads away from the
square, it is less busy than the square but the people seem to be wealthier
than the average citizen.

20.name: Central Square
desc: "   You are in Central Square, the square at the centre of town, it is here
that all the important announcements are made.  Around the square you can
see many important buildings, the police headquarters, the bank, the Tower,
and most importantly of all the Royal Inn.  The Royal Inn is frequented by
the nobility of the town, and as such is a great place for gossip.

21.name: Central Square
desc: "   You are in Central Square, where the Royal Mile meets the Square.  Looking
towards the castle you can see a heavily fortified castle wall, with some very
powerful looking guards.  Every now and then a courier comes running from the
castle speeding to some unknown destination, the couriers running towards the
castle do so at a much more reserved pace.

22.name: Central Square
desc: "   You are outside the Endarian Police Headquarters.  There is a strong burly
guard positioned outside the main entrance, who is scanning, carefully, all
who enter the station.  The headquarters itself looks very much like an
ordinary police station, except that it seems to have a couple of extra
floors.  Looking elsewhere you can see the tower in the centre of the square,
with its signposts, and to the south you can make out a small park.  Beside
the police offices, there is a small non-descript building, with a sign posted
over the door reading, "High Court of Endar".

23.name: Central Square
desc: "   You are in Central Square, the square at the centre of town, it is here
that all the important announcements are made.  Around the square you can
see many important buildings, the police headquarters, the bank, the Tower,
and most importantly of all the Royal Inn.  Looking at the bank, you can see
several burly guards inside.  The Bank of Endar is quite successful, the
taxes levied by the city are quite mild, but the economic success of the
Lord's policies have ensured a roaring import export trade, and all the
business for banks that that entails.

24.name: Central Square
desc: "   You are near the southern entrance from Wall Street into the central
square of the city.  On one hand you can see the Central Bank of Endar, it
looks very wealthy and very secure, and considering the number of customers,
well frequented.  Upon the other side of Wall street you can see a small
park and just beyond that the offices of the Endarian Times.  Wall street
does not seem to be very busy, and looks quite gloomy further down the
street, but that is probably due to the towering seawall at the end of the
street.

25.name: Central Square
desc: "   You are in the southeastern corner of the Square.  On one side there is
a small park, which has an entrance for the public.  At the entrance is a
sign warning against loitering and littering.  Nearby are the offices of the
Endarian Times, the main newspaper in these islands.  Looking in through the
windows you can see the office at work, the reporters scribbling and todays
paper being compiled.  There is a list of new and old news stories posted on
a board, on display inside.

26.name: Along the Sea Front
desc: "   You are at the edge of the wharf, where the street has narrowed and the
buildings are storm beaten and weather worn.  All along the path you can see
lobster pots and old fishing nets piled in heaps, waiting repair.  Looking
towards the north wall the path narrows, ending at the wall.
A lobster pot, like a curved cone, made of twigs and rope.  It is encrusted
in salt, and looks worse for the wear.
The nets are heaped in piles, there are some tears in the net, must've have
been some strong fish in them there waters.

27.name: Along the Sea Front
desc: "   You are at the edge of the Wharf, the path is getting narrower here, and
it is beginning to look quite shabby.  Looking south you can make out the
market and to the north the sea wall.  Along the wharf you can see an old
fisherman repairing his nets, mumbling to himself, while chewing on his pipe.
You see an old man, wearing leather pants, and a woolen jumper, his face is
weathered and worn and looks like crinkled leather rather than skin.  All the
time he is chewing on his pipe which has gone out but he hasn't seemed to
notice.  As he's repairing the nets, all you can hear is him cursing those
damned fish for tearing his nets.

28.name: Along the Sea Front
desc: "   You are now halfway down the wharf's edge, the path is real slippery
now and you struggle to keep your step.  Every now and then a fresh wave rolls
up over the wharf's edge, keeping the path slick and slippery.

29.name: Along the Sea Front
desc: "   You are nearing the end of the wharf.  Up ahead you can see the where the
path meets the seawall, you can barely make out some stairs cut into the wall.
The path is getting increasingly slippery, as the wall throws its shadow onto
the path.  The houses are beginning to look distinctly rundown.

30.name: Beside the Sea Wall
desc: "   You are the base of the seawall.  Looking up you can see how it merges
with the cliffs that run along the north of the city.  There is water running
down the moss covered wall, masking the steps that you can now see.  Off to
one side you can see an old boatshed, the roof has caved in, and there is
no movement apparent.  It is dark and cold here.

31.name: Upon Sea Wall
desc: "   You are at the point upon the sea wall where the wall itself meets the
cliff face that bounds the northern half of the city.  From here you can see
how the wall stretches out across the bay, sweeping south to enclose the
water below.  Above you there is a trail across the top of the cliff face.

32.name: Upon Sea Wall
desc: "   You are upon the sea wall, just to the east you can see the stairs down
from the wall.  Straight below you can see an old boat shed, looking very
decrepit.  The path here looks well used, and friendly seagulls are every-
where.

33.name: Upon Sea Wall
desc: "   You are standing on top of the sea wall, a path leads both east and west.
Looking down you can see all the ships as they traverse the calm waters of
the bay, the ferries and the line of people at the ticketmaster's shop, the
fishermen and their nets, and the odd pleasure boat.

34.name: Upon Sea Wall
desc: "   You are standing on top of the sea wall, paths leads both east and west.
Looking out beyond the sea wall you can see the fierce waves of the ocean
crashing against the wall.

35.name: Upon Sea Wall
desc: "   You are standing on top of the sea wall.  Looking down you can see that
there is a door in the wall of the boatshed's waterside, leading to a calm
stretch of water in the bay.  The stretch which looks easily swimmable
leads to one of the sunken ships that you can see ahead of you.

36.name: Upon Sea Wall
desc: "   As you walk upon the sea wall, you can see down below some calm water
surrounding the few wrecks that have been gathered into the northern
corner of the bay, the ships in the bay seem to avoid this area of the
harbour for some reason.

37.name: Upon Sea Wall
desc: "   You are on top of the northern sea wall, there is a strong breeze here,
carrying a taste of salt and seaweed.  On the outer wall, the waves crash
against the rocks at the base of the wall, while inside the water is calm
as it laps against the large sunken ship below you.

38.name: Upon Sea Wall
desc: "   You are on top of the sea wall, the wind is stronger here.  Looking north
you can see how the island turns mountainous and there is a steep cliff face
north as far as the eye can see, the grey clifs of Endar.

39.name: Upon Sea Wall
desc: "   You are well out to sea now, the people on the harbour front are like
ants scurrying to and fro, the ships look toylike in the distance.  The
sounds of the sea reaches your ears as a booming sound, echoing up the sea
wall.

40.name: Upon Sea Wall
desc: "   From this point on the sea wall you can ascertain the name of the sunken
ship, The Fairy Wind.  It was a mighty ship, going by the size of the wreck.
You can see some sea animals resting on it, resting from the vagaries of the
sea.

41.name: Outer Sea Wall
desc: "   You are at the bend in the sea wall, it is here that the wall begins to
bend southward so as to enclose the bay in a protective embrace.  Looking
from here you can begin to see some detail in the lighthouse at the end
of the wall, it is made of the same stone as the wall, as indicated by the
grey colour, yet more finely finished, as if made separately from the wall
and merged later.

42.name: Outer Sea Wall
desc: "   You can look straight out over the ocean from this viewpoint.  The ocean
stretches as far as the eye can see, though you know that to the north lies
Chressport and Chressica, and a bit west of that Arandia and all its wonders.

43.name: Outer Sea Wall
desc: "   You are on top of the sea wall here, the path has got decidely less steady
as the path approaches the tower.  The loose stones crunch under your feet.
The wind is more powerful here, you can understand how few ships could reach
Endar with the help of magi.

44.name: Outer Sea Wall
desc: "   You are near the Lighthouse now, you can see a large oak door.  The
lighthouse is about three stories tall, with the top story being solely made
of glass.  It is from there that the beam of light travels, indicating the
way to the harbour for the ships.  The path is crumbling quickly in the
weather this far out on the wall, the wind is very strong and the waves
are throwing spray over the wall.

45.name: Outer Sea Wall
desc: "   You are at the entrance to the lighthouse, before you is a small stone
garden before the entrance.  The waves are quite fierce this far out from
the mainland.  The comfort of the tower looks appealing, as does a quick
walk back to the city.

46.name: Tower Garden
desc: "   You are in the garden in front of the tower.  It consists of carefully
arranged stones and raked gravel.  It reminds you of a twisting river among
rolling hills.  It is very well laid.  There is a small wall surrounding the
garden ensuring that the wind and waves do not disturb the stones.  There is
a path leading through the garden leading to a door that is shut.  The only
way out of the garden is back along the wall or through the door.

extra.desc: "   It is a low lying wall, made of brick, it is about two foot high.

47.name: Kitchen
desc: "   You on the bottom floor of the lighthouse.  Looking around, you can see
the heavy oak door leading out onto the seawall, and a tall spiralling
stairs up to the floor above.  You are obviously in the kitchen., as there is
a lovely smell of freshly baked bread and the scent of a warm oven in the
air.  There is a dresser in the corner filled with beautiful china and other
crockery.  Just beside the door there is a coat hanger, where visitors can
hang their jackets and leave their dirty boots, so as not to dirty this
spotlessly clean kitchen.
"   The dresser is made of polished oak, and contains at least two sets of
the finest china.  Each plate has been carefully painted and decorated.
Looking more closely, you can see how some of the plates hidden behind those
in front have been chipped a little, so these are carefully hidden.
"   You quickly pull you hand away as you touch the hot oven, it is a
traditional black cast iron oven, which just radiates heat, a welcome
warmth.

48.name: Living Room
desc: "   You are on the second floor of the lighthouse.  This is obviously the
main living room.  There are some comfy chairs here and a pile of books.
Looking at the books you can see them to be mainly stories about dragons and
knights in shining armour.  The books are in large print, obviously for the
children of the household.  You can hear some childrens' laughter echoing
down the stairwell.

49.name: Bedrooms
desc: "   You are on the third floor.  This level has been curtained off into two
sections.  On one side of the cloth curtain you can see two small beds,
neatly made, with feather pillows and heavy blankets.  On the other side
of the curtain you can see a large king-sized double bed.  This is the
height of luxury, being able to separate the children from the parents view
at night.  By the large bed there is a ladder leading up to the upper floor.

50.name: Top of Lighthouse
desc: "   You are on the top floor.  You are in the open air, a strong wind is
blowing from the sea.  In the centre of the room, there is a glass sphere,
with a fiercely glowing fire.  Rotating slowly around the sphere is a metal
cylinder, with slots to let the light through.  As the slots pass you by,
an immense beam of focused light shoots across the sky, signalling to all
visitors.  Looking around you can see the harbour below and the city just
beyond.  Out further, you can see the mountains to the north and east, with
a smoking volcano in the distance.  Apart from the mountains you can see
immense forests covering the rest of the island.  Far off to the south and
east, you can see the outlines of the islands of Thelsha and Mythra, which
together with Endar form Hyberia.
"   The lighthouse is powered by a magical sphere.  It seems to have no
source of power but emitts an immensely bright light.  The light is
blocked from view by the metal cylinder around it.  The cylinder slowly
rotates, and the gaps in the metal let the light beam out, over the city
and the sea beyond, a marvel of engineering and magic.

51.name: Along the Sea Front
desc: "   You are on the slippery cobbled path along the harbour front.  Looking
out into the harbour you see the great harbour walls sweeping out, enclosing
a massive bay teeming with ships and boats.  Rumor has it that even the ships
from elvenhome dock here.  Looking at the sea walls you can see the fabled
lighthouse and Mage's Tower, awe inspiring in their construction.  A light
still shines from the Lighthouse on dark nights, and though the sea-calming
wizardry is no longer conducted from the tower, many swear to have seen a
blue glow about it when the moon is full.

52.name: Along the Sea Front
desc: "   You are on the seafront path between the market and southern sea wall.
It is damp and slippery here.  The sailors do not seem to dock their boats
on this side of the harbour as often as they would the other for some reason,
superstition most likely.

53.name: Along the Sea Front
desc: "   You are at the base of the southern sea wall.  There are stairs cut into
the wall here, strangely they are clean and well kept.  There is a gutter
running along the base of the wall, discharging into the bay.  It looks
disgusting.
"  It is a slimy, moldy gutter, the rainwater from the town flows downhill to
this gutter, and is captured by the wall and drains from the wall down to the
sea.  Looking seaward you can see the putrid water pouring into the sea.  You
notice that just as the water leaves the gutter, it clears.  Obviously some
magical ward cleans the water.  Truly a work from the olden days of glory

54.name: Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are the at the end of the walkable part of the Southern Sea wall,
from here you can walk out to the Mage's Tower.  There is a strong wind
blowing in from the sea.  The seawall is massively high, and there is an iron
railing along the outside to ensure that you don't fall from the wall.
"   The railing is very rusty and in parts it has worn away to almost nothing,
but it does give some comfort while walking along the wall.

55.name: Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You're atop of the southern sea wall.  The path on which you are walking is
smooth and well maintained, it is easy to make quick progress.  Looking
carefully over the edge you can see the mighty waves of the ocean smashing
themselves against the rocks at the base of the sea wall, the spray reaching
almost to the top of the wall itself.

56.name: Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are on top of the Southern Sea wall.  You can see that the path is
gradually deteriorating as the sea wall extends further out to sea.  There
is a slight covering of salt mixed with seaweed on the path.  It makes a
crunching sound as you step on it.  Now and then you see bird droppings.
They are getting larger, and those seagulls that are circling look ominously
big for normal birds.
"   The path is made of paved stones neatly laid.  There is a groove worn into
the centre of them from long usage, strange the seaweed and salt do not seem
to gather in the groove.
"   The seagulls look like ordinary seagulls but appear to be huge.  Now and
then you see one dive into the ocean and grab a large fish.  Watching one
land you can see that they next in cracks on the outer edge of the sea wall.

57.name: Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are halfway along the sea wall, there is now a strong wind blowing
from the sea.  The cries of the seagulls are piercing, they are everywhere.
The railing is looking rustier and rustier, and in parts looks almost as if
it is ready to break.
"   The railing is very rusty and you can pick of the layers of rust with your
fingernail.  Not safe to rely on anymore for protection

58.name: Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are close enough to the Tower to be able to make out features while
still being able to see its entire height and breadth in one view.  The
seagulls have begun to land on the wall itself and any movement will be
through them.  The wind is picking up, and it is definitely getting colder.
"   The railing has totally rusted away here, and there is a crack, a very
small one in the side of the wall.
"   The railing has totally rusted away here, and there is a crack, very small
one in the side of the wall.

59.name: Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are on the sea wall, close to the Mage's Tower.  It is very cold.
The wind is now literally howling around the tower.  The seagulls are looking
especially nasty now, there is that gleam in their eye.  Some have taken to
landing on the sea wall itself and to move you'll have to move through them.

60.name: Tower Door
desc: "   You are at the door to the Tower.  The wind is vicious, with its freezing
cold you are shivering to your very bones.  The knocker on the door has a
sneering look as if it knows of your discomfort.  The seagulls are getting
very nervous, they are biting at each other, screeching, biting.  The tower
soars above you, there appears to be a light in one of the upper rooms for
a moment, but then it is gone.
"   The writing is in some elven-like script, nearly illegible in the light.
It seems to have been engraved with silver.
"   The door is off solid oak, with brass fittings.  It gives the impression
of strength.  There is a knocker there with the face of a sneering gargoyle.
Apart from that there is no other decoration, apart from some faint writing
along the arch.

61.name: Mages' Tower
desc: "   You are on the ground floor of the tower.  There is a spiralling stair-
case leading upwards.  The door is rattling on its hinges as the fierce
winds lash the tower.  The room is cold and dark.  It is roughly circular in
shape, with a door at one side and a stairwell.  There are no furnishings
or lights or anything.  You can hear some noise coming from above.

62.name: Mages' Tower
desc: "   You are on the second floor of the tower.  You can see some comfortable
chairs and a large oak table.  Sitting on the table is a small bottle of
wine, empty.  In one wall of this round room you can see a small fire
crackling in the grate.  It radiates a lovely warm glow, filling the room
with a flickering yellow light.
"   It is a bottle of red wine, an expensive brand going by the quality
of glass and the fancy printing on the label.  Unfortunately as your
first glance suggested, the bottle is empty.

63.name: Mages' Tower
desc: "   You are in a very tall room.  You can see lots of magical equipment.  There
are several magicians busily examining one of the crystals that lie on the
table.  They notice your arrival but wave you away.  Taking a brief glance
at the room, you can see that a narrow ledge leads out over the sea.  There
seems to be some activity on the ledge.  Every so often one of the magicians
leaves the room with a prepared crystal, and return from the edge with a much
duller replacement, and the fevered activity starts all over again.
"   The crystals are in the shape of a cone, they form the core of the
focusing device use by the sea magi to control the weather about Endar.
The table contains several of these cones.  All but one seem to be dull and
empty, but the one being prepared by the magicians is glowing ever brighter
charging itself with pure magic.

64.name: On a ledge leading from the tower
desc: "   You are out on the ledge.  In front of you, you can see a large machine.
It seems to have no moving parts, but you can spot several of the focusing
cones, all pointing towards the centre of the machine.  Looking more closely,
you can see that in the centre there is a perfect sphere of mythran crystal
with platinum girding.  The constant murmuring of the magicians guide the
beams from the cone to form a visible wave of dark purple light radiating
from the sphere.  The light quickly vanishes into the distance, but the
sense of power remains.  The only question is, where does all this power
come from?  Suddenly you are pushed aside as a magician removes a now dull
cone and replaces it with one newly charged.

extra.desc: "   You fool!!!, you just fallen off the edge of the ledge!!!!

65.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are at the base of the seawall, it towers for hundreds of feet above you.
At the base there is a foul smelling gutter running seaward.  There are
beggars everywhere, some comatose against the wall, the gutter water flowing
around them as they grasp a bottle close to them, others more sober though
not from a desire to be, looking closely at you, calculating how many bottles
they could trade your armour for.  The walls seem littered with graffiti
here, some very colourful.

extra.desc: "   The Darkness likes the taste of blood!

66.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   Underneath the great seawall, the beggars seem to accumulate like flies.
At points there are so many that you have to pick your way through their prone
bodies.  Some of them are more watchful, and are keeping a close eye on your
every movement.  The light in the alley is very poor, limiting visibility to
only a few yards.
"   Not all beggars are harmless,
Not all drunks are drunk,
Not all thieves come dressed in black
Beware the cynic's path is best!

67.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are at the junction of a small alley and the lane.  The alley seems
real dark and foreboding, and none of the beggars seem to take more than a
few steps in.  There is a kind of quietness here, the drunks snore that bit
quieter, the rest speak in whispers, leaving only the gutters gurgling to
provide background noise.

68.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are walking along the alley that runs along the base of the southern
sea wall.  The wall looms overhead.  The cobbled path is difficult to walk on
as the dampness and darkness encourages the growth of slimy molds on the
stones.

extra.desc: "   Crystal Dust makes the girls go wild

69.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are on the path at the base of the sea wall.  There are beggars every-
where, drinking, some singing, some trying to steal the last sip out of their
neighbour's bottle.  Some even have the energy to beg for money.  The smell
is terrible here.

extra.desc: "   Find a crack in the wall, and upon there, there looks the king himself

70.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are on the path that trails along the base of the sea wall.  The
gutter gurgles slowly down to the sea.  Some of it gets diverted into a
little crack in the sea wall.  The beggars here seem slightly stronger, it
must be a more lucrative location.  The drunks are definitely more drunk,
their bottles must at least be half full.

extra.desc: "   Fiachra loves Riellan

desc: "   It is a tiny crack that leads along the base of the wall, poking in it,
you notice it only goes in an inch or two before ending a few yards away.

71.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are walking along the base of the southern sea wall, the smell from
the gutter is overpowering.  There seems to be a heavy congregation of
beggars here, fortunately most of comatose from a sucessful day of begging's
reward.

extra.desc: "   A bottle in the hand is worth two in the store
"   There is graffiti written on the wall.

72.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are at the junction of Wall Street and the path that runs along the
base of the sea wall itself.  It is brighter here than the path on either
side and cleaner too.  Looking up wall street you can see how the houses
improve the further away from the wall you get.  Looking along the paths
to the east and west, all you can see are rotting remains, a gutter and
beggars.

extra.desc: "    The wall has been scrubbed clean.

73.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are walking along the base of the sea wall.  It is quite damp here
and the gutter gurgles merrily down towards the bay.  The wall makes it dark
here, and you have to pick your steps between the sleeping beggars.

extra.desc: "   Horlock waz 'ere

74.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are standing at the base of the Southern sea wall.  It is not too
damp here, the gutter is petering out as you look from the bayward side.
Looking north you can see the outline of the Cathedral of Hope, quite a
big building really.  Looking east you can see that the number of beggars
dramatically lessens.

75.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   Above you towards the sea wall.  The wall is covered in moss and slime.
It is quite dark and cold here, the alley is hidden from the sun by the tall
buildings and the wall.  To the north you can see Hope Cathedral and the City
Library.

76.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are standing at the base of the sea wall.  Looking east you can just
make out the Eastern City wall.  The laneway is beginning to brighten up
and there are definitely less beggars to be seen.  The graffiti seems to
have totally disappeared off the walls, unlike the walls to the west.

77.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are standing near the eastern end of the lane at the base of the sea
wall.  The lane stretches as far as the eye can see westward.  Looking east
you can see that the lane turns a corner and continues along the city wall.
You can also see some stairs at the junction.

78.name: Alongside the Southern Sea Wall
desc: "   You are at the junction of the sea wall lane and the inner wall walk.  The
lane stretches westward as far as the eye can see.  The walk leads up towards
the city gate.  Straining your eyes you can make out an inn sign.  There are
stairs behind you leading up to the top of the city's fortifications.  They
are simple steps cut into the sea wall.  There is a plaque near the steps.
"   These walls were erected in the era of Hy Gaelen, they have never been
used in anger against our friends outside, though they do provide a wind-
break against the strong eastern winds.
Endarian Tourist Board

79.name: Upon the City Wall
desc: "   You are at the end of the wall that bounds the city on the east.
There are stairs here that let you get back down into the city.
Looking north the wall stretches to the northern mountains, looking
out over the wall, you can see some of the houses that have
built up outside the city, as the area within the walls grew too
crowded, the extra houses stretch for miles.  Further east you can
see the large shipyards which build the great ships and ferries that
travel between the islands of Hyberia.  It is a hive of activity.

80.name: Upon the City Wall
desc: "   You are on the wall that bounds the city on the east.  Looking
back over the city you can see the city in its entirety, the bay
in the distance, the tower and castle in the centre of the city,
the cathedral and city library, with odd splash of green from the
few parks.  You can also see the poor and rich sections of the city.
Looking east, over the wall, you can see some of the houses that have
built up outside the city, as the area within the walls grew too
crowded, the extra houses stretch for miles.  Further east you can
see the large shipyards which build the great ships and ferries that
travel between the islands of Hyberia, and with the other continents
as well.  It is a hive of activity and a source of great wealth for
the city and those who work there.  Further south the forests, which
provide the wood for the shipyards, reign supreme.

81.name: Upon the City Wall
desc: "   You are on the wall that bounds the city on the east.  Looking
back over the city you can see the city in its entirety, the bay
in the distance, the tower and castle in the centre of the city,
the cathedral and city library, with odd splashes of green from the
few parks.  You can also see the poor and rich sections of the city.
Looking east, over the wall, you can see some of the houses that have
built up outside the city, as the area within the walls grew too
crowded, the extra houses stretch for miles.  Further east you can
see the large shipyards which build the great ships and ferries that
travel between the islands of Hyberia, and with the other continents
as well.  It is a hive of activity and a source of great wealth for
the city and those who work there.  Further south the forests, which
provide the wood for the shipyards, reign supreme.

desc: "   You are on the wall that bounds the city on the east.  Looking

the city and those who work there.  Further south the forests, which

as well.  It is a hive of activity and a source of great wealth for
the city and those who work there.  Further south the forests, which
provide the wood for the shipyards, reign supreme.

84.name: Above the City Gate
desc: "   You are standing above the city gate, the gate is closable in case
of trouble, you can see the mighty gears and cables that currently
hold the gate open, you can see from here that the gate is balanced
perfectly, a single person could close this gate, and once locked, a
horde would not be able to reopen it.

85.name: Upon the City Wall
desc: "   You are on the wall that bounds the city on the east.  Looking
back over the city you can see the city in its entirety, the bay
in the distance, the tower and castle in the centre of the city,
the cathedral and city library, with odd splashes of green from the
few parks.  You can also see the poor and rich sections of the city.
Looking east, over the wall, you can see some of the houses that have
built up outside the city, as the area within the walls grew too
crowded, the extra houses stretch for miles.  Further east you can
see the forests of the southern reaches of the island, the mountains
to the north, and stretching south along the east coast.  In the far
distance you can see the smoking remnants of a once active volcano.

86.name: Upon the City Wall
desc: "   You are on the wall that bounds the city on the east.  Looking
back over the city you can see the city in its entirety, the bay
in the distance, the tower and castle in the centre of the city,

desc: "   You are on the wall that bounds the city on the east.  Looking
back over the city you can see the city in its entirety, the bay
in the distance, the tower and castle in the centre of the city,
the cathedral and city library, with odd splashes of green from the
few parks.  You can also see the poor and rich sections of the city.
Looking east, over the wall, you can see some of the houses that have
built up outside the city, as the area within the walls grew too
crowded, the extra houses stretch for miles.  Further east you can
see the forests of the southern reaches of the island, the mountains
to the north, and stretching south along the east coast.  In the far
distance you can see the smoking remnants of a once active volcano.

90.name: Upon the City Wall
desc: "   You are at the end of the wall that bounds the city on the east.
You can climb up the rocks here to get to the cliff path that bounds
the city on the northern half, and that keeps the fierce winds away.
Looking south the wall stretches to the sea and far beyond to where
the island bends back again, in a crescent shape.  Looking out over
the wall, you can see some of the houses that have built up outside
the city, as the area within the walls grew too crowded, the extra
houses stretch for miles.

91.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are at the northernmost edge of the city wall.  From here you can
see all the city, with its spired and straight streets.  There is a trail
leading along the north boundary of the city, and more trails leading into
the mountains above you.  Below you the city wall lies, there is a short
but steep climb down, enabling you to walk along the top of the wall, with
the guards marching, guarding.  It is chilly up here.

92.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are nearing the eastern wall of the city.  Looking back you can see
the cliffpath disappearing into the horizon, leading into the sea, looking
around you can make out the park and the tall spires of the Cathedral, and
the tower in the centre of the city.  Looking north all that you can see are
mountains and more mountains, looking east reveals only trees as far as the
eye can see.  The trail leads east and then splits.

93.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are on the path at the top of the cliff face, looking north all you
can see are the mountainous hills that abound in the northern section of
the island.  Down below you can see the park, the Temple of Togetherness,
and the great Cathedral in the distance.  Looking west you can begin to make
out the details of the castle and its surroundings.  The trail eastward
carries along the cliff face and westward towards the sea.  The trail looks
stony and difficult to walk upon.

94.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are on the path at the top of the cliff face, looking north all you
can see are the mountainous hills that abound in the northern section of
the island.  Down below you can see the park, the Temple of Togetherness,
and the great Cathedral in the distance.  Looking west you can begin to make
out the details of the castle and its surroundings.  The trail eastward
carries along the cliff face and westward towards the sea.  The trail looks
stony and difficult to walk upon.

95.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are on the path at the top of the cliff face, looking north all you
can see are the mountainous hills that abound in the northern section of
the island.  Down below you can see the park, the Temple of Togetherness,
and the great Cathedral in the distance.  Looking west you can begin to make
out the details of the castle and its surroundings.  The trail eastward
carries along the cliff face and westward towards the sea.  The trail looks
stony and difficult to walk upon.

96.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are on the path at the top of the cliff face, looking north all you
can see are the mountainous hills that abound in the northern section of
the island.  Down below you can see the park, the Temple of Togetherness,
and the great Cathedral in the distance.  Looking west you can begin to make
out the details of the castle and its surroundings.  The trail eastward
carries along the cliff face and westward towards the harbour wall.
The trail looks stony and difficult to walk upon.

97.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are on the path at the top ofthe cliff face, looking north all you
can see are the mountainous hills that abound in the northern section of
the island.  Down below you can see the Castle in every detail.  It consists of
four large spires connected to a great hall, with a large wall surrounding it.
There are gardens out the back, and a large courtyard where there appear to be
sparring soldiers.  The front entrance is well guarded with what seems
to be a large number of guards, and by the looks of the clothes some mages as
well.  The entire castle is well fortified.  The trail eastward runs along
the cliff face and westward towards the harbour wall.  The trail looks stony
and difficult to walk upon.

98.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are on the path at the top of the cliff face, looking north all you
can see are the mountainous hills that abound in the northern section of
the island.  Down below you can see Castle in every detail.  It consists of
four large spires connect to a great hall, with a large wall surrounding it
There are gardens out the back, and a large courtyard where there appear to be
sparring soldiers.  The front entrance is well guarded with what seems
to be a large number of guards, and by the looks of the clothes some mages as
well.  The entire castle is well fortified.  The trail eastward carries along
the along the cliff face and westward towards the harbour wall.  The trail
looks stony and difficult to walk upon.

99.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are on the path at the top of the cliff face, looking north all you
can see are the mountainous hills that abound in the northern section of
the island.  Down below you can see the Castle in every detail.  It consists of
four large spires connect to a great hall, with a large wall surrounding it
There are gardens out the back, and a large courtyard where there appear to be
sparring soldiers.  The front entrance is well guarded with what seems
to be a large number of guards, and by the looks of the clothes some mages as
well.  The entire castle is well fortified.  The trail eastward carries along
the along the cliff face and westward towards the harbour wall.  The trail
looks stony and difficult to walk upon.

100.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are on the path at the top of the cliff face, looking north all you
can see are the mountainous hills that abound in the northern section of
the island.  Down below you can see Merchants Alley and just beyond that
Guilds Alley.  Looking east you can begin to make out the details of the
castle and its surroundings.  The trail eastward carries along the cliff face
and westward towards the harbour wall.  The trail looks stony and difficult to
walk upon.

101.name: Along a Shady Grove
desc: "   You are in the middle of a lovely shady grove of trees.  The trees
tower above you, beautifully manicured by nature into pillars of green
and silver.  Looking between the trees you can see outline of some large
houses.  It is around here that the rich live, out of the confines of the
city, where the air is clean and it is safe for their children to play.
Someone rumoured once to you that the Hy himself had a country home out
here, that would be a treasure to see.  A large ornate gate lies of to one side.

102.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are on the path at the top of the cliff face, looking north all you
can see are the mountainous hills that abound in the northern section of
the island.  Down below you can see the harbour front, the slums and ghettos,
the harbour market, with all its milling people.  The trail eastward carries
along the along the cliff face and westward towards the harbour wall.  The
trail looks stony and difficult to walk upon.

103.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are on the path at the top of the cliff face, looking north all you
can see are the mountainous hills that abound in the northern section of
the island.  Down below you can see the harbour front, the slums and ghettos,
the harbour market, with all its milling people.  The trail eastward carries
along the along the cliff face and westward towards the harbour wall.  The
trail looks stony and difficult to walk upon.

104.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are on the path at the top of the cliff face, looking north all you
can see are the mountainous hills that abound in the northern section of
the island.  Down below you can see the harbour front, the slums and ghettos,
the harbour market, with all its milling people.  The trail eastward carries
along the along the cliff face and westward towards the harbour wall.  The
trail looks stony and difficult to walk upon.

105.name: On the Cliff Path
desc: "   You are the edge of the cliffpath where the sea wall meets it just below.
Looking north all you can see are the mountainous hills that abound in the
northern section of the island.  Down below you can see the harbour front,
the slums and ghettos, the harbour market, with all its milling people.  The
trail eastward carries along the along the cliff face that forms the northern
boundary of the city.  The trail looks stony and difficult.  You cannot see
where the trail ends.

106.name: Royal Mile
desc: "   You are at the start of the Royal Mile, from here you can see all the
way up the road to the castle itself, while escaping from the hazards of
the crowds in the square itself.  The scent of cooking food tickles your
nose, the smell of freshly brew ale, and crushed hops mixes to produce an
intoxicating aroma.

107.name: Royal Mile
desc: "   You are halfway between the square and the castle.  There is heavy traffic
of rich merchants and angry tradesmen leading to and from the castle.  The
road is inaptly named the Royal Mile, as it less than half that distance in
length.  The noise of the square is muted at this distance and the scurrying
crowds reduced to ants about an anthill.

108.name: Royal Mile
desc: "   You are standing in front of the entrance to the Castle.  There is a
heavy guard presence at the gate.  There is a tall wall surrounding the
castle and this is the only known entrance, though rumour has it that there
is a secret escape route for the Hy and his family.  Looking back down the
street you can see the busy square, and at the edge of the square the famous
Royal Inn, known widely for its fine food and ale.  Over to the east, you
can see the training grounds for the general population, sheltering beneath
the walls of the castle.  The grounds are located behind the Ambassadorial
Halls out of general sight and sound.  It seems to be a popular place in
town.

109.name: Main Street
desc: "   You are walking down along Main Street.  To the west you can see a large
Square, it is seems to be very busy, with hundreds of people rushing every-
where.  The noise is slightly muted at this remove but in the square itself
you can imagine if being so much worse.  Looking eastward you see a long
road with a major junction just up ahead.  The people on this street seem to
be a mixture of old wealthy people, young scholars and some adventurers.

110.name: Main Street
desc: "   You are a major junction.  Roads lead in all four directions, the north
bound route seems to pass by a series of cafe's and restaurants, and some
very impressive buildings.  There is a beautiful smell of some freshly baked
pastries wafting along on the wind.  To the west, you can just make out the
outlines of a teeming mass of people in the central square, with the tall
spire of the Clock Tower standing high.  To the east, the road extends until
it reaches the citys eastern wall, which you can just barely make out.  The
road dipping under the wall, as you lose sight of it.  To the south, you
can spot the home of the scholastic achievements of Endar, the Cathedral,
The Library and the Hospital.  Words cannot describe these beautiful buildings, you must go and visit.
"   North - Artisans Quarter
South - Library and Hospital
East  - City Gate
West  - Central Square

111.name: Main Street
desc: "   You are walking down along Main Street.  To the west you can see a long
road with a major junction just up ahead.  The people on this street seem to
be a mixture of old wealthy people, young scholars and some adventurers.
Looking briefly around you can see the tall spire of the clock tower to the
west, the city wall to the east, the cathedral spires to the south, and most
importantly of all Gregi's Bakery right beside you.  More ominously there is
a police station on the other side of the road.  Just a little more to the
east you can make out the swinging creaking sign of the Last Chance Inn.

112.name: Main Street
desc: "   You are outside of the Last Chance Inn, there is a strange smell of horse
manure coming from somewhere nearby.  Looking east you can see the main
gate, leading out of the city, to the west there is a long road back into
the centre of the city.  The creaking of the inns sign reminds you of its
presence.  The Last Chance Inn is aptly named in two senses, one if every
where else bans you, this pub is your last chance, and if you are leaving
the city to explore the back roads of Endar, well its the last pub you'll
see before you leave civilisation.  Maybe a pint of ale would not be amiss.
Yes, a pint of orc ale, and some of Gregi's bread would be perfect,
you say, patting your always empty stomach.
LAST CHANCE INN it says in bold leathers, with a coat stand and a single
hat as the backdrop.  The sign is held up by two hooks, on a now rusty
pole, which creaks with every breeze.

113.name: Inside City Gate
desc: "   You are standing just before the city wall, you can see the great gate
that guards the entrance to the city.  There are small alleys leading
both north and south.  There seems to be a small group of people to the
south and another such group further north, and of course there are the
few drunks that can always be found around pubs.  You can see the remains
of a signpost, broken at the base.  There is a very strong smell of horse
manure, but then again Tiernans Stables are near hear, just to the north.
"   All you can see is the stump of a signpost, it has obviously never been
repaired.

114.name: The City Gate
desc: "   You are standing under the arch of the city gates.  The porticullus is
raised but the solid oaks doors of the gate are still shut against the
casual visitor.  There is a gatekeeper but he seems to be a little bit too
fond of the precious fluid, and is gentle snoring in a corner.  The gates
do not seem to be locked.  It is damp and chilly under this arch, and there
is a pungent smell, reminding you of other less savoury places.

115.name: Outside City Gate
desc: "   You are standing outside the city gate.  The gates are shut, keeping out
the strong wind of the plains from sweeping through the city.  The great
city wall stretches to the north and south.  Looking outward from the city
there lies the great plain, leading to the mountains and the forests to the
south of the island.  The road looks very dusty, making your mouth dry and
parched at the very thought of walking upon it.

116.name: Inner Wall Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the city wall, it overshadows you as it
towers over a hundred feet above you, looking north you can see
Main Street as it enters the gatehouse in the wall.  Looking south
all you can see are the two walls, the city and southern sea wall,
join in the far distance.  The houses look less expensive the further
away from Main Street you go.  It is damp and dirty along this path,
it smells as it several of the inn's customers used the shadow of the
wall for toiletry purposes.

117.name: Inner Wall Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the city wall, it overshadows you as it
towers over a hundred feet above you, looking north you can see
Main Street as it enters the gatehouse in the wall.  Looking south
all you can see are the two walls, the city and southern sea wall,
join in the far distance.  The houses look less expensive the further
away from Main Street you go.  It is damp and dirty along this path,
there is a foul smell permeating the air, a small open sewer gurgles
along the base of the wall.

118.name: Inner Wall Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the city wall, it overshadows you as it
towers over a hundred feet above you, looking north you can see
Main Street as it enters the gatehouse in the wall.  Looking south
all you can see are the two walls, the city and southern sea wall,
join in the far distance.  The houses look less expensive the further
away from Main Street you go.  It is damp and dirty along this path,
there is a foul smell permeating the air, a small open sewer gurgles
along the base of the wall.  There is a seedy looking entrance here.
There is a some soft music coming from it, and a warm smell.

119.name: Inner Wall Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the city wall, it overshadows you as it
towers over a hundred feet above you, looking north you can see
Main Street as it enters the gatehouse in the wall.  Looking south
all you can see are the two walls, the city and southern sea wall,
join in the far distance.  The houses look less expensive the further
away from Main Street you go.  It is damp and dirty along this path,
there is a foul smell permeating the air, a small open sewer gurgles
along the base of the wall.  You can see a small grating in the sewer
leading down into the wall, it looks very slimey, the sewer water
flows through it, with all the rubbish being blocked.  It is clearly
not cleaned very often.

120.name: Wall Street
desc: "   You are at the bottom of Wall street, near the junction of this street and
the small path that runs along the base of the southern sea wall.  Looking
north you can just make out the pennants of the castle flying over the castle
walls.  Before the castle lies the main square, in the centre of town, and
just a little bit up the street is the Cetral bank of Endar.  The houses
look less and less well maintained the closer you get to the sea wall.  You
can hear a gentle gurgling coming from near the wall.

121.name: Wall Street
desc: "   You are halway along Wall Street.  Just to the north you can see the
Central Bank, and on the other side of the road you can see a small park.
Through the railings you can see that the park is sculptured and very well
maintained.

122.name: Wall Street
desc: "   You are near the entrance from Wall Street into the central square of the
city.  On one hand you can see the Central Bank of Endar, it looks very
wealthy and very secure.  There does not appear to be any entrances to the
bank, for the public from this side.  On the other side is the park, which
has an entrance for the public, at the entrance there is a sign warning about
loitering and littering.
"     No Loitering or Littering Allowed in Endarian Parks
Endarian Park Authority.

123.name: Merchant's Row
desc: "   You are at the entrance to Merchant's Row, this is the street where all
the more expensive shops in the city are located.  There is quite a sizable
crowd of people here, all of a more richer class of people, if there dress
is anything to go by.

124.name: Merchant's Row
desc: "   The shops around here are boarded up, they seem firestained.  Strange
eyes seem to peek out through the gaps between the boards over the windows.
The shoppers seem to walk faster here, as if to avoid this area.

125.name: Merchant's Row
desc: "   You can see just a head a junction with a sign, there appears to be plenty
of open shops on the road just ahead.  A beggar is escorted away from the
area by a strong burly guard, obviously vagrants are not allowed in this
street.

126.name: Merchant's Row
desc: "   You are on Merchant's Row, there are plenty of shops here to choose from,
ranging from hardware stores to weaponshops, why right beside you there is a
jewellery shop and an armoury.  The prices in the jewellery shops are
exhorbitant but the necklaces and such like look fantastic.  You cannot see
into the armoury, the windows are darkened and barricaded tight.

127.name: Merchant's Row
desc: "   You are in the business heart of the city, Merchant's alley is literally
exploding with shops.  There is a steady trickle of people in and out of
these shops, carrying merchandise, and a smaller trickle of people delivering
the merchants money to the banks.  Just in front of you in the map shop,
recommended wide and far.  There is a sign here with all the shop times.
"       Armoury  :     9am - 6pm
Jewellery:     9am - 5pm
Map Shop :     9am - 5pm
Hardware :     9am - 6pm
Curio's  :     9am - noon and 6pm - 9pm

128.name: Merchant's Row
desc: "   You are at the eastern end of Merchant's Row.  It is substantially quieter
at this end of the street.  The only shops that seem to be open are a curio
shop and a hardware shop, almost nobody enters the curio shop, as testified
by the cobwebs in the windows and even in the doorway.  The hardware shop
seems to be much more busy.

129.name: Guild's Alley
desc: "   You are at the entrance to Guild Alley, it really isn't a street, more a
covered pavilion with the entrances to the various guilds off the main
corridor.  Looking up you can see the transparent gauze that keeps off the
rain and keeps the harshness of the sun at abeyance.  Symbols of the sun and
moon as weel as swords and arcane symbols are embroidered on the gauze.
To your side you can see a weapons shop, it is doing great business with the
frequent passage of adventurers, weary from practice or from the road.  On
the other side is a blacksmith who will repair any armor or weapons that
need repair.

130.name: Guild's Alley
desc: "   You are in the middle of Guild Alley, it is not crowded but those people
that are here have a sense of business and purpose about them.  From your
current point of view you can see a small dark alley leading to the secretive
guilds, such as for thieves and assasins, and to your left an arch leading to
guilds that excell in the scholastic, rightous ways, such as for scholars and
clerics.  Looking back up the street you can see the blacksmith and weapons
shop, several of the adventurers are getting new weapons after learning new
skills or are repairing old ones before entering the presence of their guild
masters.

131.name: Guild's Alley
desc: "   You are at the end of Guild Alley.  The street ends with the entrance to
the Guild of the Sword, the entrance is through an arch, emblazoned with a
sword and shield, with images depicting a knight fighting a dark dragon.
Just to the side, being discreet while still having an ornate entrance, is
the portal that leads to the Arcane Guilds, it is said that it is a brave
man who treads on the arcane paths that has not the talent.  The portal
is dark and undecorate yet seems to glow with a dark light.

132.name: Inner Wall Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the city wall, it overshadows you as it
towers over a hundred feet above you, looking south you can see
Main Street as it leaves through the city's gate.  You can easily
identify the shop as the city's stables, the smell of the horse
manure is quite potent.  The flies are boundless in this sector,
some of them being quite large.  Tiernan's horses are reputed to
be of the highest quality.

133.name: Inner Wall Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the city wall, it overshadows you as it
towers over a hundred feet above you, looking south you can see
Main Street as it leaves the walls gatehouse.  Looking south
all you can see are the two walls, the city and southern sea wall,
join in the far distance.  The houses look less expensive the further
away from Main Street you go.  It is clean and well kept, and the
houses though less expensive seem to be occupied by artisans and
other colourful folk who add a sparkle to the area.

134.name: Inner Wall Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the city wall, it overshadows you as it
towers over a hundred feet above you, looking south you can see
Main Street as it leaves the walls gatehouse.  Looking south
all you can see are the two walls, the city and southern sea wall,
join in the far distance.  The houses look less expensive the further
away from Main Street you go.  It is clean and well kept, and the
houses though less expensive seem to be occupied by artisans and
other colourful folk who add a sparkle to the area.

135.name: Inner Wall Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the city wall, it overshadows you as it
towers over a hundred feet above you, looking south you can see
Main Street as it leaves the walls gatehouse.  Looking south
all you can see are the two walls, the city and southern sea wall,
join in the far distance.  The houses look less expensive the further
away from Main Street you go.  It is clean and well kept, and the
houses though less expensive seem to be occupied by artisans and
other colourful folk who add a sparkle to the area.

136.name: Inner Wall Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the city wall, it overshadows you as it
towers over a hundred feet above you, looking south you can see
Main Street as it leaves the walls gatehouse.  Looking south
all you can see are the two walls, the city and southern sea wall,
join in the far distance.  The houses look less expensive the further
away from Main Street you go.  It is clean and well kept, and the
houses though less expensive seem to be occupied by artisans and
other colourful folk who add a sparkle to the area.

137.name: Inner Wall Walk
desc: "   You are at end of the lane, up above you, the city wall merges into the
sheer rock face.  You are quite close to the rockface itself, it is very
moist to the touch and gives a cool feel to the area.  Just to your left,
you can see the domes of the chapel of Oneness, there is a regular stream
of supplicants entering the chapel, though few seem particularly enlightened
as they leave.  To the south, you can see rows upon rows of houses, all
gaily decorated, as befits the artisans quarter.

138.name: Park Street
desc: "   You are just a few steps away from the city's eastern boundary.  On your
left hand side you can see the temple, it is simply decorated in ivory and
obsidian.  Despite being at such a remove from the centre of the city it seems
proper for it to be where it is, there is a rightness about its location and
there is a steady stream of supplicants who find its location not a problem.

139.name: Park Street
desc: "   You are on Park Street, just outside of the park, it is hard to see into
the park due to the tall trees that surround it on all sides.  The houses
here are tall and very well maintained, they are painted in many different
shades of pinks and blues, with even one garish green.

140.name: Park Street
desc: "   You are at the bend in Park Street, the road to the east runs along the
edge of the City Park, until it reaches the city's walls.  At the end of
the road you can see the dull domes of the temple, it is kept an immaculate
shade of gray, with obsidian and ivory decorations.  To the south your
nose tells you of Illiad's restuarant and the hairs on the back of your neck
tell you of MerLuin's magic shop.  The entrance to the park is on your left.

141.name: Park Street
desc: "   You are near the top of Park street, just north of here the street takes
a turn to the east.  From here you can see MerLuin's Magic shop, and also
Illiad's Journey.  There is a small pile of food outside MerLuin's place,
deposit by the employees of the restuarant, as if a peace offering to the
wizard, for any escape of magic from the shop would be sure to hit Illiad's
restuarant.  The restuarant is indoors and by the looks of it has a candles
on each table and a large roaring oak fire, the smell is delicious.
"   It is quite a large pile of food, you feel nervous about touching, as do
all the insects and small animals as they pass around it at quite a distance.
MerLuin may not eat the food but the food is obviously for anyone's taking.

142.name: Park Street
desc: "   You are halfway up Park Street.  Peering south you can make out the
junction of Park Street and Main Street, with the cafe and theatre just before
the junction.  Looking north you can see MerLuin's Magic Shop, and Illiad's
Journey Restuarant.  Just beside you, there is a small doorway leading into
one of the many small but beautifully maintained residences that line these
streets.  Straining your eyes, seeing far up the road, you detect some trees
and a bend in the road.

143.name: Park Street
desc: "   You are on Park Street, there is a large crowd of people drinking tea and
eating pastries in the cafe on your right.  There are clean white benches and
chairs to rest your limbs while you sup on some tea.  On your left, you can
see the Theatre of Performing Arts, the front is impressive, with its columns
and marble steps.

144.name: Park Street
desc: "   You are at the bottom of Park Street, one of the more lively areas in
Endar.  Looking north you can see the Endarian Theatre, some cafes and
restuarants.  Mixed between these are a few shops of a livelier nature.
Your nose informs you that there must be a bakery nearby as the sweet smell
of freshly baked bread tempts your tastebuds.

145.name: Scholar's Avenue
desc: "   You are the top of Scholars Avenue, it is on this road that all the work
of the scholars and clerics of the city is carried out.  From here you can
see the University, the famous Library, the Cathedral of Hope, and the
Hospital.  The Library and the Cathedral are immense soaring buildings, the
cathedral far exceeding the Library in beauty and height.  The Hospital is
a small squat building, with a very long front.  As for the university, it
has an impressive front but you cannot see anything behind the front.  The
street is quite busy, there is a constant stream of people to the hospital
and the cathedral.  You also note that there are a lot of foreigners
visiting the library.

146.name: Scholar's Avenue
desc: "   You are outside both the University and the Hospital.  There does not
seem to be anyone going into the University but there is a steady stream of
patients and visitors into the hospital.  The hospitals front is a simple
brick wall painted white.  There are plenty of windows, most of which have
potted plants along their sills.  The University has a very impressive
front.  It has a series of marble steps leading up to huge archway, with
great oak doors, currently open.  You now make out more details of the
cathedral, and its four towers and its great golden dome.

147.name: Scholar's Avenue
desc: "   You are outside of the Library and the Cathedral.  Now that you are up
close to the two of them, you are tempted to say that the Library is the
more magnificent building, with its great arches and delicate architecture.
The cathedral itself looks quite plain from this angle, but it was not the
view from this angle that the architect was considering, but the angle that
the Almighty would see from above, and that was of the sun glinting off the
golden dome, framed by two copper green spires at each of the corners of the
compass.  There is a sense of righteousness coming from both buildings, of
science and learning coupled with faith and good living.

148.name: A Dark Alley
desc: "   You are in a small dark alley, the buildings seem to fall in over the
road blocking out any light that may enter.  You notice that all the street
lights are broken here, this is truly a dark alley.  There are no beggars
here, and the rats tread very quietly across the road.  It is very quiet,
and cold too.  There is no longer any graffiti on the walls, they are bare
and barren.

149.name: A Dark Alley
desc: "   You are at the end of the dark alley.  It is very cold and if it could
be said darker than dark.  There is only one doorway that you can see that
is passable, all the rest are securely boarded up.  If seems that the door
is the source of the darkness.  There isn't a sound to be heard in the alley,
none of the habitual rats can be seen, nothing, all is silent.

150.name: Sewers
desc: "   You are in a smelly sewer.  There is a green slime oozing all over the
place.  Uhhhk, it smells!  You try to stand up, but whoops... you start
sliding in the ooze.  You try to climb back up the sewer towards the
street but you keeping sliding down.  Even though it is very dark you
can begin to see pairs of glowing red eyes, blinking, coming closer.

151.name: Sewers
desc: "   You are further down the slimey sewer.  You are growing weak with
the stench of the sewerage.  There is a constrant trickle of water
flowing down the pipe.  You know better than to try to stand up, the
ooze is everywhere.  You can sense that you are being watch, something
is causing shivers to run up your back.....

152.name: Sewers
desc: "   You are at the end of the tunnel. You can see the exit, or at least
you can see some light.  The tunnel is even bigger here, and the eyes
that have been watching you are even bigger.  You can see that some green
plants are beginning to grow at the end of the tunnel, the water flow is
even stronger here, washing all over your clothes, making you gasp as it
tries to drown you in sewerage.  Grasping the plants you manage to hold
your place against the flow.

153.name: A Dusty Road
desc: "   You are on a dry and dusty road.  To the south you can make a small
crossroads, and a little more to the east a small bridge.  The road seems
to be improving slightly, and looking ahead towards the north, you can
see the beginnings of a tree lined grove, framed by the snow covered
mountains to the north.  Looking west you can see the city walls, as they
stretch to the north and south.

154.name: The Beginnings of a Shady Grove
desc: "   You are on a dry hard-packed dirt road.  There are now plenty of trees
planted along the road sides.  Looking further north, you can see that this
grove extends quite a distance away from the road.  The trees block all
signs of the city from sight, and despite the city's closeness, the only
sound you can here is of a gurgling stream and the wind whistling through
the trees.

155.name: Along A Shady Grove
desc: "   You are in the middle of a lovely shady grove of trees.  The trees
tower above you, beautifully manicured by nature into pillars of green
and silver.  Looking between the trees you can see outline of some large
houses.  It is around here that the rich live, out of the confines of the
city, where the air is clean and it is safe for their children to play.
Also added to the fact that the houses can be bigger and better guarded
than at all possible in the city.  The roads here are paved, with large
flagstones, and in the distance you can actually see a peace guard
patrolling the grove.

156.name: Luella's Bordello
desc: "   You have entered Luella's Bordello.  It is obviously what some would call
a house of ill-repute.  There is a bar at one end of the room.  The barman
is disgustingly handsome, with just enough muscles flexing as he pours the
drink to hint at a finely tuned body, and considering the location, he
probably is skill in more than just bar-serving.  The room is decorated in a
rich red colour, with several lounge couches along the walls.  There are no
windows on any of the walls, but plenty of mirrors.  There are several
scantily clad women draped over some still clad men.  One of the free girls
wanders over to you, looks you over and smiles sultrily at you, hinting at
