exotic pleasures and some more banal ones as well.  You can smell the
narcotics in the air, drugs that heighten sensation and loosen your
inbitions.  Now and then you see some couples going off to a set of rooms
off to the back, with heavy curtains blocking the view.  You suspect you
know what is behind those curtains.

157.name: A Dark but Comfortable Room
desc: "   You find that all but one of the curtains are firmly fastened.  You can
here giggles coming from some of them.  Finding a curtain that is free, you
walk in to find a simple room, with only a large king sized double bed.  The
room is dark, with the only light coming from a small globe near the
entrance.  The floor is covered in a real thick red carpet, which is so
thick it is like walking on air. The bed has red silk sheets, and loads of
pillows.  Beside the bed there is a small ice bucket.  The bed looks
dishevelled and used, and the ice bucket only contains an empty bottle of
cheap wine.  While looking around, you are interrupted by Luella herself who
says "Sir, this room has just been recently vacated, I can direct you to
another room, while this one is being cleaned up." she smiles.

158.name: Rear of Keel
desc: "   You are in the drydock.  There are many ladders along the sides to enable
you to climb out whenever you wish.  Along the centre of the drydock is a huge
wooden beam, you are at one end of the beam.  There are several sections cut out
of the beam, going about six inches deep into the twenty four inch deep beam.
The cuts go straight across the beam, must be for the ribs of the ship.  There
is another cut at the end of the beam, going about twelve inches long the length
of the beam.  You have to be very careful, all these cuts make treacherous
walking.  Away from the keel you can see that the rest of the drydock is
actually a mixture of rocks and small ponds.

159.name: Front of Keel
desc: "   You are in the drydock.  There are many ladders along the sides to enable
you to climb out whenever you wish.  Along the centre of the drydock is a huge
wooden beam, you are at one end of the beam.  There are several sections cut out
of the beam, going about six inches deep into the twenty four inch deep beam.
The cuts go straight across the beam, must be for the ribs of the ship. You can
see that the end of the beam is being bent slightly through the use of weights.
This must be where the bow of the ship is formed.  Just beyond the front of the
ship is the sea gate.  Several small puddles have formed near the gate.  Testing
these pools, you estimate that they are several feet deep yet the pumps seem to
have everything under control.

160.name: Lumber Yard
desc: "   You are among the many piles of wood.  Some of the wood has been here for
years, slowly being seasoned.  The pile you are currently standing is under the
exit of one of the city's drains, a steady stream of foul smelling water flows
out, splashing all over the room, making the entire place very slippy.  There
are several small creatures living here, plenty of small lizards and frogs at
least.

161.name: Police Jail
desc: "   The guard on duty notices your entrance and immediately calls for help.
Quickly two burly officers push you into a cell.  The officer shouts in your
ear, "If you want to see our jails, stranger, have a closer look".
Looking at your cell from the inside you can see that is has all the
rudimentary requirements, a hole in the floor for sanitary purposes, and a
leaking, dripping, pipe for water.  Your only bed is a pile of straw in a
corner.  I suppose all you can do is wait.
"   It is a small lead pipe which drips water into the hole on the floor.
It is a slow drip but the water is clean and plentiful.
"   It is a small hole, about three inches wide, to small for even a pixie
to escape through.  The dripping water falls down the hole, resulting in
a deep hollow plop when it lands at the bottom.  Fortunately the cities
famous sewerage system extends even to its jails, and so at least it doesn't
smell badly.

162.name: Lumber Yard
desc: "   You are among the many piles of wood.  Some of the wood has been here for
years, slowly being seasoned.  There are several small creatures living here,
plenty of small lizards and frogs at least.  From this point you can look over
the entire yard.  You can count ten drydocks, two full of water, one with a
near completed ship, and all but two of the remainder having ships in some
state of construction.  The yard stretches further to the west but you cannot
see how you can get there.

163.name: Slipway No. 2
desc: "   You are at the bottom of the dry dock, the water level must be at least
thirty foot deep.  There are several large crabs and other sea creatures
scrambling among the bits and pieces left over by the exiting of the ship.  Here
and there you can seem some nails, lumps of wood and other items that must have
been dropped when the last ship was under construction.

164.name: Slipway No. 2
desc: "   You are at the bottom of the dry dock.  There are several large crabs and
other sea creatures scrambling among the bits and pieces left over by the
exiting of the ship.  Here and there you can seem some nails, lumps of wood and
other items that must have been dropped when the last ship was being built.  You
are at the gate now, it is currently closed but the pumps are not operating.
The gate is totally encrusted with seashells and barnacles.

165.name: The Bending Room
desc: "   You are in a large shed.  The purpose of the machinery is obvious.  It's to
bend the large wooden beams into the correct curvature required for the ribs of
the ship.  Currently there is a large beam undergoing bending.  It is about
thirty feet in length and about one foot square.  The wood hasn't been seasoned,
as seasoned wood would crack.  The machine has been well designed so that if the
beam cracked, the machine collapses like a book, but the spine of the book moves
away from you.  Looking at the oft-repaired wall behind the beam it is obvious
that this is an important design consideration.
"   The beam is being held by ten adjustable clamps, that are bolted tightly
to movable boards, the boards have a marker, and these clamps are gradually
pushed into the right positions in order to get the right curvature.  The
boards are moved by immense pulleys and held in position by pins as thick as
an orc's wrist.

166.name: Beside the Lumber Yard
desc: "   You are between one of the drydocks and the large lumberyard.  There are
piles upon piles of wood, both cut and uncut, stacked in triangular piles.
Some of the wood has been here so long that small bushes and grass have sprouted
between them.  To the other side you can see into the drydock.  The keel has
been laid and the ribs and support beams have been put in place.  The ship is
quite long, narrow and tall.  It doesn't seem to have the bulk required for a
cargo ship, probably going to be commissioned as a warship for some cities navy.
You can see lanterns hung all over the ship, constantly alight as it is dark
down in the drydock.  To the north you can see a small shed, surrounded by large
machines and immense pulleys.

167.name: On a Gravel Path
desc: "   You are between two drydocks.  Looking quickly into one of the drydocks, you
see that it is not very dry, the sea has been allowed in. On the other side of
this small gravel path you can peer into one of the drydocks currently in use.
You can see the outlines of a ship under construction.  It seems to be quite
a large ship, easily three hundred feet in length, and from the height of the ribs you suspect that it will more likely be a warship rather than cargo.  The
path leads of down to the sea locks that control the drydocks.  The smell
of the sea spray is very strong, as is the smell of rotting seaweed.  In the other direction you can see large piles of wood and some large machines.

168.name: Upon the Sea Wall
desc: "   You are at the edge of the yard, upon a small sea wall between two sea locks.
One of the drydocks looks recently vacated, half-filled with water, whereas in
the other you can see a large ship under construction.  Looking over the side of
the wall you can see the waves lapping gently against the edge of the wall.
Pacing the wall, you ascertain that the wall at the top is at least five yards
across, and greater than that at sea level as the wall narrows towards the top.
There are some markings on the outside of the wall, indicating the depth, the
water is level is currently at fifteen fathoms, sufficient for the largest of
ships.

169.name: Upon a Sea Lock
desc: "   You are standing upon a sea lock.  The gates huge pulleys tower over you,
their cables thicker than you arm.  It is the purpose of this gate to keep the
water out of the drydock while the ship is been worked upon.  Peering over the
seaward side of the gate you can see the water level only a few feet down, but
in the drydock side, the floor level is at least thirty feet down, and still
parts of the ship towers over the sides.  You can see that the gate isn't
perfect as the drydock is not very dry, put you can see that the pumps have the
situation well in control.
"   The sea lock is simply a large gate, similar to those used in canals.  It
consists of immense planks of oak, several planks thick.  There are huge pulleys
for lifting the gate in and out of place, but you can see a smaller gate built
near the top of the larger gate, which will allow the water in at a controlled
rate.

170.name: Upon the Sea Wall
desc: "   You are at the edge of the yard, upon a small sea wall.  The canteen building
is to one side and the sea lock for the drydock is to the other.  Looking over
the side of the wall you can see the waves lapping gently against the edge of
the wall.  Pacing the wall, you ascertain that the wall at the top is at least
five yards across, and greater than that at sea level as the wall narrows
towards the top.  There are some markings on the outside of the wall, indicating
the depth, the water level is currently at fifteen fathoms, sufficient for
the largest of ships.

171.name: On a Gravel Path
desc: "   You are outside the yard's canteen.  There is a strong smell of tea and fresh
bread wafting out the door.  It mixes strangely with the smells of the sea.  On
the other side of this small gravel path you can peer into one of the drydocks
currently in use.  You can see the outlines of a ship under construction.  It
seems to be quite a large ship, easily three hundred feet in length, and from
the height of the ribs you suspect that it will more likely be a warship rather
that cargo.  The path leads of down to the sea locks that control the drydocks.
The smell of the sea spray is very strong, as is the smell of rotting seaweed.

172.name: On a Gravel Path
desc: "    You are beside the entrance to the yards and one of the drydocks.  From this
vantage point you can view the work in progress on the ship below.  The keel has
been laid and the ribs and support beams have been put in place.  The ship is
quite long, narrow and tall.  It doesn't seem to have the bulk required for a
cargo ship.  You can see lanterns hung all over the ship, constantly alight as
it is dark down in the drydock.

173.name: On a Gravel Path
desc: "   You are outside the main offices of the shipyard.  The offices form a small
building in comparison to the rest of the yard.  On the other side of this small
gravel path you can peer into one of the drydocks currently in use.  You can see
the outlines of a ship under construction.  It seems to be quite a large ship,
easily three hundred feet in length, and from the height of the ribs you suspect
that it will more likely be a warship rather than cargo.  The path comes to an
end here, there is a large closely weaved wicket fence here.

174.name: Site Office
desc: "   You are in the shipyard's main office.  The desk is currently unoccupied,
but you can see from the numerous papers on the desk that the yard is extremely
busy.  There is a chart on the wall identifying the main steps in constructing
a ship.  The office is very draughty and the scent of the sea permeates through
the walls.  There is another exit at the back of the room, a door with a large
sheet of frosted glass.  There seem to be some figures moving in the backroom
but the door is firmly locked.
"   Ten Steps to Building a Quality Assured Ship.
1.   Confirm order TWICE with buyer.
2.   Identify suitable lumber for type of ship.
3.   Place green lumber in bending arms.
4.   Lay keel in drydock.
5.   Use bent lumber to produce backbone.
6.   Layer seasoned oak upon backbone, the bottom of each
plank inside the top of the plank below.
7.   Install the inner decks.
8.   Launch Ship.
9.   Outfit ship, as per customer requirements.
10.   Collect payment UPON delivery.
"   You enter a smokey room, you see two men crouched over a table, they see
you and immediately yell at you to leave.  One of them reaches for his sword
to make you leave, you turn and leave before it gets message, the door slams
shut after you

175.name: Endarian Shipyards
desc: "   You are at the entrance to the shipyard.  A big wooden banner hangs over the
entrance, with ENDARIAN YARDS embossed in big red letters.  The road has turned
to a gravel path, with buildings to either side of the entrance.  Looking into
the yards you can make out the bones of a ship, still under construction.  There
are a lot of workers clambering all over the ship.  In the far distance you can
see the tall walls of the city.

176.name: Site Canteen
desc: "   You are in the canteen, the shutters have been pulled down over the serving
hatch, obviously nothing is available.  It is quite a large canteen, capable of
seating over a hundred men.  Everything is clean and smelling slightly of
disinfectant.  All the tables are at the end of the room, this section has been
left clear for serving purposes.

177.name: Site Canteen
desc: "   You are amongst the tables in the canteen. Everything is clean and smelling
slightly of disinfectant.  You were once told that every work canteen looks
exactly the same, and it is true, the same near-indestructible chairs and
tables, the absolute lack of taste in decoration, if any decoration.  The only
thing that differentiates canteens is the graffiti often written on the tables.
"   Ten Steps to Building a Quality Assured Ship.
1.   Make sure someone wants to buy the ship.
2.   Find the cheapest wood and charge for the most expensive.
3.   Place green lumber in bending arms, and hope you don't get killed.
4.   Use bent lumber to produce backbone, and break your own back.
5.   Layer seasoned oak upon backbone,
6.   Put the floors in, or else what use is it?
7.   Launch Ship, and hope it doesn't sink.
8.   Outfit ship, as per customer requirements, and your price tag.
9.   Deliver ship to customer, with an escort to protect from pirates.
10.   Collect payment UPON delivery, with escort to ensure payment.

178.name: Outside the Jail Cell
desc: "   The jailer grabs you by the arm and pulls you out roughly.  He warns
you to mind your own business in future, and pushes you out onto the street.

179.name: Centre of Keel
desc: "   You are in the drydock.  There are many ladders along the sides to enable
you to climb out whenever you wish.  Along the centre of the drydock is a huge
wooden beam, you are at the centre of the beam.  There are several sections cut
out of the beam, going about six inches deep into the twenty four inch thick
beam. The cuts go straight across the beam, must be for the ribs of the ship.
There is a large circular hole cut deep into the beam, over half as wide as
the beam itself.  You have to be very careful, all these cuts make treacherous
walking.  Away from the keel you can see that the rest of the drydock is
actually not very dry, being a mixture of rocks and small ponds.

180.name: A Dusty Road
desc: "   You are on a dry and dusty road.  A short distance to the west you can
see the city gates, and as far north and south as you can see, the great
city walls.  To the south, you can see the see on the horizon, and to the
north the great western range, that runs from the northernmost tip of the
island to the southernmost frames the city's spires.  The road looks well
travelled and a little further west you can see a junction.

181.name: A Dusty Road
desc: "   You are on a dry and dusty road.  A short distance to the west you can
see the city gates, and as far north and south as you can see, the great
city walls.  To the south, you can see the see on the horizon, and to the
north the great western range, that runs from the northernmost tip of the
island to the southernmost frames the city's spires.  The road looks well
travelled and a little further west you can see a junction.  The road
breaks to the south, with a less travelled road leading further west.  To
the southwest all that there is to be seen are the great forests that
provide lumber for the Endarian shipwrights.

182.name: A Dusty Road
desc: "   You are at a junction, there is a signpost here, but it does not look
in very good condition.  Looking at all the exits from this junction, you
can see the city to the west, what looks like the shipyards to the south,
and the eastern road winds it way southward, into the forests.
"   North  -  Some Private Residences
South  -  Shipyards and Beach
East   -  Great Forests and Lumberyard
West   -  The City

183.name: A Bridge over Rushing Waters
desc: "   You are on a dusty road, to the west you can see a junction, and beyond
that on the horizon, the City.  The road is not very well travelled and
there is more grass than road in parts.  The road wends its way in a
south-easterly direction, losing itself in the forest.  There is a small
bridge here, with a fast flowing stream rushing underneath it.  The river
is deep and cold, originating high up in the mountains.

184.name: A Dusty Road
desc: "   You are nearing the great forests.  The road passes some old tree
cuttings, but they are near indistinguishable from the forest itself
except for some piles of logs.  The forest exudes a vibrancy that makes
it seem more alive, active than it should be.

185.name: A Dusty Road
desc: "   You are nearing the great forests.  The road passes some old tree
cuttings, but they are near indistinguishable from the forest itself
except for some piles of logs.  The forest exudes a vibrancy that makes
it seem more alive, active than it should be.  The air is filled with
the sound of small animals and sweet bird song.

186.name: A Dusty Road
desc: "   You are nearing the great forests.  The road passes some old tree
cuttings, but they are near indistinguishable from the forest itself
except for some piles of logs.  The forest exudes a vibrancy that makes
it seem more alive, active than it should be.

187.name: A Dusty Road
desc: "   You are nearing the great forests.  The road passes some old tree
cuttings, but they are near indistinguishable from the forest itself
except for some piles of logs.  The forest exudes a vibrancy that makes
it seem more alive, active than it should be.  The air is filled with
the sound of small animals and sweet bird song.

188.name: A Dusty Road
desc: "   You are nearing the great forests.  The road passes some old tree
cuttings, but they are near indistinguishable from the forest itself
except for some piles of logs.  The trees are beginning to get a lot
denser the further into the forest you go.

189.name: Entering the Forest
desc: "   You are nearing the great forests.  The road winds its way between
the trees, it is more a track than a road, but there is evidence that
something heavy regularly travels this way.  The trees are beginning
to get a lot denser the further into the forest you go.

190.name: Entering the Forest
desc: "   You are nearing the great forests.  The road winds its way between
the trees, it is more a track than a road, but there is evidence that
something heavy regularly travels this way.  The trees are beginning
to get a lot denser the further into the forest you go.

191.name: Lumber Yard
desc: "   You are at the entrance to the forest.  There are piles of cut logs
here ready for removal to the shipyards.  Some of the logs have been left
here so long that they have sprouted leaves and roots, such is the strength
of the forest.  Others are so fresh that the sap is still slowly dripping
from the fresh wounds on the trees.  There is a lumberjacks cottage just
to the side, but it is in such a run down condition that it almost at the
stage of collapsing.  There is a small path into the forest, but you quickly
lose sight of where it leads.

192.name: Forest Depths
desc: "   You are at the threshold of the deep forest.  You can barely see the
lumberyard to the far west, and everywhere else.... there is but trees.
The forest is quieter here.  It is almost as if it is waiting, and has
been waiting for a long time, but for what?

193.name: Lumberjack's Cottage
desc: "   You are in the shack, there is a well maintained fireplace and there is
a little cot in the corner.  It looks a lot better maintained than the
outside suggests.  In the corner you can see some pots and pans, blackened
with soot.  You can see an old kettle, but is unfortunately holed at the
bottom.

194.name: Yard Road
desc: "   The road is a little bit sandy.  There are large ruts in the road, leaving
the centre ridge about six inches higher than the tracks to either side.  To
the west you can see the immense wall of the city and beyond that the towers
and domes that stand out above the wall, spiking the horizon.  To the southwest
you can make out the great dockyards that form the foundation for the large
Endarian trading fleets.  To the south you can make out the sea, seems so
peaceful and calm from here.

195.name: Yard Road
desc: "   The road is a little bit sandy.  There are large ruts in the road, leaving
the centre ridge about six inches higher than the tracks to either side.  To
the west you can see the immense wall of the city and beyond that the towers
and domes that stand out above the wall, spiking the horizon.  To the west
you can see the entrance to the great dockyards that form the foundation for
the large Endarian trading fleets.  A large sign hangs over the entrance,
though from here you cannot make out what it says.  The road continues to
the south, becoming ever more sandy.  In the distance you can make out the
sea, it seems so peaceful and calm from here.

196.name: Beach Road
desc: "   The road is a almost pure sand.  The trail of people walking has worn a
single rut down the middle of the lane, the walking is easier there, the
sand has been compacted and smoothed by the passing of many feet. To the
west you can see the immense wall of the city and beyond that the towers and
domes that stand out above the wall, spiking the horizon.  To the northwest
you can make out the great dockyards.  You can hear the sound of the sea
coming from the south, the crashing of the waves.  Mixed in with the sea sounds
you can hear the gurgling of the large river to the east.

197.name: The Pier
desc: "   You are quite a distance out to sea here.  Fishermen and their big
trawlers are docked here, there is a very strong smell of fresh fish.  Only
the big boats dock here, the rest dock along the wharf itself, where the
water is shallower.  Up ahead you can see some sailing ships.  These are
obviously the private yachts of the rich nobility.  Down at the other
end of the pier you can see the ferries loading and unloading their cargo,
both people and luggage.

198.name: The Pier
desc: "   You are at a relatively quiet part of the pier.  You are faraway enough
from the wharf so as not to have the bustle of the people of the city, and
the cranky old fishermen, and not so close to the pier's end, where all the
big ships and ferries dock.  The pier is actually quite wide here, well
actually as wide as anywhere else, but there are less crates stacked here.

199.name: A Soft Sandy Beach
desc: "   You are on a sandy beach.  The water laps gently against the silvery sand.
There are several trees shading the back of the beach.  To the west you can
see that the great pier from the shipyards is sheltering this beach from the
ferocity of the seas.  You can see the waves breaking over the pier, throwing
spray scores of feet into the air, but on this side all is calm.  Sheltering
behind the pier you can make out an unfinished ship, the main masts have been
erected but the spars have not been fitted nor the mizenhead attached.  She
looks a fine ship, long and broad.  She rides well in the water.  To to east
you can see a large river just over the next rise, looking back up towards the
mountains you can see how it snakes it way down, curving and bending.  Beyond
the river you can see some farms and beyond those an immense forest, until the
blue sky meets the green canopy in the distance.

200.name: Tourist Office
desc: "   You are in Endar's Tourist Office.  There is a steady stream of people
looking at the various books and maps of the area, some are even available
for public view.  The receptionist is busy handling the gawking tourists
from Arandia and elsewhere who arrive at all times of the day and night.
They have heard of Hyberia, the crystal lands of Mythra, of Thelsha and all
that land has to offer and of course glorious Endar itself.  Places where the
glory of earlier times still exists.

201.name: Dolphin's Inn
desc: "   You are in the sailor's inn.  They throng the place, hard working and
definitely hard drinking.  There are escapees from the market resting and
drinking a quiet pint of beer.  There is a strong but gentle atmosphere of
welcome in the bar.  Following the movements of some other fellow travellers
you see that there is a private room at the back for you to have a quiet
conversation or other private pursuits.

202.name: A private room
desc: "   It is a simple room, with no more than a few chairs, and a series
of small beds.  A sweet looking woman is here, charging for the use of
the beds.  She points outs some lockers than can be used to stored your
valuables while asleep.  Some of the beds are already occupied, rough
looking characters but it is quiet and the small fire keeps the room
nice and warm.
It is an old marble fireplace, which by the looks of it is kept burning
al the time.

203.name: Sena's Fish
desc: "  The smell of the fish assaults your senses.  There are fish abundantly
displayed  thoughout the shop, on the counters, the walls and even some
smoked fish across the rafters.  You can even see a model of the fabled
Endarian dolphins across the entrance of the store.  Sena himself is
behind the counter gilleting a rather large fish, pulling out the
entrails and throwing them into a basket on the floor, some of which
doesn't actually land in the basket but on the floor... ugh!
"   The dolphin is quite long, about 10 feet, with a strong tail and several
fins.  The nose is very pointed and could do great damage.  The artist who
created this model seems to have instilled a look of intelligence in the
eyes of the dolphin, this is truly a masterpiece!

204.name: Old Man's Boats
desc: "   You are in a run-down old shack of a boat house, but the boats are all
in pristine condition.  The old man is looking at you, chewing on his pipe.
There are simple rafts, boats, canoes for the buying, some of them look
less seaworthy than others but the old man assures you that they are all
in good condition.  Looking at the shack itself, it is falling to pieces,
there is even a small door on the seaward side of the shack, barely shut,
leading nowhere.
"   The canoe is a lightweight boat, it is composed of small sticks forming
a frame with prepared skins forming the outerskin.  Needs plenty of care
and maintenance but will serve you in need.
"   It is a small boat, capable of holding two at a squeeze.  Definitely
the best boat on sail her.  It is made of heavy oak.

205.name: Last Chance Inn
desc: "   You are in the Last Chance Inn, as it proudly declares itself to be the
last chance that you can get a pint of beer before leaving the city.  It
doesn't seem to do great business, a few adventurers some dirt covered,
others clean and obviously taking their last chance.  The barman is at the
bar pulling on the several taps that are there, a friendly old soul.
The atmosphere is heavy with smoke and alcohol.  In the corner you can
see some tired adventurers sitting with their hoods pulled over their eyes
as they try to catch some sleep.  In another corner you can see an old
adventurer fondling the buxom barmaid as she tries to serve him another
jug of ale, she doesn't seem to object too much.  The people here all
mind their own business, and their business is none of yours.  This is
truly the last chance inn for most of them.
"   The bar is made of polished oak.  There are several taps there, some for
cider and others for ale.  There is a cask of mead behind the bar.  Straining
your neck you can see several bottles of strong whisky, guaranteed to
drown your sorrows.
"   The taps display the available beers, Ould Grumpy, Devil's Brew are among
the list.

206.name: MerLuin's Mysteries
desc: "   You are in MerLuin's shop, there are hundreds of potions, wands and
scrolls stacked neatly on the shelves.  You can see mighty wards inscribed
on the floor and walls, runes to control and dispell all use of magic.
The shelves are all marked according to potency, the highest reaching a
title called DON'T USE.  MerLuin himself is staring at you with his elven
eyes, reading your very soul, smiling to himself.
"   There are several of these, ranging from harmless to deadly.  The shelves
are group into various classes such as healing, offensive, defensive.
"   These are scattered everywhere in the room, and around the door.  They
are essential for keeping the magic in the store under control.  Destroy
these runes and the entire city could go up in a magical explosion of
energy.

207.name: Royal Inn
desc: "   You are in the bar at the Royal Inn, there are some tables and chairs
so that you can either eat your meal or drink a beer or two in comfort.
Looking at the prices for the food here, you can see why it is called the
Royal Inn, only royalty could afford the prices they charge.  There are
several large bouncers hovering around the room, making sure that there
is no trouble while you are staying here.

208.name: Bedrooms
desc: "   There are lines of beds here, seperated by cloth walls, providing some
privacy.  Beside each bed are some lockers for you to store your belongings.
There is a receptionist on duty here to help you to your bed, if you have
inbided a little to generously in the precious liqour below.

209.name: Gamblers Den
desc: "   There are several gamblers here.  The gambling tables are over to one
side leaving half the room for a quiet conversation.  The gamblers are all
staring intently making hardly a sound, pokerfaced in their card games.

210.name: Kitchens
desc: "   You are in the kitchens behind the bar.  This is where they make the food
(well by definition at least) that they serve up front.  The heat from the
open fires is tremendous.  The cook and his assistants are sweating heavily
from the heat.  The cook waves angrily at you to get out of his kitchen.

211.name: Malria's Fresh Groceries
desc: "   You are in Malria's grocery store, the smell of fresh vegetables and
moist earth permeates the room.  You can see lettuces and cabbages,  broccoli
and every other green, carrots and even eggs.  There are torn vegetable
leaves on the floor.  Malria's obviously does great business considering the
jewellery Malria sports even when she's serving you.
"   There are cabbage leaves lying everywhere, some quite old and moldy in the
corners.  Attempts are made to keep the place clean but over the years the
vegetables have stained the stone floor green.

212.name: Central Bank of Endar
desc: "   You are in the foyer of the opulent Central Bank of Endar.  The room is
richly decorated in mythran crystal and dwarven metalwork.  There are several
citizens depositing money in the bank, with the watchful eye of a cityguard
spying for any pickpockets or trouble makers.  The tellers work efficiently
all day keeping the wheels of commerce running smoothly.
"   The walls are decorated in ornate mythran crystal which shimmers in the
light of the flickering candles.  There is enough crystal here to buy a
small island.
"   The emblem consists of two hands clasping with a diamond above and a ship
below, emphasising the co-operation of man and the use of ship and mines to
build the wealth of Endar.  The emblem is used on all the banks offices and
gold reserves.

213.name: Hall
desc: "   You are in a strangely cold and dark hallway.  The room is very old and
dilapidated, the wooden supports are full of woodworm, the walls are broken
and cracked.  Looking back to the alley it looks more distant than it should
be.  There are torn, ripped papers everywhere, illegible.  Now and then you
see bones, and all the time the wind whistiling through the holes in the wall.
"   There are papers strewn everywhere, grabbing a few, you find nothing
legible, as they crumble away in your very grasp.
"   Nothing special, they look like rat and dog bones by the size of them,
strange some of the bones look human like, though there are not many of
those, all the bones seem old and charred.

213.flags: dark, no_mob, indoors, peaceful, anti_good, anti_neutral

214.name: Altar of Darkness
desc: "   You are standing in front of the Altar of the Serene Lady of Darkness.
Around the room in the flickering candlelight you can see paintings of
various temples and priestesses. Before the altar is an ornate rug, where
a bare patch has been worn where the priestess obviously would kneel
down before the altar during services.  You can sense the aura of such
sacred ceremonies... the ambience of meeting one's gods, it is overwhelming.
"   The altar is made of transparent crystal from nearby Mythra.  It has a
faint blue glow about it.  Draped over the altar is a black velvet cloth
that flickers in the candlelight.  There are two black candles lit upon the
altar, yet no wax seems to melt.
"   It is an ornate rug with a pattern resembling a black dragon and a tall
beautiful Lady standing by its side.  Beneath the Lady's feet there lie
kobolds, humans, dwarves and elves.  Walking on the rug you hear a hollow
wooden sound, as if the floor is wooden underneath, yet the floor is all stone.

215.name: Preparation Room
desc: "   You are in the preparation room just off from the altar.  All around there
are sharp knives, candlesticks, and pentagrams.  The instruments of the dark
side.  There are a couple of books lying on the table.  It seems peaceful
here, not a sound penetrates the thick walls and the heavy curtain seperating
this room from the altar.
"   It seems just like an ordinary table, with a black cloth laid over it.
There appears to be some dried in blood stains on it.
"   They are just books of instruction, detailing the precautions needed
before summoning the Great Ones, how to draw pentagrams and the correct
way to sacrifice both animals and men.  A whole section on the latter.

216.name: Beggar's Lair
desc: "   You have entered the beggars hideout.  The beggars here look more like
guards or enforcers than beggars.  They are all very healthy and look
extremely strong. You notice a few are lightly armed.  The room itself
is well furnished, with bottles aplenty and chairs.  There are some boxes
to the north which some of the beggars are sitting on.
"   The boxes are made up of wood and appear stacked in a random fashion.  You
try to peer around them, there appears to be some sort of space there but
any further investigation is halted by the looks of the beggars.

217.name: Beggar's Throne
desc: "   You are in the throne room of the Beggars, it is a chamber made up of
boxes, with some frayed carpet on the floor.  The King is sitting on his
throne, there are clearly armed guards pacing the room, they are looking
at their swords, itching to kill someone.

extra.desc: "   It is made up of wood cartons and cushions, it looks filthy.

218.name: Chapel of Oneness
desc: "   You are in the entrance way of the Chapel of Oneness.  Here they
profess that man consists of two sides, a dark and and a light, and that
together they form a unified complete person, neither dark nor light, but
grey, and grey is the colour scheme this temple prefers.

219.name: Altar of Oneness
desc: "   You have entered the altar room, it is a simple room, with only small
windows and no decorations.  The altar is made up of Endarian Granite,
and has two gray candles lit upon it, giving out two small halo's of light.
There is a sense of oneness, and of peace with both halfs of yourself in
this room, darkness does not overpower the light, nor the light the darkness.

extra.desc: A simple wooden door, closed but not locked.

desc: "   It is a simple block of Endarian granite, a solid gray stone mined in
the hills above the city.  Looking behind the altar you can see a thick
rug with a depiction of two half crescents, one black, the other white,
joining to form a whole circle.

219.flags: no_mob, indoors, peaceful, no_magic, anti_good, anti_evil, fast_mana, neutral_altar

220.name: The Clock Tower
desc: "   You are at the base of the clocktower.  A long windy stairs leads up to
the higher floors.  It is dark and dusty in here, but a trail of footsteps
can be clearly seen.  Behind you lies a strong oak door, it is permanently
wedged open a little.
"   The door is made of solid oak, it has an old poster on it, advertising
the foods available from The Royal.
"   The stairs climb up steeply in a spiral.  There is no handrail and some
of the steps look decidedly unstable.

221.name: Stairs
desc: "   You are near the base of the spiral staircase, there is writing on the
wall but even with further investigation it is illegible.  It is getting
cold.  Looking up all that you can see are spirals and spirals of stairs.
You feel dizzy.
"   You stare at the writing on the wall and slowly you begin to make sense
of the letters.  They are a very old form of the characters.  Slowly the
message is translated to say
The Way is dark and full of circles,
But not all circles are round.
Floors are what you walk on
And roofs you walk beneath.
Assumptions hinder knowledge,
Knowledge is power,
Beware of thy assumptions.

222.name: Stairs
desc: "   You are now midway up the stairs.  To your left is a small room.  The
stairs seem to spiral forever both up and down.  There is more of that
fiendish writing on the wall.
"   The floor ahead looks sound, but still you sense something not quite
right about it.
"   The writing is of an old form and with time you manage to translate it
Through a crack too wide comes no wonder,
Innocence forbades wisdom,
Wisdom begotten by experience
And experience oft begets a crack too wide.
If thou ever should find thee in a pit of darkness
Search thy soul for the answer.

223.name: Rest Room
desc: "   You are in a small room, with a table and some chairs.  A small window
looks out over the town.  this is obviously a rest room, for those who
find the journey up the stairs tiring.  The room looks well used.  The
room itself is quite bare, with tiles on the walls, and a strange pattern
on the roof.

extra.desc: "   A heavy oak table with some wine stains clearly apparent.

desc: "   The window looks out over the city, towards the castle.  It is quite a
large castle with many tall towers, and a central great hall.

224.name: Cell
desc: "   You have been transported to a small cold cell.  A haunting voice
echoes Nah Nah NaNah Na.  The cell looks as if it has no exit.
There is a whispering in your ear, saying The answer is in that
part of you that is not material yet without which life is not
worth anything material, look deep.  You can see the steps of
the stairs above you.  It is very cold here.
"   They are perfectly smooth, and cold.  Looking more closely you see
a crack in one corner, a crack that widens greatly once some plaster is
pulled away.
"   You can see the steps above you, they are clearly designed to trap any
that come to climb the stairs, unknowing of the trap.

225.name: Stairs
desc: "   You are just below the top of the stairs.  The steps here are very steep
and are well worn, the wall has some fiendish writing which you cannot
quickly translate.

extra.desc: "   Nothing spectacular

desc: "   With difficulity you manage to translate the message, yet it still remains
cryptic:
What goes up must come down,
But use thee a path that differs not.

226.name: Air Vent
desc: "   You are in a dark and dusty tunnel.  It is very tight and there is only
room for one person at most.  The tunnel appears to travel above the stairs.
There are tracks in the dust, and plenty of creepy insects crawl all over
you.

227.name: A dark and Dust Tunnel
desc: "   You are in a dark and dusty tunnel.  It is very tight and there is only
room for at most one person.  the tunnel appears to travel above the stairs.
There are tracks in the dust and there are plenty of creepy insects crawling
all over you.

228.name: Top of Stairs
desc: "   You are standing at the top of the stairs.  To your east there is a small
hall, the entrance draped with a red robe.  At the top of the stairs there
stands a guard, an member of the elite squad by the look of his armor.  There
is the gentle smell of incense coming from the hall, and you can hear a
gentle rumbling in the distance.
"   There are rungs in the ceiling, just within your reach, which lead to an
air vent in the north facing wall.

229.name: A Narrow Corridor
desc: "   You are in a narrow hallway, the walls are undecorated but there are
windows facing south, looking out towards the sea.  There is a door at one
end with a bronze plaque on the door.  It is very quiet.
"   The plaque on the door reads:
Crier's Room
Unauthorized Personnel will be punished
"  There is a great view from the window looking south, over the sea wall,
and to the milling seas beyond.  The brilliant blue waters dissappear in the
distance.  There is a shadow on the horizon, it could be Thelsha.

230.name: Crier's Room
desc: "   You are in the Town Crier's Room.  There is a large clock on the wall
and several large chests.  The town crier is an angry irritable man who
is slightly overweight.  Beside him there is a large dog which he pats
gently, more like a wolf actually.  From here the town crier keeps an eye
over the entire city, calling the time and warning the guards of any
trouble in the town below.  Along the walls are pictures of several of the
previous holders of this post.
"   There are eight chests lying on the floor, each are named according to
the eight days of ancient Endar, the eight box is no longer used, but the
others look well worn.
"   Along the wall you can see the pictures of several portly men who have
been crier's in the past, these are men who have saved the city from fire
and attacks from pirates by their keen eyes and loud voices.

231.name: City Park
desc: "   You are in the City's Park.  You are surrounded by lovingly cared for
lawns and sculptured trees.  The gravel path upon which you walk crunches
with your every step.  Apart from the sound of the gravel there is naught
to be heard but the wind in the trees and the sound of birds.  There is
a careful constructed wall of trees around the gardens.
"   The wall of trees was created several hundred years ago by a celtic
warrior turned gardener, of the name Fionn Og, or so says the plaque.
The trees consist of mature oak, chestnut and maple trees, planted in such
a way so as to keep out the sounds of the city.

232.name: City Park
desc: "   You are in the city park, there is a selection of nice red flowers here.
The sign says that they are a variety of rose, amazing, these roses have no
thorns.  The sign has more details.  The path is well worn here, this must
be an favourite place for the city folk to visit, especially the younger ones
who feel those amorous feelings.
"   The roses have being christened the Endarian Love Rose.  When picked
they change to the colour of the heart of the pickee, red for those in love,
black for those black of heart.  More details can be found in the Library.
These flowers can only be found on Endar and picking them is strictly
forbidden.
Endarian park Authorities
"   These  roses have being christened the Endarian Love Rose.  When picked
they change to the colour of the heart of the pickee, red for those in love,
black for those black of heart.  More details can be found in the Library.
These flowers can only be found on Endar and picking them is strictly
forbidden.
Endarian park Authorities

233.name: City Park
desc: "   You are in the south eastern corner of the park, you can now clearly see
the temple of Oneness, the trees are less effective at keeping out the city
noise here, you can see where some of the trees have been burnt.  Strange
how the trees are burnt so, must have been mage fire escaping from Merluin's
shop across the road.

234.name: City Park
desc: "   You are in the park, it is very quiet here.  The gravel path leads south
and east.  To the north you can see the cliff face that edges the northern
half of the city.  The park reaches up to the base of the cliff though the
signs say keep off the grass.
"   KEEP OFF THE GRASS
Endarian Park Authoritories

235.name: City Park
desc: "   You are in the park.  It is very quiet here.  The gravel path leads south
and east.  The gravel sounds differently here.  To the north you can barely
see the mountains through the trees.  There are signs saying keep of the
grass.
"   Examining the gravel you hear the sound of stone on metal.  Further
investigation leads to you seeing a small trapdoor hidden under the gravel.
The door is too small to enter for more than one to enter.
"   KEEP OF THE GRASS and PLEASE DO NOT LITTER
Endarian Park Authorities

236.name: City Park
desc: "   You are in the park, it is very quiet here.  To the north you can see
the cliffs and further east the end of the park and the temple of Oneness.
It is a strangely built temple, but with a rightness about it.

237.name: Small Hollow
desc: "   You are in a small hollow, there is a trapdoor leading to the surface
above you.  There are lots of insects here, hungry for food.  There is some
writing on the wall.  It is old and faint.
"   The Merchant Gweedoor hides a secret, not always was business his
first priority but a secret affair with the Lord's wife.  It is
rumoured that the wife used a secret passage to visit the merchant's
abode, unknown to the Lord and his guards.

238.name: Central Park
desc: "   You are in a quite park off the square.  It is an ornamental garden
consisting of arranged stones and manicured trees.  A sense of peace oozes
from this place.  The sound of the bustling city mingles with that of the
birds and the trees to produce a harmonious melody.
"   They consist of large pieces of granite, arranged in concentric circles
of eight.

239.name: Crack
desc: "   You are on a small ledge on the outside of the sea wall.  A small crevice
leads back up to the top of the sea wall.  Also on the ledge is a large nest,
where there are some seagulls nesting.  They hiss at your every movement.
Nothing is so protective as a mother and her children.

240.name: Nest
desc: "   You are in the seagull's nest.  The birds are all screeching and pecking
at you.  You can see some eggshells, and the some recent hatchlings.  There
are birds everywhere.
"   The eggshells are made of some very hard material, hard but tough, would
make great armour but not from these pieces.
"   It consists of twigs, straw, seaweed and even some wire, stolen from the
town below.

241.name: Kasman's Jewellery
desc: "   You are in the famous jewellery store of Kasman, not only does he sell
and buy the most beautiful gemstones this side of the Spectral Isles, he also
has a great range of dresses and suits.  Looking around the store you can see
very little, it all being very carefully guarded by Kasman.  Kasman noticing
your dissappointment, shows you some midnight blue satin dresses, shimmering
in the faint light, a dark dinner suit, and a beautiful pair of cufflinks,
ideal for the fashion-touched shopper.
"   Kasman notices your gaze and pulls them away from you, muttering about
dirty fingers, he points to a price list on the wall.

242.name: Johann's Arms
desc: "   Now that you are inside, you can see in the faint light, racks upon racks
of swords, pikes and awls.  Looking back at the windows, you can see thick
iron bars criss-crossing the inside, making this a fortress to get in or out
of.  Johann is busy grinding a blade on his stone wheel, the sparks fly out,
like a spray of golden specks.  He looks at you and grunts, pointing at the
racks of weapons.  A brief look tells you that these weapons are of a superior
quality, and most likely have a price tag to match.  Johann points a second
time to a large sign, which reads NO PURCHASES, umm it seems Johann sells
but does not buy back.

extra.keywords: weapons racks awls swords pikes sword
desc: "   Looking more closely at the weapons, you can see that the swords are of
various sizes, and of differing grips, some for small people with small hands,
and by the heft of the weapons, seem perfectly balanced despite their smaller
size, as do the larger weapons.  Picking a hair, you drop it on a sword's
edge, it splits under its own weight.

243.name: Ronan's Curio's
desc: "   You are in a Curio's Shop.  There are strange knick-knacks everywhere.  The
only thing not old and badly maintained, is a small velvet curtain, hanging on
the eastern wall, towards the back of the shop.While looking at the curtain,
you manage to spot the proprietar's desk, almost hidden underneath a pile of
rubbish and other items of dubious value.  Looking at the shopkeeper you make
out a small wizened man, he could not stop a thief stealing anything but his
best defence is that only he knows where the good stuff is in all this junk.  He
has a kindly face, he gently beckons you in.
"   Looking at the curtain, you notice that it is of very high quality.  Behind
the curtain you see a large tunnel, but when you try to put your hand into the
tunnel you notice that it is blocked at the entrance.  The old man notices your
actions, and chuckling, he explains that it requires a certain word to be said
before it will let you pass.  You can see that the old man knows the answer but
at his age, you know no way to get the answer out of him, it must lie elsewhere,
as must the answer to where it leads.
"   You speed along a rapidly falling tunnel.  There are piles of dust
everywhere.  You begin to choak.. but suddenly you see a light ahead...
you're going to fast.. you're going to be killed...
I am going to dieeeeeeee.....
bounce bounce ouch

245.name: Alcove of Humility
desc: "   You are in the alcove of Humility.  it is important to remember your place.
Yours is not the way of the gods, mighty though you may be, the gods are
above you still, question not the ways of them, but accept and be happy that
what you do is what's right.
Humbling words as these fill you with a sense of your position in the universe
and yet your eyes wander as you pray, naught meets your eyes but a beautiful
picture.
"  The tunnel appears to be covered by a heavy cloth, blocking entrance,
though the catch holding the cloth seems to have been long rotten.
"   It is a beautiful picture of a golden dragon and a young warrior riding
the skies.  The epitomy of a warrior's might, and above them standing in
the clouds is the host of angels and gods, mightier still.  A closer look at
the picture reveals that it is loose, and looking behind you see a tunnel.

246.name: Alcove of Righteousness
desc: "   You are in the Alcove of Righteousness.  Might is not always right, young
one, but might in the cause of Justice is right.  Never let your sword waver
nor your will bend in this cause.
Fine stirring words fill your mind, looking around reveals only some kneelers
to pray upon and a picture on the wall.
"   The picture is quite simple, a staff and sword crossed, and an evil
serpent pierced by the sword and crushed by the staff.

246.flags: indoors, peaceful, no_magic, anti_neutral, anti_evil, good_altar

247.name: Alcove of Peace
desc: "   You are in the Alcove of Hope, my child.  The way is hard but there is
hope, you are not alone in the struggle.  Pray for guidance and the way will
become clear.
While absorbing this message a quick glance around the room shows only a
picture hanging on the wall.
"  There is a large framed picture of a young man trudging along, bent over
with worry, with a god walking by his side, further along the path the man
is even further troubled and the god is helping him, along the path a bit
more the god carries the man over the worst part, until he can walk again.
Inspiring!

247.flags: indoors, peaceful, no_magic, anti_neutral, anti_evil, good_altar

248.name: Altar of Hope
desc: "   You are in the centre of the cathedral.  Beside you rests the great altar
of Endar, where the lords of Endar come to be crowned with the responsibilities
of ruling this city.  Surrounding the altar are four alcoves, one for each
point on the compass, each is dedicated to a certain aspect of the way.
"   The altar is made of one single piece of mythran crystal.  There is a
symblem of the sun engraved on the altar.  Two white candles are lit on the
altar, giving a warm, comforting light for your prayers.

248.flags: no_mob, indoors, peaceful, no_magic, anti_neutral, anti_evil, good_altar

249.name: Alcove of Serenity
desc: "   You are in the Alcove of Serenity, this is one of the four keys to the
path of goodness, to recognise the Way and to recognise the trials that
befalls this path, to understand what is possible to change and to accept
what is not.
This message seems to permeate the air in this small alcove.  There is a
large picture hanging on the wall.  The room is dark but this does not seem
to hinder visibility.
"   It is a large picture depicting a young woman and man, walking together
along a long windy path, leading to a setting sun.

249.flags: indoors, peaceful, no_magic, anti_neutral, anti_evil, good_altar

250.name: Entrance Hall
desc: "   You are in the entrance hall to the cathedral.  You can sense the holiness
of this place leak through the entrance way.  There is a sign here asking you
to prepare yourself before entering this holy place.  This vestibule is
simply but effectively dcorated, giving a sense of welcome and austerity at
the same time.
"   This is a place of worship, the drawing of weapons will not be allowed.
Nor shall any monsters be allowed within these halls.  Magic will also be
prevented so as not to distort the purity of the prayers being offered to
those above, for the mercy of our prayers and your soul, follow these rules.

251.name: Slums
desc: "   You are at the entrance to the slums of Endar, they seem to stretch
endlessly into the distance.  Everywhere you turn you see exactly the same
decay and slums, and hundreds of twisted paths between what used to be
buildings.  There is no guarantee that you will ever find your way out.

252.name: Slums
desc: "   You are in the midst of the slums, there are hundreds of rats everywhere.
You can see many tunnels and paths leading in various directions, though
from experience you know that they twist and turn along the way.  The
residents of these slums look harmless and very hungry.

253.name: Slums
desc: "   You are in the midst of the slums, there are hundreds of rats everywhere.
You can see many tunnels and paths leading in various directions, though
you know from experience that they twist and turn along the way.  The
residents of these slums look harmless and very hungry.

254.name: Slums
desc: "   You are in the midst of the slums, there are hundreds of rats everywhere.
You can see many tunnels and paths leading in various directions, though
from experience you know that they twist and turn along the way.  the
residents of these slums look harmless and very hungry.

255.name: Slums
desc: "   You are in the midst of the slums, there are hundreds of rats everywhere.
You can see many tunnels and paths leading in various directions, though
from experience you know that they twist and turn along the way.  The
residents of these slums look harmless and very hungry.

256.name: Slums
desc: "   You are in the midst of the slums, there are hundreds of rats everywhere.
You can see many tunnels and paths leading in various directions, though
from experience you know that they twist and turn along the way.  The
residents of these slums look harmless and very hungry.

257.name: Slums
desc: "   You are in the midst of the slums, there are hundreds of rats everywhere.
You can see many tunnels and paths leading in various directions, though
from experience you know that they twist and turn along the way.  The
residents of these slums look harmless and very hungry.

258.name: Slums
desc: "  You are in the midst of the slums, there are hundreds of rats everywhere.
You can see many tunnels and paths leading in various directions, though
you know from experience that they twist and turn along the way.  The
residents of these slums look harmless and very hungry.

259.name: Slums
desc: "   You are in the midst of the slums, there are hundreds of rats everywhere.
You can see many tunnels and paths leading in various directions, though
from experience you know that they twist and turn along the way.  The
residents of these slums look harmless and very hungry.

260.name: Gnomish Maps
desc: "   You are in a small shop, you have to stoop just to avoid hitting your
head.  Looking around you can see thousands of maps, written on leaves, and
bark, vellum and hide.  There are a bunch of small gnomish creatures running
around the shop, making little notes in their notebooks.  The windows are
all very dirty, letting in a dull yellowy light, which accentuates the dusty
nature of the stop, and the yellowing pages of the maps.  Rumour has it that
there are maps in here to secret treasures, but also that the vast majority
of the maps are absolutely useless.  One of the small gnomes notices your
presence and runs over you, shoving a list of available maps under your nose.

261.name: Bread's and Pastries
desc: "   You are in a lovely, sweet smelling, bakery.  The owner, Gregi, is standing
behind the counter, looking at you expectantly.  There is a host of pastries,
cakes, an breads to choose from.  Looking behind the counter you can see the
ovens from which the breads arrive.  It is lovely and warm here, there is a
gentle scattering of flour everywhere, and the light as it shines from outside,
through cracks between the tiles on the roof, highlight the dusty flour as it
falls gently to the ground.

262.name: " Tiernan's Stables
desc: "   You are in Tiernan's Stables.  The horses groomed and trained here all
come from Tiernan's own stables, in the back-country of the island.  These
horses are beyond comparison, in their swiftness and strenght.  Story has
it that these horses have done the trip from city wharf to the Dolcain Bay,
at the far end of the island, in less than six hours, not withstanding the
cobbled streets and trees of the forest, and other non-friendly inhabitants.
Tiernan himself is a portly man, but the breadth of chest and arms come from
bulging muscles rather than excessive eating.  He is very proud of his horses.

263.name: Teas and Buns
desc: "   You are in the famous cafe Teas and Buns.  It is modelled after the most
fashionable cafe's of Arandor itself.  There is a busy trade at the bar, where
teas of many different flavours can be purchased.  A quiet but pervasive hum
of conversation permeates throughout the cafe and onto the street beyond.
Looking around at the people who come here, you can see that the youth of
Endar consider this to be the place to be seen.

extra.desc: "   You can see the various teas available, mango, lime, mint, and many more

264.name: " Illiad's Journey
desc: "   You are at the entrance to a fine restaurant.  The food smells
delicious.  This room is gently lit, not too dark, but comfortable.
There is a stand for leaving jackets and coats behind, as well as
a second for the odd piece of weaponry.  Surely you wouldnt want to
eat with your weapons about, this is a high class place.  The way
to the restaurant leads to the north, a beautifully ornate door
leads back out to the street.

265.name: Dining Room
desc: "   You are in the restaurant dining room.  There are only about a
dozen tables in the room, each subtly hidden from view of the other
tables by tall plants and furniture.  In one corner you can see the
glow of a small fire, heating the room quite nicely.  There are
several young waiters darting around the room.  It is amazing to
watch as they fly by, at breakneck speeds, and yet not drop a piece
of food or spill a drop of soup.

266.name: Guilds of Learning and Prayer
desc: "   You are in the hall of the Scholastic Guilds, the guilds that
use prayer and learning to develop their minds and souls, and
those of others.  The entrance hall is empty but for one old
book and a young lady praying.  This is no ordinary woman but
a cleric of innate power and trained well in the defensive arts,
it is her duty to protect those inside and the sacred relics
contained.

267.name: Guild Hall
desc: "   You are in the guildhall, you can see your guildmaster practising
in the ring, showing a young student the alphabet of Old Arandian, the
form used quite commonly in the scholarly and religious books of old,
not just how to say or write them, as everyone knows, but the true
meaning that lies within them and how the knowledge that is available
in any book is enhanced by a true appreciation of the writer and
his feelings, true knowledge is just not information alone, but
experience, and as the Master intones, experience is only garnered by
the old, learn from the old, through books and talks, less thee
require to be old before thee have wisdom.  Hearing your noisy
entrance, a few grains of sand fell off your shoes, the master
turns and greets thee.

268.name: Guilds of the Sword
desc: "   You are in the Guild of the Sword, guarding the entrance there is
a large warrior, muscled and tan, he is quite old, but still strong,
and the many scars testify to his experience.  Around the hallway
there are pictures of many famous warriors, and above some of the
pictures you can see the swords made famous by the warriors, Fire,
Dragonsbane, Snowblade.

269.name: Guild Hall
desc: "   You are in the guildhall, you can see your guildmaster practising
in the ring, showing a young student the art of holding a shield,
taking the blows and moving with them so as not to be stunned or
weakened, back and forth he moves, accepting the blows of the students
sword upon his shield, moving with the blows, letting them flow
naturally away from him, never missing a step.  Calling upon another
student to take his place, he walks over to welcome you.  Remembering
past sessions, you smile as you remember once being like these young
students.

270.name: Arcane Guilds
desc: "   You are in the hall of the Arcane Guilds, guarding the entrance
there is a an old man, wizened and frail, but from his eyes there
shines an energy, he looks at you, through you, you feel naked in
his glare.  There are no decorations in this room, it is bare but
for the glow from a single crystal ball.  All you can see are the
glowing blue symbols inscribed on the wall, there to prevent any
dangerous build-up or escape of magical energy.

271.name: Guild Hall
desc: "   You are in the guildhall, you can see your guildmaster practising
in the ring, showing a young student the art of preparing the various
components needed to cast a spell, how to ensure the freshness, how to
handle them so as not contaminate them with other substances, and how
to shield them so as not to contaminate them with the energies caused
by you and other magic users.  He notices your entry with scarcely a
raised eyebrow and completes his lesson before looking at you, in magic
never split your attention, and so too in life.

273.name: Theatre of Performing Arts
desc: "   It is a magnificent foyer, the walls are covered in red velvet and there
are posters of previous great shows on the walls.  There is a large sign at
the other end of the hall,
The Theatre of Performing Arts will be shut
for renovations and improvements, these are
necessary for the future well-being of the
theatre and the building.  We apologise for
any inconvenience.  Please remain attentive
for the announcement of our re-opening.
TPA of Endar.
"   The pictures are so old that the glass has gone so yellow that you can
not make out the names of the shows, it looks like it has been a long time
since there has been a great theatre group in Endar.

274.name: Guild Hall
desc: "   You are in the guildhall, you can see your guildmaster practising
in the ring, showing a young student the art of moving silently, not
lifting your foot more than a fraction, shifting your wait smoothly,
controlling your breathing.  He leaves the student to practice upon
your entry, he does not rush over but his very walk is silent, the
difficult skills, yet to be mastered by the students, automatic in
his very walk.

275.name: Guilds of Secrecy
desc: "   You are in the hall of the Secret Guilds, the guilds that
practice their trade best at twilight, thieves, assassins, spies.
You see a flicker in the corner of your eye, a movement in the
shadows, stories tell of the great assassins that guard these
guilds, hiding in the shadows, but if you dare draw a blade,
youre dead before you hit the ground.  Such skill has to be
appreciated and admired, as even when you look closely you can
see naught.

277.name: Main Street Police Station
desc: "   You are in Main Street's Police station.  There are a couple of burly
officers standing behind a desk dealing with enquiries.  They look at your
adventuring garments and turn steely eyed.  These Peace Guards know about
your type, the troublemaking type, the type that arrive back from their
travels, end up in a pub, drink the night out, being rowdy and disruptive.
Yes these guards know your type and their cells know them just as well, still
the guards have a reputation for fairness, even to those they don't like.
The police station itself is really just a single room, divided in two by the
bench.  There is a large poster on the wall, proclaiming the benefits of the
local neighbourhood watch scheme.  There are of course the mandatory warnings
about don't Drink and Ride, the importance of keeping your weapons sheathed.
The bench clears, leaving just you and the guards.
"   Endarian Neighbourhood watch
- Watch your neighbour's premises
- Report to the Peace Guards any suspicious persons
- Tell your neighbours if you are going away for a while
- Cancel all deliveries of milk, papers, and other groceries
Be alert, be watchful, defeat crime.

278.name: Police Headquarters
desc: "   You are in the Police Head Quarters.  It is really just a large room
with some offices leading off it.  Off to the back you can see part of the
jail itself.  There is the usual strained atmosphere of a police station,
fear and desperation.  All around the room you can see the usual cheerful
messages, such as Don't Drink and Ride, help your neighbour, and warnings
about not leaving your house door unlock with adventurers in town.  The
station is so busy that the guards do not have any time to pay attention
to your activities.

279.name: Map Room
desc: "   You are in the Police station's map room.  Here you can see on a large
map of the city where all the major crime spots are.  To the northwest of
the city you can see a large red circled section, named The Fishermen's
Quarters, and another area all along the southern sea wall, and especially
to the south of Guilds' Alley.  Also present in the room is a big list stuck
onto the wall, and a poster listing the latest edicts from the castle.
"   Officers on Duty
Day      60 officers,   5 commanders
Night    50 officers,   4 commanders,
Supplementary Peace Enforcers
Endarian Army Elite Squad    20 warriors, 2 commanders.
Allocation of Personell
25%  Market Square and Central Square
30%  City Walls and Wharf
10%  Guild and Merchants Alleys
20%  Artisans Quarters
15%  Sundry, includes Fishermens Quarters
"   This is a list of all the recent edicts that the Hy has ordered the
Police to enforce, all but one of them has been scratched out as either
impractical or already in operation.  The only one the police have refused
to implement is article 6 on the list, which reads,
"Welcome strangers and foreigner to the city
encourage their visits, promote the name of the
city to these visitors"
Scribbled underneath this edict was the remark... when the dragon takes a
bath... you gather it isn't a short term proposal.

280.name: Stairs
desc: "   You are in the middle of the upper flight of stairs, it feels
sort of strange here and the steps do not look walked upon.
Looking up you can just begin to make out the end of the steps
and downwards you can see a small landing.

281.name: Endarian Times
desc: "   You are in the front room of the Endarian Times.  ET is produced on a
weekly basis, with all the news, gossip and sports news from all around.
You can see many reporters walking around the room frantically, some are
hunched over desks scribbling.  It is a weird sight, not all the reporters
are human, it is hard for a human to report on elven matters, when it would
be much easier to get an elf to do the same job.  There is energy in this
room, all controlled by the Editor, in his little office to the side.

282.name: The Editor's Office
desc: "   You are in the Editor's office, he is slouched behind his big table, in
an old leather chair.  He swings to face you, chewing something at the back
of his mouth, he grumbles a greeting.  The desk is a mess of paper cuttings
and scribbled notes.  At the front of the desk there is a big sign saying
"EDITOR".  The rooms is dark and dusty, with the sound of busy people muted
to a nice low level hum.

283.name: Print Room
desc: "   You are in the heart of the paper, the printers.  The presses are not
operating at the moment, as the printmen are all working on one of the
rollers.  They spare you a momentary glance before settling into a series
of shouts and yells and the commencement of a constructive destruction of
the entire machine.  There is oil everywhere, coating the workers, the floor
and even the walls.  The machinery exudes a lovely, welcoming warmth.

285.name: City Library
desc: "   You are in the entrance hall to the greatest library in Hyberia.  The
hall towers above you, with its huge marble done and statued walls.  As you
walk across the hall, your every footstep reverbetrates around the hall,
echoing, resounding, slowly fading away.  The statues stand in small alcoves
that line the circular hall, their black bodies in contrast to the white and
pinks of the wall's marbles.  Upon further investigation, you can see that
the statues are of previous Lord Librarians, who have collected and built up
this fine collection.  There is a big sign in the middle of the hall, located
so that everyone can see it as they enter.
"          ATTENTION
No eating
No drinking
No loud conversation
permitted within the library itself
Lord Librarian,
Tsarles.
"   The statues are carved out of seasoned black oak.  The degree of detail
is fantastic.  As you stand and admire, you see a few citizens pass by,
reverently touching the statues.  After asking them about it, you discover
that it is good luck to touch the statues, which you do.. well good luck
never harms anyone.

286.name: History Section
desc: "   You are in a great hall, all you can are tiers upon tiers of books.  The
hall must be at least fifthy feet high, and over two hundred feet long.  Every
piece of wall space is covered in books, with huge aisles of even more books
filling every gap possible.  There are huge ladders leaning up against the
wall and on a few of them you can see a few librarians sorting the books.  The
array of books is totally daunting but there is a small collection of books
lying before you on a table.  It seems that these are the books most often
in demand and as such have been laid within easy access for visitors.
"   Here presented is an abstract from the Journals of Miller's Falls,
describing the last days of the town, as the water rose to destroy the
town.  No corroborating evidence exists to either prove or disprove this
story, the Library leaves its veracity to the decision of the reader.
The journals consist of six segments, each distanced in time, covering
the period over which the town became flooded.
The water level in the river is rising at a very fast rate.  I am afraid
that if it rises anymore that we might have to evacuate some parts of our
beautiful city.  The spring has been a very rough one, it hasn't stopped
raining for three months now.  We cannot mine for ore anymore because the
river has already flooded our tunnels that we mine in.  Many families have
already left to look for another place to live.  If the river keeps rising I
know that even more people will evacuate.  Why does this have to happen to us?
First we fight for our freedom, and now mother nature turns on us.
The water level has kept rising, the part of the city closest to the river
is in danger of being submerged.  The water has already lapped up onto most
of our river banks and is now threatening some of our house's with flooding.
I do not know how much more of this I can take, I have already lost a lot of
business thanks to this damn flooding issue and now people have stopped coming
to our city.  I am losing too much from this threat of flooding, if this
keeps up all my customers will be gone and I will be out of a business and
have to move, Oh I do not want to leave my beautiful city that I love so
much.
Most of the people in the city have moved now, COWARDS! let them leave.
There is a small band of us of approximately three hundred or so, that have
agreed and promised we'd stay and help to keep our city intact.  We have
done all that we can, we have sandbagged the river and moved to the north
western most part of the city that is furthest from the river.  There is
nothing more we can do than wait, and see what Mother Nature has in store
for us.
Disaster has struck!  The water that flowed through our tunnels has forced
its way through the mine and broke a new hole through solid rock and flooded
most of the city that is on the south-eastern side now is under ten plus feet
of water.  Everyone in that part of the city has evacuated and we are
helping each other, now all we have to do is wait....
Why us?  Now we have a new problem, besides the fact that some of our city
is now underwater we now have to deal with some strange new sickness.  Our
only doctor that is left has no idea what this sickness is and the few
of us that are left are rapidly dying.  We need to find a cure before it is
too late.  Otherwise we might all die...
I am the only one left, all the other people died or ran off madly, the
sickness made a few of us go crazy and then kill each other.  The water has
brought monsters into our town too.  This may be for the better that everyone
has died.  Better to have died from a sickness then from some monsters.  This
will be my last entry considering that I don't have much time to live.  I now
lie back and close my eyes and wait for death to bring peace to me.  My only
hope is that these journals of what has happened to the people of Millers
Falls and the words within will not fall on deaf ears.  Good-Bye....
"   Many legends have been collected over the years from various parts
of the world.  Questions have to be asked about the accuracy of some
these tales but many give insight into the behaviour and historical
geography of the lands.  The few listed below are a small collection
of the stories available, the rest are available from our librarians.
Arandia
2.1.1  Sleeping Giant Mountains
2.1.2  Sea Folk of Stormquor
2.1.3  Highhold Fortress
2.1.4  Tower Isle
2.1.5  Pillars of Anarchy
2.1.6  Millers Fall
Chressicaa
2.2.1  Chressport
2.2.2  Cafchuloo in the Cult-i-nac Desert
Hyberia
2.3.1  Mythra
2.3.2  Endar
Pharsica
2.4.1  Ponytail Archipelago
2.4.2  Clip City
Glacia
2.5.1  Golbatron

287.name: Geography Section
desc: "   You are in a great hall, all you can are tiers upon tiers of books.  The
hall must be at least fifthy feet high, and over two hundred feet long.  Every
piece of wall space is covered in books, with huge aisle of even more books
filling every gap possible.  There are huge ladders leaning up against the
wall and on a few of them you can see a few librarians sorting the books.  The
array of books is totally daunting but there is a small collection of books
lying before you on a table.  It seems that these are the books most often
in demand and as such have been laid within easy access for visitors.
Glacia:  Starting at Golbaton, on the southern coast of Glacia, the Many
Trails lead through a large mountain range to Winter Valley in it's
center.  The western part of Glacia is dominated by the Ice Plains, while
the west is dominated by the Grand Glacier, which houses the Blue Ice Palace.
City of Endar
A Great Lighthouse   I  Merchants Quarter     a   Old Boatieh
B Mages Tower        J  Guilds Quarter        b   Harbour Inn
C City Gate          K  Central Square        c   Food Stores
D Sunken Ship        L  The Castle            d   Royal Inn
E Piers              M  Artisans Quarter      e   Bank of Endar
F Slums (beware)     N  Temple of Oneness     f   MerLuins Shop
G Harbour Market     O  Great Library         g   Last Chance Inn
H Dark Temples       P  Cathedral of Hope     h   Endarian Times

288.name: General Information Section
desc: "   You are in a great hall, all you can are tiers upon tiers of books.  The
hall must be at least fifthy feet high, and over two hundred feet long.  Every
piece of wall space is covered in books, with huge aisle of even more books
filling every gap possible.  There are huge ladders leaning up against the
wall and on a few of them you can see a few librarians sorting the books.  The
array of books is totally daunting but there is a small collection of books
lying before you on a table.  It seems that these are the books most often
in demand and as such have been laid within easy access for visitors.
"   Nataichal is the city's foremost wizard, with the possible exception
of MerLuin.  Nataichal was key in the development of Endar's famous
crystal armor and weapons , which offer the guards great protection,
but rarely survive outside of Endar.  Nataichal is famous for
dressing in dark clothes, though the infectious twinkle in his eyes
belie his taste in clothes.  As a close advisor to Hy Dolcain his opinion
carries a lot of weight in Council.
"   The Empire of Arandia is crumbling in the absence of it's Imperial
family.  The Emperor of Arandia left to Hyberia on a delicate political
mission, bringing his family with him, but at sea, it is said that a magical
storm hit his boat in the deep seas east of Arandia, and in any case he
and his family has been missing now for just over twenty years and many now
agree that a new successor must be chosen, for the Regent Emperor, though
a great warrior and fiercely loyal, has many opponents.  The Regent was
the former Duke of Tosk, assuming the reign and leaving his brother in
control of the Southern regions (The duchy of Tosk includes Agatar's Keep,
Tosk, Pharport, and Multigar).  But these southern regions are the only
