regions in the once great Empire to remain totally loyal to the crown, with
independence-minded to outright rebellious regions in the North starting
to distance themselves from the throne.
Norport and Oldport are both key trading cities, the main trade routes
to glacia and chressport respectively, and both are the homes of several
greater houses, with varying degrees of claim to the throne of Arador.  The
Marquis of Norport in particular is attempting to rally support for his own
claim, and plans to declare his intentions once he can rally the support of
the other noble houses.
The regent Emperor is not blind to these ambitions, and decides to take
action, levying a tax on imports in order to break the backs of the merchant
backed houses of Norport and Oldport, supposedly to fund some small wars on
the Eastern end of the continent.  This tax has the opposite effect, however
to it's intentions, and the Marquis uses this opportunity to rally his
support and declare himself "King of the Northern Realm", with the backing
of Oldport and with a huge amount of Mercenaries funnelled in through
Golbatron and Chressport.
The Regent Emperor, always proud of his southern military background and
tiring of politics, now decided to take it upon himself to utterly crush the
noble houses of Norport and Oldport, and then lay claim once again to
Golbatron and Chressport for their role in the upsurgence.  Armies gather in
Tosk, Arador, and loyal cities to the south, while defences are strengthened
in the north for the expected attack.  Meanwhile Tosk, Multigar and Pharport
launch their fleets, at the command of the Duke, to crush the merchant
based fleets of the north.  The regent Emperor assumes control of the
ground forces, and plans a daring march through cobb's pass to split the
power base in half and force Norport and Oldport to rely on the sea, while
he trusts to his brother the Duke to crush the merchant navy.
Meanwhile Hyberia has released news that Emperor Gerald and his family
have been discovered on a small isle off Endar, shipwrecked there 20 years
ago. Some believe that this accident was more than just an accident.  Some
minor players have been executed for treason but their superiors have
avoided detection.  The Emperor has been kept in a secure location for
their own keeping, and some may suggest as hostages.  Upon the announcement
of the Emperors discovery, the Regent has decided to carry through his
plans and declare himself Emperor before the old emperor can regain
support. He has also made it known that the seals of office are high
on his wanted list as they would endow legitimacy to his reign.
As can be seen by this review of current political events, the current
world order is in an immense state of flux and new powerful players are
beginning to make their mark.

300.name: On the Sea
desc: "   You are a short distance away from the boatshed.  The door has swung
closed again.  The sea is gentle here, beside the wall.  You can see the
odd fish swimming, jumping out of the water, nipping at your toes, thinking
them flies or food.  Up ahead you can make out the superstructure of the
sunken ship.

301.name: On the Sea
desc: "   You are halfway between the ship and land.  You can see the odd fish
swimming, jumping out of the water, nipping at your toes, thinking
them flies or food.  Up ahead you can make out the superstructure of the
sunken ship.  The stern of the ship is nearest you, you can just make out
the name, the Stormfarer.

302.name: On the Sea
desc: "   You are halfway between the ship and land.  You can see the odd fish
swimming, jumping out of the water, nipping at your toes, thinking
them flies or food.  Up ahead you can make out the superstructure of the
sunken ship.  The stern of the ship is nearest you, you can just make out
the name, the Stormfarer.  The bow of the ship is also raised out of the
water, leaving the centre of the ship, beneath water, like an elven V.

303.name: Hospice for the Infirm
desc: "   You are in the city hospital.  It is not a very big hospital, there are
only beds for about one hundred patients, and most of these you can see to
be empty.  The hospital consists of one long hall, with beds on either
side, and at the end, there is a pharmacy which has all the medicines for
the patients.  Most patients can be quickly treated and sent home with a
potion or two, to be taken regularly, three times a day before meals.
There is a strong antiseptic smell to the hospital, and the nurses are
all very busy, caring for those too sick to leave.
"   The patients are a complete mixture, from the very wealthy to the poorest
beggar, all patients get the same free treatment, class and wealth has no
influence on the doctors, they see niether wealth nor class, but people
who are sick and need help.
"   There are hundreds of bed in this low but long hall.  They are simple
beds with two back boards at each end and a simple mattress in between.
Testing one, you can tell that they are not the best of beds but more
than sufficient to recover upon.  At the end of each bed there is a little
notepad with charts and some writing on it.

304.name: Hospital Pharmacy
desc: "   You are in the hospital's pharmacy.  The pharmacist is very busy
compiling the medicines needed by his patients, carefully mixing a drop
of this and a hint of that to produce his coloured phials.  Every now
and then a nurse comes in and takes the prepared phials, administering them
to the needy patients.  The pharmacist totally ignores your presence, he
is so engrossed in his work.

305.name: On the Sea
desc: "   You are at the ship, there are plenty of footholds for you to be able
to climb up the side.  The wood seems well preserved against the years in
the sea.  Looking up, the climb looks formidable but the idea of being
dry as opposed to wet is so inviting.

306.name: On the Side of the Ship
desc: "   You climb up the side of the ship, the odd piece of the ship's siding
breaking away in your hands as you climb.  There is a strong smell of
seagull droppings as you put your hand once more into another pile of
droppings.  You can see the top of the railings not far above you
and the water level is about three yards below.

307.name: " Rear Deck
desc: "   You are at the rear of an old galleon.  The rear deck is very large.
The wooden planks creak under your weight, and with every slight and not
so slight sea wave.  Looking down over the length of the ship, you can see
some cabins at the centre of the ship, with a section of the ship just
beyond that submerged in water.  The bow of the ship rears out of the water
at the far end, but it seems impossible to get there.  Looking over the
edge of the ship, you can see a makeship set of steps, enabling you to
climb down off the ship.

308.name: " Rear Deck
desc: "   You are at the rear of an old galleon.  The rear deck is very large.
The wooden planks creak under your weight, and with every slight and not
so slight sea wave.  Looking down over the length of the ship, you can see
some cabins at the centre of the ship, with a section of the ship just
beyond that submerged in water.  The bow of the ship rears out of the water
at the far end, but it seems impossible to get there.  Looking over the rear
deck you spot the remains of the steering system, and ships wheel is still
recognisable.  There appears to be something draped over the wheel.  Looking
further back, the end of the ship seems to be most gone.  There is a lovely
sea breeze blowing off the harbour, bringing with it a scent of salt.  Be
careful, salt rusts irons weapons very quickly.
"   You can see the old ship's wheel.  It has been darkened with age and
weather.  The wheel itsef is missing quite a few spokes and is only being
held upright due to the bones of the last seaman to try to steer the ship.
The bones have been picked clean, and as you watch, a seagull lands some
more droppings on the more soul's bones.

309.name: " Rear Deck
desc: "   You are at the rear of an old galleon.  The rear deck is very large.
The wooden planks creak under your weight, and with every slight and not
so slight sea wave.  Looking down over the length of the ship, you can see
some cabins at the centre of the ship, with a section of the ship just
beyond that submerged in water.  The bow of the ship rears out of the water
at the far end, but it seems impossible to get there.  Looking over the rear
deck you spot the remains of the ships name, it is mostly gone, torn by wind
and wave.  Looking further back, the end of the ship seems to be most gone.
There is a lovely sea breeze blowing off the harbour, bringing with it a
scent of salt.  Be careful, salt rusts irons weapons very quickly.
StormFarer is written on it, the writing is very faded, and there appears
to be more, but no more can be made out.

310.name: Lower Rear Deck
desc: "   You are between two cabins.  Behind you there are some steps leading up
to the rear deck.  The deck on which you stand is halfway between the upper
rear deck and the main deck of the ship. The wooden planks creak under your
weight, and with every slight and not so slight sea wave.  Looking down over
the length of the ship, you can see some cabins at the centre of the ship,
with a section of the ship just beyond that submerged in water.  The bow of
the ship rears out of the water at the far end, but it seems impossible to
get there.  Looking over the edge of the ship, you carefully hold onto the
decaying rails.  You cannot see anything but some fish jumping at the birds
as they swoop down.  Down below, you can see the rear of a cabin.

311.name: Lower Rear Deck
desc: "   You are between two cabins.  Behind you there are some steps leading up
to the rear deck.  The deck on which you stand is halfway between the upper
rear deck and the main deck of the ship. The wooden planks creak under your
weight, and with every slight and not so slight sea wave.  Looking down over
the length of the ship, you can see some cabins at the centre of the ship,
with a section of the ship just beyond that submerged in water.  The bow of
the ship rears out of the water at the far end, but it seems impossible to
get there.  Looking down the length of the ship you see two cabins, and
between them an alley leading to the other half of the ship.

312.name: Lower Rear Deck
desc: "   You are between two cabins.  Behind you there are some steps leading up
to the rear deck.  The deck on which you stand is halfway between the upper
rear deck and the main deck of the ship. The wooden planks creak under your
weight, and with every slight and not so slight sea wave.  Looking down over
the length of the ship, you can see some cabins at the centre of the ship,
with a section of the ship just beyond that submerged in water.  The bow of
the ship rears out of the water at the far end, but it seems impossible to
get there.  Looking over the edge of the ship, you carefully hold onto the
decaying rails.  You cannot see anything but some fish jumping at the birds
as they swoop down.  Down below, you can see the the entrance of a cabin.
The door has long been blown aside, showing some stairs leading down.

313.name: Upper Cabin Ways
desc: "   You are standing in front of one of the cabins.  The door to the cabin
has long since being blown asunder, what with wind, wave and age.  Looking
inside you can see the outline of a stairs, leading down into the innards
of the ship.  Looking towards the rear of the ship, you can see the double
tiered rear deck, that was characteristic of royal ships in the Before times.
Looking over the railings, you can see the great northern sea wall, against
which the great ocean waves break and lose strength.

314.name: Upper Cabin Ways
desc: "   You are standing at the base of the stairs to the rear decks.  Looking
forward you can see part of the forward decks rising out of the water, but
the passageways inbetween are flooded. Even here the water is up to your
ankles and is making travel treacherous.  To either side you can see two
cabins, more like little huts in the middle of this large deck.  It is
still possible to get to these cabins without having to walk through too
much water.

315.name: Upper Cabin Ways
desc: "   You are standing in front of one of the cabins.  The door to the cabin
has long since being blown asunder, what with wind, wave and age.  Looking
inside you can see the outline of a stairs, leading down into the innards
of the ship.  Looking towards the rear of the ship, you can see the double
tiered rear deck, that was characteristic of royal ships in the Before times.
Looking over the railings, you can see across the harbour, all the way until
your gaze meets the distance belittled southern sea wall.  In between you
can see the great pier as it pierces out from the land into the glass smooth
harbour waters.

316.name: Stairwell
desc: "   You are in a small dark cabin.  There is a stairs leading down to the
decks below.  A little sign above the stairs reads "Crews' Quarters".  There
used to be a swing door on the entrance of the cabin, but the door now hangs
off only one hinge, the door itself resting comfortably, half on the floor.
The stairs looks very dodgy, and it is questionably whether they will hold
your weight.

317.name: Between the Stairwells
desc: "   Water!  You are between the two cabins.  The water is making it very
difficult to breathe, even with the temporary gift of gills.  It is strange
looking at fish from this angle, they no longer look bloated or ungainly,
but smooth and agile.  Looking at the walls to either side, you cannot
understand how they are still standing, so weather beaten that a single
touch would probably collapse them.  Looking back you can see the water
level drop, but towards the front of the ship, water stretches for quite
a distance.

318.name: Stairwell
desc: "   You are in a small dark cabin.  There is a stairs leading down to the
decks below.  A little sign above the stairs reads "Cargo Hold".  There
used to be a swing door on the entrance of the cabin, but the door now hangs
off only one hinge, the door itself resting comfortably, half on the floor.
The stairs looks very dodgy, and it is questionably whether they will hold
your weight.

319.name: Starboard Upper Fore Deck
desc: "   You are on the starboard foredeck.  There really is not a lot to see.
Some small crates where stacked here, the remains of which can be seen.
Looking a little more closely at the crates, you can see that some of
the contents still remain.  Lurking around the crates you can see some
small fish.  They seem harmless enough, small black and white fish, they
do not seem bothered at your presence.
"   Looking more closely at the cargo, you can see that there appears to be
some sort of mealy substance contained within.  There are hundreds of small
little fish hovering around, but they all seem to avoid hanging around the
crates.  Suddenly some movement catches your eye, a huge moray eel is lurking
here.

320.name: Upper Fore Deck
desc: "   You are on what was used to be part of the foredeck of the ship.  Just
ahead you can see some stairs leading up to the bow of the ship.  Standing
here you can see what remains of the stumps of the great masts, the sails
that powered this great ship have long since rotten, but two stumps remain,
indicating where the great beams supported those sails.

321.name: Port Upper Fore Deck
desc: "   You are on the port foredeck.  You can see the remains of one of the
ship's main mast.  It is partly decayed and you can see some small worms
wriggling their way in and out of it.  The water is a little colder here
for some reason, looking over the edge, all you can see are the rocks that
the ships floundered upon.
"   It is a long piece of wood, shaped in what used to be a tall spire, but
now is half rotten, which worms peeking their heads out every now and then.
Looking a little closer, you put your hand down, it is instantly covered
in worms.  You quickly pull it away.

322.name: Out on The Foremast
desc: "   You are at the head of the ship.  The bow has raised itself quite a
distance out of the water.  Looking at the beautiful caricature of a woman
on the mizzen you find it hard to think that the gods let this beautiful
ship come to such a cataclysmic end. But that is the imponderables of gods.
Looking back over the ship, you can see the broken back of the ship, covered
in water, the rear decks rearing out of the water, with the city as a back
drop.  There is a strong salty wind blowing from the bay, though the harbour
waters look as smooth as ever.
"   Looking at the carved statue of the woman, you get the feeling that though
she is smiling, she projects a sadness, a sense of being warped from her
original purpose......

323.name: Sailor's Quarters
desc: "   You are in the sailors' quarters.  The movements of the sea pull you
back and forth.  In the far end of the room you can see the remains of
some hammocks and at the other end there appears to be some cooking
arrangements.  At the moment you are at the entrance to the Captain's
Quarters.  The door still seems to be on its hinges, swinging back and
forth, now and then catching on a still functioning latch. There is a stairs
behind you, leading up to the upper decks.

324.name: Sailor's Quarters
desc: "   You are below decks.  The constant swirling of the sea makes it very
difficult to move about.  It is very cold.  Looking around the cabin you
can see some stone stoves, blackened with soot and fire.  On top of the
stone stoves you can make out some rusted grills and other now useless
cooking utensils, such as knives and some pots.

325.name: Captain's Quarters
desc: "   You are in the Captain's Quarters.  The prominent feature of this room
is the still intact and impressive rear window.  Through the window you
can see many creatures outside.  There is a large desk in the middle of
the room, and behind it, on the floor, you can see the bones of the captain.
The room seems strangely quite, very few fish swim in here, unlike outside.
After seeing the bones, you can't seem to stop shivering.
"   You stare out the window, thousands of little fish swim by, innocently
unaware of your gaze.  The seabed seems to be very rocky, with plenty of
large eels and wow... what a massive crab!!!
"   The bones of the skeleton have been picked clean by the sea.  The
captain must have decided to go down with the ship.  The strangest thing
about the bones is that though they appear untouched the skull is missing.

326.name: Sailor's Quarters
desc: "   You are below decks.  The constant swirling of the sea makes it very
difficult to move about.  It is very cold.  Looking around the cabin you
can see that the sea has taken its toll on the living quarters of the
crewmen.  The room is quite large, in the corner where you are at you
can see the remains of several hammocks hanging between support beams.
The hammocks have long ago rotted away but some threads still hang from
the beams.

327.name: Cargo Hold
desc: "   You are in the cargo hold.  The water is making you feel cold.  Just
in from the stairs a space has been left free of crates.  Everywhere else
you can see crates piled one upon another in an unholy mess.  Ropes that
had held the crates in position during the sea voyage had snapped upon the
ship sinking, resulting in a myriad of crates flying and landing in every
form and shape.  There seems to be a layer of mossy substance on the floor.
"   You are standing in about an inch of some mossy substance.  It swirls
around your feet whenever you move.  Examining some of the nearby crates
you gather that this substance has formed from the rotting and mutation
of the cargo on the ship.  It doesn't seem to be too deep here, but it gets
worse in among the crates.

328.name: Cargo Hold
desc: "   You are amongst a large number of crates.  They tower over you, and crowd
you in from all sides.  The moss on the floor is very thick, there seems
to be something moving over the surface of the moss.  The crates have fallen
in a completely random form, to get anywhere you will have to scramble over
them.

329.name: Cargo Hold
desc: "   You are on top of a small pile of crates.  The water is clearer up here.
Looking around you can see a small hole in the side of the ship to the
south and the stairwell to the east.  Out of the side of your eye you keep
catching something moving between the crates, but it is gone before you
can identify it.

330.name: Cargo Hold
desc: "   You are amongst a large number of crates.  They tower over you, and crowd
you in from all sides.  The moss on the floor is very thick, there seems
to be something moving over the surface of the moss.  The crates have fallen
in a completely random form, to get anywhere you will have to scramble over
them.  You notice that you are alongside one of the walls of the hull.
Testing the wood you gather that it is not very sturdy, and in spots you
can see out, to the water behind, but in the dark you can't make anything
out.

331.name: Cargo Hold
desc: "   You are amongst a large number of crates.  They tower over you, and crowd
you in from all sides.  The moss on the floor is very thick, there seems
to be something moving over the surface of the moss.  The crates have fallen
in a completely random form, to get anywhere you will have to scramble over
them.  The crates don't seem very steady to the east, you'll have to watch
your step.

332.name: Cargo Hold
desc: "   You are amongst a large number of crates.  They tower over you, and crowd
you in from all sides.  The moss on the floor is very thick, there seems
to be something moving over the surface of the moss.  The crates have fallen
in a completely random form, to get anywhere you will have to scramble over
them.  You notice that you are alongside one of the walls of the hull.
Testing the wood you gather that it is not very sturdy, and in spots you
can see out, and behind a nearby crate you can spot a hole large enough for
you to get out through.

333.name: Sea Bed
desc: "   You are outside of the ship.  There is a large hole in the hull just to
the west.  The currents are quite strong here, swirling around the edge
of the ship.  Through the murky water you can see that this area of the
harbour is very rocky, with large fronds of kelp waving in the currents.
The ship itself seems to have landed on a large rocky outcrop, forcing the
rear end of the ship up, breaking the back of the ship.  The waters around
the ship are teeming with life, there are crabs and other large fish, eels
and the odd small shark.

334.name: Sea Bed
desc: "   You are alongside the outside of the ship's hull.  The currents are
quite strong here, swirling around the edge of the ship.  Through the murky
water you can see that this area of the harbour is very rocky, with large
fronds of kelp waving in the currents.  The ship has had its keel broken
upon landing on a large rocky outcrop.  You could explore the around the
outcrop, as it lies within easy reach.

335.name: Sea Bed
desc: "   You are in amongst the rocky outcrop.  It is very dangerous here, most
of the surface of the outcrop is covered in loose shale and where the shale
is absent seaweed has taken its place.  There are massive fronds of kelp
growing here, the branches holding the kelp to the rock must be at least a
foot in thickness.  Looking up you can see the underside of the ship.  It
was cracked like an eggshell, the keel simply snapped.  In the gap you can
see crates piled heavily upon each other, the ones at the bottom crushed
almost beyond recognition.  Just ahead there is a darker section to the
outcrop, two large rocks shadow this small inlet, the strong sea current
rushes through, whipping up the dirt and rocks from the sea floor, hiding
everything from view.

336.name: Sea Bed
desc: "   You are outside of the ship.  There is a large hole in the hull leading
back inside.  The currents are quite strong here, swirling around the edge
of the ship.  Through the murky water you can see that this area of the
harbour is very rocky, with large fronds of kelp waving in the currents.
The ship itself seems to have landed on a large rocky outcrop, forcing the
rear end of the ship up, breaking the back of the ship.  The waters around
the ship are teeming with life, there are crabs and other large fish, eels
and the odd small shark.

337.name: Sea Bed
desc: "   You are out on the seabed.  You are now quite a distance away and in
the dark waters the ship is often hidden from view by the waving kelp.
It is very rocky here and the currents are very strong as they whip around
the rock formations.  Looking up you can make out the surface of the water,
it actually isn't as far away as it appeared, when shadowed by the old ship.
The fish seem to be larger this far out from the ship.

338.name: Sea Bed
desc: "   You are out on the seabed.  You are now quite a distance away and in
the dark waters the ship is often hidden from view by the waving kelp.
It is very rocky here and the currents are very strong as they whip around
the rock formations.  Looking up you can make out the surface of the water,
it actually isn't as far away as it appeared, when shadowed by the old ship.
Looking up you can make out the wake of a large ship as it leaves the
harbour for the seas outside.  You can almost feel the beating of the oars,
the breaking of the waves across its bow.

339.name: Swimming Near the Surface
desc: "   You are out upon the sea, the waves are quite mild, hardly hampering
your efforts at swimming.  Nearby you can make out the sunken ship and
beyond that the northern sea wall.  In the distance you can make out the
twin towers at the entrance to the harbour, the piers to the south
and beyond those the wharf.

340.name: A Cave under the Ship
desc: "   You are in a dark cave formed by the keel of the ship and the rocks all
around.  The water rushes from outside, under the ship and beyond, but you
can't fit through the sea's exit.  You can see that there are a large number
of small fish resident here.  The constant flow of the sea water carries
food in plenty for these little fish.  At your entrance the fish all dart
away, hiding among the many crevices.

341.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in a dark labyrinth.  The place seems to be full of pillers
and walls.  It is very dark and cold.  Every now and then you hear a
scurrying, accompanied by a scraping noise, as if the rats down here have
claws of steel.  The walls seem to guide you in directions and yet the
pillars offer you a whole range of choices, the entire place is a dichotomy
of purposes, freedom and constriction.

342.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in a dark labyrinth.  The place seems to be full of pillers
and walls.  It is very dark and cold.  Every now and then you hear a
scurrying, accompanied by a scraping noise, as if the rats down here have
claws of steel.  The walls seem to guide you in directions and yet the
pillars offer you a whole range of choices, the entire place is a dichotomy
of purposes, freedom and constriction.

343.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in a dark labyrinth.  The place seems to be full of pillers
and walls.  It is very dark and cold.  The walls seem to guide you in
directions and yet the pillars offer you a whole range of choices,
the entire place is a dichotomy of purposes, freedom and constriction.
There is a gentle breeze coming from somewhere, but you cannot ascertain
where.  It carries a faint scent of roasting meat, it makes you feel
hungry.

344.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in a dark labyrinth.  The place seems to be full of pillers
and walls.  It is very dark and cold.  Every now and then you hear a
scurrying, accompanied by a scraping noise, as if the rats down here have
claws of steel.  The walls seem to guide you in directions and yet the
pillars offer you a whole range of choices, the entire place is a dichotomy
of purposes, freedom and constriction.

358.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in a dark labyrinth.  The place seems to be full of pillers
and walls.  It is very dark and cold.  The walls seem to guide you in
directions and yet the pillars offer you a whole range of choices,
the entire place is a dichotomy of purposes, freedom and constriction.
There is a gentle breeze coming from somewhere, but you cannot ascertain
where.  It carries a faint scent of roasting meat, it makes you feel
hungry.

359.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in a dark labyrinth.  The place seems to be full of pillers
and walls.  It is very dark and cold.  The walls seem to guide you in
directions and yet the pillars offer you a whole range of choices,
the entire place is a dichotomy of purposes, freedom and constriction.
There is a gentle breeze coming from somewhere, but you cannot ascertain
where.  It carries a faint scent of roasting meat, it makes you feel
hungry.  Up ahead you can almost sense a lightening in the darkness,
but with all these pillars there seems to be multiple ways of getting
there, this is all very confusing.

360.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in a dark labyrinth.  The place seems to be full of pillers
and walls.  It is very dark and cold.  The walls seem to guide you in
directions and yet the pillars offer you a whole range of choices,
the entire place is a dichotomy of purposes, freedom and constriction.

363.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in a dark labyrinth.  The place seems to be full of pillers
and walls.  It is very dark and cold.  The walls seem to guide you in
directions and yet the pillars offer you a whole range of choices,
the entire place is a dichotomy of purposes, freedom and constriction.
There is a gentle breeze coming from somewhere, but you cannot ascertain
where.  It carries a faint scent of roasting meat, it makes you feel
hungry.  Up ahead you can almost sense a lightening in the darkness,
but with all these pillars there seems to be multiple ways of getting

364.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in a dark labyrinth.  The place seems to be full of pillers
and walls.  It is very dark and cold.  The walls seem to guide you in
directions and yet the pillars offer you a whole range of choices,
the entire place is a dichotomy of purposes, freedom and constriction.
There is a gentle breeze coming from somewhere, but you cannot ascertain
where.  It carries a faint scent of roasting meat, it makes you feel
hungry.

365.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in a small alcove.  There seems to be a rune written on the
wall.  There appears to be only one exit.  The smell of roast meat is
very strong here, its making you deliriously hungry at the very scent of
it.  Looking more closely at the wall, you can see a small hole, about
a finger-width in size.
After scraping away the dust, coughing a little, you can make out that
the rune is one of the more common ones, warning you of mortal danger!

366.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in a small alcove.  There seems to be a rune written on the
wall.  There appears to be only one exit.  The smell of roast meat is
very strong here, its making you deliriously hungry at the very scent of
it.  Looking more closely at the wall, you can see a small hole, about
a finger-width in size.
After scraping away the dust, coughing a little, you can make out that
the rune is one of the more common ones, warning you of mortal danger!

desc: "   You are in a small alcove.  There seems to be a rune written on the

After scraping away the dust, coughing a little, you can make out that

368.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in a dark labyrinth.  The place seems to be full of pillers
and walls.  It is very dark and cold.  The walls seem to guide you in
directions and yet the pillars offer you a whole range of choices,
the entire place is a dichotomy of purposes, freedom and constriction.
There is a gentle breeze coming from somewhere, but you cannot ascertain
where.  It carries a faint scent of roasting meat, it makes you feel
hungry.

369.name: " The Deepest Catacombs
desc: "   You are in the centre of a great hall.  There are three figures looking
in towards a blazing cylinder of flame.  The scent of burning flesh is
overwhelming.  Ugh!!! You feel sick, that roasting meat smell was the
smell of burning flesh!!  Looking, with shielded eyes, you can see a dark
figure standing within the flame, kept there by some fearsome magic.  The
three hooded figures turn to you.  They are clad in a silvery cloak, lined
with black velvet.  You cannot ascertain what race they are but they seem
to radiate a homely aura, comforting, calming, relaxing you.  You feel
as you could go to sleep.... suddenly you are awakened by the screams of
the imprisoned figure.  A scream that came from the soul and that pierces
the soul.
"   You look more closely at the blazing flame.  You cannot make out the
figure prisoned within but the constant murmuring of the three cloaked
figures indicates that without them the flame would fail, and the
soul within released.

370.name: A mountain trail
desc: "   You are walking along the edge of a volcanic mountain.  Just ahead you
can see a small cave leading into the mountain.  The snow is very thick
here and you are feeling very chilled.  Looking about across the mountain
range, you can barely make out the sea, both to the south and north.  Over
to the west you know the city exists but no evidence of this is apparent
from this view.

371.name: A Small Cave
desc: "   You are in a small cave, it is about twelve feet across at the widest.
There are what, appears to be,  scratches along the floor of the cave.  The
cave is lovely and warm due to what must be warm air coming from the
active heart of the volcano.  There is a strange smell in the air, but
you cannot make out what it reminds you of.  Looking out the cave's
entrance you can see the billowing snow as it falls incessantly.
Considering how cold it is out there, and still is in here, the warmer
depths of the cave seem tempting.

372.name: A Warm Cave
desc: "   The cave has widened out substantially.  You can still see some
tracks in the floor.  The cave is much warmer now.  Looking back towards
the entrance of the cave, you can see some snow gently falling, covering
any tracks leading to the cave.  Looking deeper into the cave, you can
see a widening of the cave.

373.name: A Hot cave
desc: "   The cave has widened out substantially.  You can still see some
tracks in the floor.  There are many more tracks now than before, most
of them leading either to the north or south.  Looking along the trail
of scratch marks, you can see two smaller caves branching off this large
basin of a cave.  Looking deeper still into the cave, you can make out
a small cave in the distance, the apparent source of the heat.  The cave
is significantly warmer now than outside.

374.name: A Very Hot Cave
desc: "   The cave has narrowed quite a bit, almost as narrow now as the entrance.
You can still see some heavy markings on the floor.  There are many more
scratches now than before.  Following their lead, you espy a small opening
leading into a very hot lake of lava.  The heat is tremendous.  Backing
away slightly from the great heat, you can see the cave widening behind you
and then narrowing before slanting upwards to what appears to be the exit.

375.name: The Treasure Room
desc: "   You are in the dragon's treasure room.  You can see some gems and
thousands of gold coins lying in small piles around the room.  In the
back of the room you can see an even greater pile than all the others
put together.  There is enough gold here to look to buy an entire island
Looking carefully around the piles of gold, you see a sleeping dragon,
or rather hear than see.  He is meant to be guarding the gold, but most
of the treasure is guarded more securely by the spells he's cast.  Maybe
with some luck you can find some he's missed, and get away with it.
"   There is a fortune just waiting here to be collected.  Dragons aren't
particularly greedy, but considering their communal nature and their
immense lifespans, it would be hard not to collect some wealth over the
years.  Looking carefully around the piles, you can spot armor, deathswords,
weapons so powerful that you could take down a wyvern in a single blow,
armor that could protect you from even a hero's blow, but all protected
by dragons.

376.name: Scrapings Room
desc: "   You are in the room where all the dragons come to scrape their lose
scales off, and to scratch each other.  It is all very civilised, the
elders of the nest will not allow their home to become filthied by the
scrapings of younger dragons.  The young dragons who shed a lot of scales
find this a place to which they can come, away from their elders' gaze.
True to form, you can see a couple of dragons playing with each other, in
a game designed to remove their scales in a very playful manner!!!  As you
walk in, the young dragons continue to play and court each other, ignoring
you totally as you walk around the piles of scrapped scales.
"   Looking at the piles of old scales, you can see why they've been discarded.
They are all broken and shattered.  Testing the scales you can see that they
are brittle but still unbelievably hard.  Maybe they would be more malleable
if you could get one just recently discarded.  You continue searching but
to no avail.

377.name: A Lava Lake
desc: "   You are on a boiling lava lake, you are getting slowly burnt to a crisp,
and not too subtly at that.  Looking about you can see some dragons nesting
in the rock formations above.  They are impressive, these massive creatures
resting so gently and comfortably on ledges so small as to be narrow for
even an elf.  The bubbling of the lava fills the air with a sulphurous
smell which is burning your nose and mouth.  Looking around, as well as
you can in this inferno, you can spot a small rocky island in the middle
of the lake, and what appears to be another cave, to the south.  Wow!!! one
of the dragons just took off, soaring high into the air, and out through
the top of the volcano, majestic, beautiful.

378.name: Hatchery
desc: "   You are in the hatchery of the dragons.  Dragon eggs are born in lava
and it is in lava that they must hatch, the hot boiling lava hardening
the dragonlets scales as they grow.  Looking around the cave, you can
see several carved ledges, suitable in size for dragons to sit comfortably
and watch their eggs and young ones grow.  Overlooking the hatchery is
an old dragon, but not so old that she is unable to defend her charges.
For to her the future security of the dragon nest is entrusted.  She looks
at you cautiously, not hoping to provoke a confrontation, but ready to
finish one if you start it.
"  You examine the ledges.  These are not natural, the stone curves in such
a way as to facilitate the curvature of the dragons claws.  The ledges are
also located at such a height that the dragons can easily sit and watch
without fear of hitting the ceiling of the cave.

379.name: A Lava Island
desc: "   You are on a rocky island in the middle of the lake.  It is not so
fiercely hot here, but the sulphurous gases are just as poisonous.  In the
middle of this island there is a small rock outcrop, upon which there
stands an old dragon, its once golden scales, now reddened with age.  Its
baleful eyes glare at you, sizing you up, dismissing you as threat.  Slowly
the great dragon moves to a different resting position.  Behind him you can
see, suspended in the air, the breastplate of a glowing suit of armor.
This must be part of the armor of the ancient hero Farrell.  The old dragon
notes your gaze and chuckles to himself, as if to dare you to try and take
it by force.
"   Cuchulann is one of the oldest dragons in the world, and definitely the
eldest of this dragons' nest.  He has a reputation for treating lesser
creatures with some degree of care, even to talking to them.  Cuchulann's
treasure trove is beyond count, carefully protected by magical spells, but
his greatest treasure is that of Farrell's armour, the one mortal that
Cuchulann respected in both might and intelligence.  This breastplate
was never won in battle, but given, and as such is displayed in pride of
place, near Cuchulann's favourite resting point.

380.name: Outcast's Cave
desc: "   You are in a small dark cave.  There is a musty smell to the air and
the cave reverberates with the crashing of the waves against the cliffs
below.  In one corner you can see a messy pile of half-eaten rabbits and
squirrels.  There are a few old rotten-looking scales strewn around the
cave floor.  Looking at them more closely you can see that they are covered
in sores and wormholes.  From the entrance of the cave you can see over
the cliffs, looking south across the city and to the ocean beyond.

381.name: Cliff's Edge
desc: "   You are on a sheer cliff face.  Fortunately the bushes are well rooted, or
else you would be having a long fall down to the rocks below and the crashing
waves.  The wind is fiercely cold, it pushes you away from the cliff with every
gust.  There is a narrow ledge visible, if you are lucky you may be able to
swing over and reach the ledge.

382.name: Cliff's Edge
desc: "   You are on a sheer cliff face.  Fortunately the bushes are well rooted, or
else you would be having a long fall down to the rocks below and the crashing
waves.  The wind is fiercely cold, it pushes you away from the cliff with every
gust.  The top of the cliff is not very far away.

383.name: On A Narrow Ledge
desc: "   You are on a narrow ledge.  There seems to be an entrance to a cliff cave
formation.  Further down the cliff you can see an underground river spill out
of a cliff cave.  The inside of the cave is very dark, you can hear movement.
The only way off the ledge would be to enter the cave or else try to climb the
cliff.

384.name: A Ledge
desc: "   You are on a narrow ledge.  The room is very dark, and if it were not for
the meagre light and your abilities it would be impossible to discern the
stalactites and stalagmites that form the interior of this massive cave.  Even
the ledge you are on is formed from the bottom of an underground river bed.  The
cave is full of small and large ledges, but the numerous glistening stalactites
and stalagmites block your view.  All around the ledge are deep gorges with the
sound of rushing waters rising to your ears.

385.name: Inside a dark cave
desc: "   You are on a narrow ledge.  The room is very dark.  In the dark you can
detect a gentle glow coming from the rock formations.  You can sense that there
is something large moving in the dark but you cannot make it out, you cannot
sense anything more than a few feet away.  All around the ledge are deep gorges
with the sound of rushing waters rising to your ears.  It is quite cold.  Nearby
you can see a large stalactite that has fallen across the ledge, making a small
and very narrow bridge to some of the ledges across the gorge.  The stone
bridges looking sturdy but very slippy.

386.name: A Narrow Rock Bridge
desc: "   You are standing amongst several large formations of stalactites and
stalagmites.  It is amazing the way the light can fall upon these formations,
making them look like other things, for example one formation here looks like
a small upside down city, with towers and domes, and small houses.  It looks
extremely lifelike.  About the pillars you can see some evidence that this
ledge is occupied by something.

387.name: Wyvern Perch
desc: "   You are standing amongst several large formations of stalactites and
stalagmites.  It is amazing the way the light can fall upon these formations,
making them look like other things, for example one formation here looks like
a small upside down city, with towers and domes, and small houses.  It looks
extremely lifelike.  About the pillars you can see some evidence that this
ledge is occupied by something.  Looking around the pillars you can see some
books, human books.  Looking at the spines, you can make out some of the titles,
most are books on psychology and inter-species relationship in Endar and on
other continents.  The books are in very bad condition, some with clawmarks
puncturing completely through the books.

extra.desc: "   You have slipped off the edge of the ledge, down into the roaring river below.
"   You slip off the edge of the ledge, down into the freezing water below.

388.name: Among the Stalagmites
desc: "   You are standing amongst several large formations of stalactites and
stalagmites.  It is amazing the way the light can fall upon these formations,
making them look like other things, for example one formation here looks like
a large waterfall, the slivers and riverlets of limestone pouring over a small
rock shelf, and the glistening minerals and constant skin of water cause the
small amount of light available to make the waterfall glisten and flicker.
Several of the smaller stalagmites have been broken, someone has been here
before, but there is no way to say how recently.

389.name: Among the Stalagmites
desc: "   You are standing amongst several large formations of stalactites and
stalagmites.  It is amazing the way the light can fall upon these formations,
making them look like other things.  A lot of the stalagtites have been broken,
most of the others seem to be adorned with pieces of battered armor, and sundry
weapons.  Looking at the collection you can see Chressican swords, Arandian
armour, even some battered Endarian crystal armour.  Some superb warrior lives
here, and takes pride in all the champions he has defeated.

extra.desc: "   You slip of the narrow ledge of stalactites, into the freezing river below.
"  You have slipped off the edge of the ledge, down into the roaring river below.

390.name: The Feeding Area
desc: "   This room is well lit, the luminescent minerals are much more prominent here
than at the entrance to the caves.  The sound of rushing water roars from below.
You can see dozens of large birds pulling at a large pile of meat in the centre
of the room, there is a ferocity in their feeding.  Every now and then a wyvern
returns from the hunt and having fed earlier swoops in and jettisons the
remainder of his hunt in the pile, sometimes missing the pile and hitting one
of the feeding birds, causing an immediate struggle as others try to grab the
fresh meat.  Several of the feeding wyvern look at you but with all the ready
food available probably decide that you're not worth the trouble.  Looking
beyond the immediate area into the dim distance, you see ranks upon ranks of
stalactites and in every formation, and on several of the possible perches you
can see large wyverns, sleeping or resting.

391.name: North Western Section of Fighting Arena
desc: "   You are in a large natural arena.  There is a centre stalactite which
forms a huge solid pillar from the top of the cavern to the bottom.  There
is also a ring of small stalagmites surrounding this large central pillar.
These smaller stalagmites have had their tops knocked off and form simple
stools.  The area between the seats and the central pillar has been covered in
leaves and chippings.  In the arena you see young warriors battling each other
or together against older wyvern.  The ferocity of the battle belies the idea
that they are only training.  Now and then a young adult collapses from his
wounds.  He is quickly removed from the arena, and dissappears into the
distance.

392.name: North Eastern Section of Fighting Arena
desc: "   You are in a large natural arena.  There is a centre stalactite which
forms a huge solid pillar from the top of the cavern to the bottom.  There
is also a ring of small stalagmites surrounding this large central pillar.
These smaller stalagmites have had their tops knocked off and form simple
stools.  The area between the seats and the central pillar has been covered in
leaves and chippings.  In the arena you see young warriors battling each other
or together against older wyvern.  The ferocity of the battle belies the idea
that they are only training.  Now and then a young adult collapses from his
wounds.  He is quickly removed from the arena, and dissappears into the
distance.

393.name: Meeting Area
desc: "   This room is well lit, the luminescent minerals are much more prominent here
than at the entrance to the caves.  There are several creatures here, just
sitting, talking to each other in a strange language.  You can recognise the
females of the breed, they are slightly smaller and the claws are smaller, but
their plumage is much more colourful, whereas the males are larger and more
vicious looking, with a pronounced bony crest running from their foreheads down
to the base of their necks.  In the air above you can see two wyvern, a male
and a female, circling each other, screeching and clawing at each other.  Some
of the younger wyvern, not yet having the fine plumage of the females or the
strength of body or mind of the mails, look on the circling couple intently.

394.name: South Western Section of Fighting Arena
desc: "   You are in a large natural arena.  There is a centre stalactite which
forms a huge solid pillar from the top of the cavern to the bottom.  There
is also a ring of small stalagmites surrounding this large central pillar.
These smaller stalagmites have had their tops knocked off and form simple
stools.  The area between the seats and the central pillar has been covered in
leaves and chippings.  In this section of the arena you see two older warriors
fighting in a duel, there are several elders watching the dual from across a
narrow gap in the plateau.  The warriors are not pulling any punches, you can
spot several rips in wings, blood spilling wounds.

395.name: South Eastern Section of Fighting Arena
desc: "   You are in a large natural arena.  There is a centre stalactite which
forms a huge solid pillar from the top of the cavern to the bottom.  There
is also a ring of small stalagmites surrounding this large central pillar.
These smaller stalagmites have had their tops knocked off and form simple
stools.  The area between the seats and the central pillar has been covered in
leaves and chippings.  In the arena you see young warriors battling each other
or together against older wyvern.  The ferocity of the battle belies the idea
that they are only training.  Now and then a young adult collapses from his
wounds.  He is quickly removed from the arena, and dissappears into the
distance.

396.name: The Elders' Perch
desc: "   You are on a small perch.  This ledge is separated from the main bulk of
the cave by a narrow gorge, about two human man-lengths in width.  You are not
alone, there are several elders here with you, they are no longer the mighty
fighting beasts that they were of old, but a strong sense of intelligence and
controlled belligerence enamates from their eyes.  Looking up higher you can
make out another ledge, and you guess that that is where the high elder lives.
There are several meals left un-eaten here, the elders too busy looking at the
games below.

397.name: The High Perch
desc: "   You are on a high ledge, from here you can see over the entire wyvern nest.
The training arena, the minor ledges occupied by the mightier elders, the gorges
and the rushing waters underneath.  Far off you can see where the young adults
guard the entrance from hidden alcoves.  On this high perch you can see several
amazing treasures and magical items, there are several crystal cones, white
silk cloaks and other obviously valuable items.  There are also the remains of
several meals and the droppings of the elder wyvern.  Obviously the old wyvern
no longer leaves his perch but gets everything delivered and cleaned away.  The
perch is lit by an abundance of the luminous minerals that provide the meagre
lighting in the caves.

398.name: Among some rocks
desc: "   You are just above the base of a large rockfall.  The rockfall leads all the
way up to a higher ledge, providing plenty of handholds.  It is very dark but
the rocks have been covered with the glowing minerals that are found elsewhere
in the cavern.  The rocks don't seem to be as slippy or as loose as some you
have found elsewhere at the bottom of gorges.

400.name: Castle Gatehouse
desc: "   You are at the entrance of the guardhouse.  You are surrounded by the
thick walls that comprise the castle's first line of defense.  The walls
are at least six feet thick, of solid granite, and tower up for at least
fifthy, in parts a hundred feet.  Just ahead you can see the gatehouse itself,
with the soldiers on guard.  Encrusted all around the portculli are runic
stones, tended by the castle's mages.  Whispers in the street speak of the
mages dispelling all magic of those who enter, though no-one can ever prove
it, true or not.  There is a large sign in front of you.
"   Due to recent unwanted incursions and due to the presence of the several
valuable items now on loan to Endar, all visitor's to the Castle must have
written invitations.  All other visitors will be prevented from entering.
By the order of
The Chancellor of Endar

401.name: Castle Gatehouse
desc: "   You are in the gatehouse, at the portcullus itself.  There is a gentle
hum from the mages, as they continuously activate the stones surrounding
you.  You know now that any spells that people try to bring with them, never
get past this gate.  Just ahead you can see the guards checking peoples' names
off a list.  The guards are watching everyone warily, like eagles.  One
citizen who had just been refused permission to enter, protest, and was
quickly, and forcibly, removed from the gatehouse.

402.name: Castle Gatehouse
desc: "   You are the edge of the courtyard, the noise of the gatehouse is muted
a little now.  Ahead you can see the courtyard with training soldiers, and
beyond that the castle itself.  Looking towards the gatehouse you can see
a little path, leading south, behind the guards.  They are obviously not
too concerned about those leaving, giving them only a perfunctory check,
to ensure they are not carrying any valuables.

403.name: Prince's Laboratory
desc: "   You are in the laboratory at the top of the tower, it is here that
the prince practices the skill at which he excels and which has taken
his sanity.  There are flasks of luminescent green standing side by
side with flasks of glowing blue and radiant red.  There is a large
conglomeration of glass tubes and bubbling beakers.  There are several
flasks of different colours feeding this network, then the liquids
are being heated and recombined into a mysterious multi-coloured hue
in the final beaker.  The final beaker is being filled drop by slow
drop.

404.name: Falling down the Cliff
desc: "   You are falling down the side of the cliff.  You twist and turn trying to
control your fall.  You pull at the few bushes, having no more success than
having a few leaves accompany you as you fall down.  Glancing down you can
see a small cove.  The cove is protected upon three sides by the huge cliffs,
but if you land there, though you may survive... you may never escape.
"   You continue falling, the sea is rushing towards you at a fierce rate.  With
a final twist of your body you manage to bounce off the cliff wall and into the
sea... SPLASH!!!!!!.. slowly you drag yourself to the shore.

405.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You are in the courtyard in front of the castle.  Behind you, the outer
wall of the castle looms high above.  Looking towards the gatehouse, in the
centre of the wall, there seems to be a heavy guard presence.  Looking
around the courtyard you can see several training soldiers with their yard
sergeants bellowing out orders.  The soldiers are too busy to pay any
attention to the many people milling in the courtyard.  Looking at the
castle you can see a centre dome, with four tall minarets at the corners.
These towers loom high above the walls, with pennants fluttering at their
peaks.

406.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You are in the courtyard in front of the castle.  Behind you, the outer
wall of the castle looms high above.  Looking towards the gatehouse, in the
centre of the wall, there seems to be a heavy guard presence.  Looking
around the courtyard you can see several training soldiers with their yard
sergeants bellowing out orders.  The soldiers are too busy to pay any
attention to the many people milling in the courtyard.  Looking at the
castle you can see a centre dome, with four tall minarets at the corners.
These towers loom high above the walls, with pennants fluttering at their
peaks.

407.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You are in the courtyard in front of the castle.  Behind you, the outer
wall of the castle looms high above.  Looking towards the gatehouse, in the
centre of the wall, there seems to be a heavy guard presence.  Looking
around the courtyard you can see several training soldiers with their yard
sergeants bellowing out orders.  The soldiers are too busy to pay any
attention to the many people milling in the courtyard.  Looking at the
castle you can see a centre dome, with four tall minarets at the corners.
These towers loom high above the walls, with pennants fluttering at their
peaks.

408.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You are in the courtyard.  Behind you, the castle wall shields this
square from the noise of the city outside.  Looking around the courtyard
you can see several training soldiers with their yard sergeants bellowing
out orders.  The soldiers are too busy to pay any attention to the many
people milling in the courtyard.  Atop the walls the guards keep a
careful eye on all who enter, and those who remain in the courtyard.

409.name: Along East Wall
desc: "   You are in the courtyard.  Behind you, the castle wall shields this
square from the noise of the city outside.  Looking around the courtyard
you can see several training soldiers with their yard sergeants bellowing
out orders.  The soldiers are too busy to pay any attention to the many
people milling in the courtyard.  Atop the walls the guards keep a
careful eye on all who enter, and those who remain in the courtyard.

410.name: Along East Wall
desc: "   You are walking along the eastern wall of the castle.  To one side is
the tall wall that separates the city from the castle.  To the other is the
castle.  Looking at the castle from this close distance you can see how old
it must be, the granite is weather worn and cracking, and the glass in the
windows has seeped with age, making it very difficult to look inside.  This
path looks less travelled than those in the front of the castle, though
from the sound of marching feet above you, that obviously does not apply to
the walls themselves.

411.name: Along East Wall
desc: "   You are walking along the eastern wall of the castle.  To one side is
the tall wall that separates the city from the castle.  To the other is the
castle.  Looking at the castle from this close distance you can see how old
it must be, the granite is weather worn and cracking, and the glass in the
windows has seeped with age, making it very difficult to look inside.  This
path looks less travelled than those in the front of the castle, though
from the sound of marching feet above you, that obviously does not apply to
the walls themselves.

desc: "   You are walking along the eastern wall of the castle.  To one side is

desc: "   You are walking along the eastern wall of the castle.  To one side is

414.name: Along East Wall
desc: " are walking along the eastern wall of the castle.  To one side is
tall wall that separates the city from the castle.  To the other is the
Looking at the castle from this close distance you can see how old
must be, the granite is weather worn and cracking, and the glass in the
has seeped with age, making it very difficult to look inside.  This
looks less travelled than those in the front of the castle, though
from the sound of marching feet above you, that obviously does not apply to
the walls themselves.

415.name: Along North Wall
desc: "   You are in the north-eastern corner of the castle grounds.  There is
not a lot to see here.  There is a strong smell of rotting vegetation and
bird droppings, the janitors don't get here too often. To the west, you
can make out a large hedge, with some tall trees behind that.  Looking
up you can see the edge of one of the corner towers, you can't make
out the emblem on the flag at this angle.

416.name: Along North Wall
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the castle.  Before you there is a tall
hedge.  It is thick and thorny and impossible to see through  You are at
base of one of the tall corner towers that decorate the castle.  It
stretches way up.  A gray flag with the symbol of a sword and hammer.  You
can here the beating of cold steel on stone.  This tower is obviously the
armoury, where the best armour and weapons of all Endar are made and held
for use by the citys defenders.

417.name: Along North Wall
desc: "   You are standing at the back of the castle.  Before you there is a tall
hedge.  It is thick and thorny and impossible to see through  You are at
base of one of the tall corner towers that decorate the castle.  It
stretches way up.  A golden flag with the symbol of two hands and a diamond
are visible, there is another symbol on the flag which you can not make out
due to the fluttering of the flag in the wind.

418.name: Along North Wall
desc: "   You are in the north western corner of the castle grounds.  Looking
eastward you can see a small path leading to a large hedge.  Looking
south you can see all along the western wall of the castle itself and
the protecting wall.  It looks dark and dismal.

419.name: Along East Wall
desc: "   You are walking along the western wall of the castle.  To one side is
the tall wall that separates the city from the castle.  To the other is the
castle.  Looking at the castle from this close distance you can see how old
it must be, the granite is weather worn and cracking.  Standing on your toes
you can barely reach the windows, but all you can see are corridors upon
corridors.  From above you can hear the sound of marching feet.

420.name: Along East Wall
desc: "   You are walking along the western wall of the castle.  To one side is
the tall wall that separates the city from the castle.  To the other is the
castle.  Looking at the castle from this close distance you can see how old
it must be, the granite is weather worn and cracking.  Standing on your toes
you can barely reach the windows, but all you can see are corridors upon
corridors.  From above you can hear the sound of marching feet.

Looking at the castle from this close distance you can see how old

From above you can hear the sound of marching feet.

424.name: Along the East Wall
desc: "   You are in the courtyard.  Behind you, the castle wall shields this
square from the noise of the city outside.  Looking around the courtyard
you can see several training soldiers with their yard sergeants bellowing
out orders.  The soldiers are too busy to pay any attention to the many
people milling in the courtyard.  Atop the walls the guards keep a
careful eye on all who enter, and those who remain in the courtyard.

425.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You are in the courtyard.  Behind you, the castle wall shields this
square from the noise of the city outside.  Looking around the courtyard
you can see several training soldiers with their yard sergeants bellowing
out orders.  The soldiers are too busy to pay any attention to the many
people milling in the courtyard.  Atop the walls the guards keep a
careful eye on all who enter, and those who remain in the courtyard.

426.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You are in the courtyard in front of the castle.  Behind you, the outer
wall of the castle looms high above.  Looking towards the gatehouse, in the
centre of the wall, there seems to be a heavy guard presence.  Looking
around the courtyard you can see several training soldiers with their yard
sergeants bellowing out orders.  The soldiers are too busy to pay any
attention to the many people milling in the courtyard.  Looking at the
castle you can see a centre dome, with four tall minarets at the corners.
These towers loom high above the walls, with pennants fluttering at their
peaks.

427.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You are in the courtyard in front of the castle.  Behind you, the outer
