careful eye on all who enter, and those who remain in the courtyard.

434.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You are standing along the castle's front wall.  It is a very majestic
castle, with minarets, flags, and tall walls.  Looking at the walls more
closely you can see slits cut into the wall, for archers.  To your side you
can look more closely at the western tower.  Looking at the pattern of
windows as they circle up the tower, you can ascertain that the stairs
spiral anticlockwise, to hinder any right-handed attackers coming up the
stairs.  The top of the tower is blackened, and the roof looks recently
repaired.

435.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You are standing along the castle's front wall.  It is a very majestic
castle, with minarets, flags, and tall walls.  Looking at the walls more
closely you can see slits cut into the wall, for archers.  The walls are
solid granite, it looks as if no mortar has been used to build the wall,
the blocks seem fused together.  There are some windows halfway up the wall,
narrow slits, reaching up and into the wall.  In times of war, this would
be a formidable fortress.

436.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You are standing in front of the main entrance to the castle.  It is a
great archway, with oak doors.  They are open, and there is a steady stream
of people passing through, under the watchful eye of the guards.  Looking
in, you can see a long, torch-lit hallway.  A gentle breeze floats from
the door, bringing a smell of rich food and home fires.

437.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You are standing along the castle's front wall.  It is a very majestic
castle, with minarets, flags, and tall walls.  Looking at the walls more
closely you can see slits cut into the wall, for archers.  The walls are
solid granite, it looks as if no mortar has been used to build the wall,
the blocks seem fused together.  There are some windows halfway up the wall,
narrow slits, reaching up and into the wall.  In times of war, this would
be a formidable fortress.

438.name: Courtyard
desc: "   You are standing along the castle's front wall.  It is a very majestic
castle, with minarets, flags, and tall walls.  Looking at the walls more
closely you can see slits cut into the wall, for archers.  To your side you
can look more closely at the eastern tower.  Looking at the pattern of
windows as they circle up the tower, you can ascertain that the stairs
spiral anticlockwise, to hinder any right-handed attackers coming up the
stairs.  Looking more closely at the windows, you can see that the bars
seem more designed to keep people in, than out.

439.name: Palace Entrance
desc: "   You are just inside the main entrance to the castle.  The corridor
splits into three here, one to the east, north and west.  To the north
you can see the Great Hall of the castle, to the east and west the
corridors seem to stretch on and on.  The walls here are lit by little
globes of light, held in the mouths of gargoyles.  The shadows cast upon
the gargoyles from the light makes them look alive, and terrifying.

440.name: Royal Halls
desc: "   You are walking along the main hall, leading to the great hall.  There
are pictures along the wall, of great kings and queens of old.  The corridor
is well lit, and there is a thick red carpet lying on top of the cold marble
floor.  There are polished suits of armour lined up along the wall

441.name: The Royal Hallway
desc: "   You are walking along the main hall, leading to the great hall.  There
are pictures along the wall, of great kings and queens of old.  The corridor
is well lit, and there is a thick red carpet lying on top of the cold marble
floor.  There are polished suits of armour lined up along the wall

442.name: The Royal Hallway
desc: "   You are walking along the main hall, leading to the great hall.  There
are pictures along the wall, of great kings and queens of old.  The corridor
is well lit, and there is a thick red carpet lying on top of the cold marble
floor.  There are polished suits of armour lined up along the wall

443.name: Entrance to Great Hall
desc: "   You are in from of the entrance to the great hall.  Two large oak doors
form the entrance.  They are polished so bright that you can see your own
reflection.  A hurried citizen brushes past you, but before entering the
hall he looks at his reflection in the door, adjusts the feather in his hat
and rushes in.  The doors slam shut after him.  The ceremonial guards on
duty smile.  Looking at the guards, they look harmless, their pikes would
no more dent your armor than would a willow reed.

444.name: Library Corridor
desc: "   You are walking along a wide corridor.  Ahead you can see various doors.
At the end of the corridor you can see a corridor crossing it, leading both
ways.  There is a lovely smell wafting down the corridor.  There are few
pictures on these walls, and the red carpet only extends between the entrance
to the great hall and the nearest door.  Looking beyond the great hall, you
can see the red carpet extend much further, all the way down the corridor.

445.name: Library Corridor
desc: "   You are walking along a wide corridor.  Ahead you can see various doors.
There is a lovely smell wafting down the corridor.  There are few
pictures on these walls, and the red carpet only extends between the entrance
to the great hall and the nearest door, which looking in, you ascertain to be
the castle's library.

446.name: Library Corridor
desc: "   You are walking along a wide corridor.  Ahead you can see various doors.
There is a strong smell of cooking meat, and a slight taste in the air of
something burning.  Just ahead there is a junction with another corridor,
and just behind you can still see the entrance to the library.  The floor
here is still marble but the royal carpet does not extend this far down
the corridor.

447.name: Library Corridor
desc: "   You are walking along a wide corridor.  Ahead you can see various doors.
There is a strong smell of cooking meat, and a slight taste in the air of
something burning.  Just ahead there is a junction with another corridor,
and just behind you can still see the entrance to the library.  The floor
here is still marble but the royal carpet does not extend this far down
the corridor.

448.name: Guards Corridor
desc: "   You are just a little to the east of the entrance to the great hall.  To
your side you can see the guard's quarters.  You can hear the sound of swords
being sharpened and armour creaking.  The door is kept wide open, and every
now and then a pair of soldiers leave the room and enter the great hall.
Sometimes you can see them leave again, dragging a stubborn supplicant behind
them.

449.name: Guards Corridor
desc: "   You are now halfway down the corridor leading from the great hall.
There is a nice, red carpet lining the floor.  The walls look well cared
for, and there are pictures of knights fighting dragons, and sailing ships.
Up ahead you can see a junction with another corridor.  The carpet leads
to the south.

450.name: Guards Corridor
desc: "   You are now halfway down the corridor leading from the great hall.
There is a nice, red carpet lining the floor.  The walls look well cared
for, and there are pictures of knights fighting dragons, and sailing ships.
Up ahead you can see a junction with another corridor.  The carpet leads
to the south.

451.name: Guards Corridor
desc: "   You are now at the end of the corridor, just ahead you can see two
corridors leading to the north and south.  The carpet extends only
slightly to the north, but all the way down the southern corridor, as
far as you can see.

452.name: The Base of Southwestern Tower
desc: "   You can go no further, a barricade with a warning sign, blocks the way.
Looking around you can see lumps of rock gathered in piles.  There are
steps leading up the tower, but they are impassable from this approach.
The flickering red light makes everything difficult to recognise, haunting
shadows are cast on the rockfall.

453.name: A Dark Corridor
desc: "   You are halfway down a long corridor.  The pictures on the wall are faded
and dirt covered.  It is impossible to make out any of the pictures.  The
flickering light gives an eerie feel to the place.  The dust is very heavy
here.  Looking up the corridor you can just make out a brighter area.  The
light globes are cracked and broken, and the replacements glow with a deep
red light.  The gargoyles look even more menacing here.  Looking down the
corridor you can make out some steps.

454.name: A Dark Corridor
desc: "   You are halfway down a long corridor.  The pictures on the wall are faded
and dirt covered.  It is impossible to make out any of the pictures.  The
flickering light gives an eerie feel to the place.  The dust is quite heavy
here.  Looking up the corridor you can just make out the entrance hall,
looking the other way, darkness.

455.name: A Dark Corridor
desc: "   You are just to the west of the main entrance to the castle.  Behind you
lies the entrance hall, and in front, a long corridor, dimly lit.  The carpet
here is faded and dirty.  There is a gentle sprinkling of dust everywhere.
Looking down the corridor, you can see that the odd light globe is broken,
and a few others are twinkling.

456.name: A Dark Corridor
desc: "   You are just to the east of the main entrance to the castle.  Behind you
lies the entrance hall, and in front, a long corridor, dimly lit.  The carpet
here is faded and dirty.  There is a gentle sprinkling of dust everywhere.
Looking down the corridor, you can see that the odd light globe is broken,
and a few others are twinkling.

457.name: A Dark Corridor
desc: "   You are halfway down a long corridor.  The pictures on the wall are faded
and dirt covered.  It is impossible to make out any of the pictures.  The
flickering light gives an eerie feel to the place.  The dust is quite heavy
here.  Looking up the corridor you can just make out the entrance hall,
looking the other way, darkness as more and more globes seem broken.

458.name: A Dark Corridor
desc: "   You are halfway down a long corridor.  The pictures on the wall are faded
and dirt covered.  Everything is dirty and dusty.  You can see your own
steps in the dust behind you, but they are quickly covered by the swirling
wind that pervades this corridor.  Looking up ahead you can see the base
of the south eastern tower.

459.name: At the Base of the Southeastern Tower
desc: "   You are the base of the south-eastern tower.  You can see some steps
leading up the tower, but a brick wall has been built, preventing access.
It is very dark here, no light globes seem to be working here.  The brick
wall is a recent addittion, made from mud and mortar, not like the marble
floor.

460.name: Base of the Tower
desc: "   You are the base of the south-eastern tower.  The corridor leading
to the tower looks unused, the carpet is hardly worn, yet it is very
well furnished, with royal carpets.  There are pictures of a young
man upon the wall.  Looking closer at the pictures, you discern a
faint resemblance with that of the current Lord.  There are steps
leading up into the tower here.  There is a closed door just above
them.  It looks locked.

461.name: Prince's Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the southern corridor, along the lovely, soft,
red carpet.  There is a door just along the corridor to the south.  The
pictures on the wall all show a young man, dressed like a prince.  There
is a sense of sadness about the pictures, a wildness in the young mans
eyes and of despair in eyes of those around him.  One picture is different
though, the young man is in the company of several sprites.  Sprites are
never sad, but the young boy radiated happiness and wonder, in such a way
that even this oil painting emits it too.  Looking towards the end of
the corridor, the base of the tower is growing near.

462.name: Prince's Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the southern corridor, along the lovely, soft,
red carpet.  There is a door just along the corridor to the south.  The
pictures on the wall all show a young man, dressed like a prince.  There
is a sense of sadness about the pictures, a wildness in the young mans
eyes and of despair in eyes of those around him.

463.name: Prince's Walk
desc: "   You are at the junction between the main corridor and one of the service
corridors.  There do not seem to be any servants along the corridor
Looking both ways you can see the bases of the two western towers.  Royal
red carpet leads south, and the corridor there is lined with paintings.
The corridor to the north is undecorated except for a simple, now thread-
bare grey carpet

464.name: Armoury Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the northern corridor.  The old carpet does little
to hide the sound of your every step.  In places you can see where the
marble has been scratched by the heavy step of armoured shoes, for looking
ahead, an armoury is the only thing that could warrant the heavy guard
that lies at the northernmost end of the corridor.

465.name: Armoury Walk
desc: "   You are walking along the northern corridor.  The old carpet does little
to hide the sound of your every step.  In places you can see where the
marble has been scratched by the heavy step of armoured shoes, for looking
ahead, an armoury is the only thing that could warrant the heavy guard
that lies at the northernmost end of the corridor.  You are now halfway
between the junction with the Royal Corridor and the base of the tower.

466.name: Armoury Walk
desc: "   You are at the base of the tower.  There are steps leading up to an
iron door.  There are several heavily armed guards watching carefully
anyone who nears the base of the stairs..  These are no ordinary guards
but ogre-like creatures with the strength to crush you in their bare
hands.  There is a door just a little up the stairs.  It seems to be locked.

467.name: Servants' Western Corridor
desc: "   You are at the base of the tower, you can spot an alcove halfway up
the steps leading to the door.  You cannot see what is inside the alcove
if anything.  The door looks very strong, but the steps look well worn.

468.name: Servants' Western Corridor
desc: "   You are nearing the base of the north-western tower.  The letters CBE
are engraved above the entrance, apart from that you can ascertain
nothing about the tower, except that it has a solid oak door.  The noise
of the kitchen gratefully lessens the further up the corridor you are.

469.name: Servants' Western Corridor
desc: "   You are just north of the junction with the Royal Corridor.  There is
a sweet aroma of cooking meat drifting down the corridor from the door
ahead.  The place is very busy with servants, carrying fresh food into
what must be the kitchens.  Now and then you spot the HouseMaster, as he
orders the servants about.

470.name: Servants' Western Corridor
desc: "   You are at the junction between the main corridor and one of the service
corridors.  There are many hurried servants rushing along the corridor
to the north, they seem to avoid going to the south for some reason.
Looking both ways you can see the bases of the two western towers.

471.name: Servants' Western Corridor
desc: "   You are just south of the junction with the main corridor.  Just beside
you is a forbiddingly well built door.  The door is firmly shut.  Looking
through the grills on the door, you can make out a dark dungeon, with all
the smells that come with such a place.  Looking south you can see the
base of the tower more clearly.  There seems to have been some recent
repair work on this part of the corridor.

472.name: Servants' Western Corridor
desc: "   You are near the base of the tower, there is a strange aura about
this place.  You notice that none of the servants even look past the
dungeons to the north, averting their eyes in case they should look
down this way.  You notice a sign near the entrance to the tower, but
from this distance you cannot make out what it says.

473.name: Servants' Western Corridor
desc: "   You are at the base of the south-western tower.  From this vantage
point you do not need to read the notice to ascertain that the castles
magician resides here, and more dangerously that he has taken an
apprentice.  Of all the most dangerous things in the known world, a
training magician, who has the innate power, but no skill, is beyond
compare, even a raging dragon is predictable, but a teenager with
magic!!  There is a door a little up the stairs, it seems to be locked.

474.name: Kitchens
desc: "   You are in the castle's kitchens.  There is a large fire at the other
end of the room.  There are tables of food, meat, and drink.  The servants
are rushing everywhere, trying to escape from the watchful eye of the
cooks.  There is a gorgous smell of cooked meats, and freshly baked
pastries.  This entire room just exudes warmth, and homliness.

475.name: Kitchens
desc: "   You are at the upper end of the kitchen.  There is huge fire here,
radiating heat.  The black cast iron ovens are filled with meats and
breads.  Just behind you there is a small doorway leading into the main
hall, through which the food is delivered for banquets.  Over in one
corner there are several bottles of wine stored for quick use.  There
is a heavily locked door leading to the wine cellar below.  Can't let
the servants near the good wine.

476.name: Chapel of Repose
desc: "   You are in a small chapel, off from the throne room.  There are a
few lines of pews, enough for about ten people to kneel upon.  The
aisle has a thick shimmering blue carpet, leading up to the altar.
There are no pictures on the walls, all the room consists of is
polished marble, some oak pews, a single strip of carpet and the altar.
The room has an aura about it, not specific to any religion, martial
yet peaceful.

477.name: Chapel of Repose
desc: "   You are near the altar.  There is a single ornament on the altar,
it consists of a large ring, and within the ring, three more rings.
The outer ring is a yellow gold, whereas the inner rings are obsidian
black, ivory white, and steel gray.  The three rings are interwined
about each other, and each touches the golden ring just once.  Apart
from that the altar is a dissappointment, it itself is a simple wood
altar, though by the smoke stains, it is very old.

478.name: Library
desc: "   You are in a great room.  The walls are filled with books,
cases upon cases of books.  There are roll-along ladders so that
you can reach all the books.  There are just so many of them.
There is an index hanging on the wall.  Looking down the room,
there is a gentle orange light, a nice warm glow to read by.
"   You reach for the index but a bolt of blue lightning strikes at you, this
book is only for Royal hands.

479.name: Library
desc: "   You are in the Great Library.  There is a large fire here, or
what looks to be a fire.  It gives out great warmth, and a soft
light to read by, but you can see some paper in the fire, and it
doesn't seem to be burning.  You sense that this is a mage tended
fire.  Luckily so, for there is a great treasure here, in all these
books.  Another index lies here.
"   As you reach for the index a bolt of blue lightning strikes at you, burning
your hands, this book is for royal hands only.

480.name: Guard's Quarters
desc: "   You are at the entrance to the guard's quarters.  There is no lock
on this door, the soldiers are always on quick call.  looking in you
can see several types of soldiers, the common guards, well trained and
fierce to fight, the elite guards, very well armed and a look of steel
in their eyes.  The elite guards are the only ones not polishing their
armor, their armor is magically warded to keep it in shape.  The sound
of metal on grinding stone pierces the senses.

481.name: Guard's Quarters
desc: "   You are deep within the guard's quarters.  They are all looking at
you rather suspiciously.  The sound of hammers on armor plate, and
stones grinding the edges of swords sends a shiver down your spine.
There is a small fire in the corner, and several benches, with tankards
on them.  Looking at the tankards, you can sense no alcohol, only
flavoured water for these men.

482.name: Living Room
desc: "   You are in the main living quarters of the royal family.  This is where
the king is a father, the queen a mother, to their children.  There are some
shelves packed with thumbed books and well-used toys.  Across one of the
comfy chairs, a recent copy of the Endarian Times lies discarded.  The room
is lit, not with the ubiquituous globes, but simple candles, that flicker
with every opening of the door.  The room is not pretty or special, just
comfortable.
"   The paper seems to be a recent copy, it is open on an article describing
the recent politicial arguments over trade barriers and the power of the
trading cities.

483.name: Living Room
desc: "   You are in a small comfy room, the room is long and narrow, lit only by
simple candles.  There is not much furniture here, that all seems to be
in the other half of the room.  Much of this half is taken by a spiralling
staircase, leading to the upper floors.  On the floor you can see some
toys that haven't been put away yet.  You can imagine the trouble the guilty
children will be in, if their nannies find out before the toys are put
away.

484.name: Great Hall
desc: "   You are standing by the fireplace.  It is massive, the sound of
wood crackling fills this area of the hall, the heat is blistering
when you get close.  Just to side of the fire, you can see a door,
obviously leading to the kitchens considering the smell escaping
from the room behind.  There is a space cleared of tables around
the fire, with a few comfortable chairs circling the fire.

485.name: Great Hall
desc: "   You stand before the throne, Upon its blue velvet seat sits the Hy
himself.  He looks serenely down at you.  A sense of wisdom and
righteousness enamates from the lord.  With his advisors, a cleric, a
mage, his general, he well deserves the love that all Endarian's have
for him.  There are many guards standing within easy reach of the
throne, no common guards these, but elite members of the palace guard.

486.name: Great Hall
desc: "   You are in one of the corners of the hall. From here you can
appreciate the architecture of the hall, its great domed roof, its
marble floors and the craftsmanship of the globe holders.  From here
you can see two doors.  You can discern one of the doorways to be
that of the castle's private chapel.  The other door is guarded
by two servants, who seem to be more interested in the local gossip
than watching who goes through the door.

487.name: Great Hall
desc: "   You are standing among the tables.  They are old oak, blackened
with age.  Along the tops of the walls, you can see various hunting
birds with light globes in their beaks.  As you walk, each step echoes
through the hall, every creak of leather and metal resounds of the
marble floors and walls.  Looking down the hall you can see the hearth
and a doorway.

488.name: Great Hall
desc: "   Looking around you can see a centre aisle, leading to the throne,
and to either side tables, all ready for a banquet.  Over in one wall,
there is a large open fire, roaring in its hearth.  All around the
hall, there are alcoves in the walls where soldiers and servants can
wait out of sight but within call.  Just ahead you can see the
throne itself with Hy Fiachra himself and his advisors.  The room is
well lit with many globes along the tops of the walls.  The gargoyles
have been replaced with eagles and hawks, and other hunting birds.
In the centre of the hall's domed roof, a huge dragon hangs suspended,
and its claws hangs a great globe, filling the room with a golden glow.
Behind you, the great door lies shut.

489.name: Great Hall
desc: "   You are standing among the tables.  They are old oak, blackened
with age.  Along the tops of the walls, you can see various hunting
birds with light globes in their beaks.  As you walk, each step echoes
through the hall, every creak of leather and metal resounds of the
marble floors and walls.  Looking down the hall you can see two small
doorways.

490.name: Upon Some Stairs
desc: "  You are on the steps up the northwestern tower.  The stairs is quite
narrow, and steep.  Up ahead you can see a yellowish glow.  The tower is very
quiet, apart from the rustling of the winds.  The tower is lit by luminous orbs.
There is also some old carpet on the steps, old and faded but it makes the steps
less cold.

491.name: Upon Some Stairs
desc: "   You are on the steps towards a large room.  The stairs is quite narrow,
and steep.  Up ahead you can see a yellowish glow.  The tower is very quite,
apart from the rustling of the winds.  The tower is lit by luminous orbs.  You
can now make out the sound of clinking coins and the shuffling of paper.

492.name: The Counting Room
desc: "   You are in a large room.  There are several large tables in the room.  At
each table an clerk is counting receipts, and at other tables money is being
counted.  Several large burly guards are present, scanning for any intruders.
They are obviously present due to the large quantities of cash being handled.
In the centre of the room, the master clerk sits and watches his workers,
answering their queries and sorting out any problems.  There is a small window
high up in the room.  It is very stuffy here.

493.name: The Planning Room
desc: "   You are in a small room.  There is no-one here.  The room seems to be
reserved for the display of charts.  There are several charts, each depicting
the trade relationships between the various continents and cities, and Endar.
There is a large deficit with Mythra, but is far exceeded by the trade surpluses
with Arandian cities, Chressport and Norport.  The charts for the Spectral Isles
and Glacia have been highlighted, each is showing a small surplus, but the
overall trade volume is quite low.

494.name: Upon Some Stairs
desc: "   You are on the steps towards a large room.  The stairs is quite narrow,
and steep.  Up ahead you can see a yellowish glow, and the sound of hammers.
The room is dim, lit only by some spluttering torches on the walls, occasionally
spitting some burning grease.
"   You are in a large room, you can see several men working, a great anvil,
buckets of cold water and several rooms leading off.  The man working at the
anvil is extremely muscled, a master of his trade, the others are apparently
his apprentices, learning the secrets.  To the clamour of metal beating metal,
you scan the room more carefully.  There are a large number of weapons and
armour covering the walls.  Beautiful swords and immaculate armours.  You
notice that everything is made using, to some degree, mythran crystal, either
in the hilt of the weapon, or as a component of the blade, even the armour
is laced with the stuff.  As you watch the master, you notice that with every
reheat of the metal, some dust is sprinkled upon the metal and then hammered
into it.  Every now and then, he points some facet of the operation out to his
apprentices.
"    You look at the weapons and armour upon the walls.  Everything is a work
of art, the bloodlines of the swords are exquisitely decorated yet the lines
of flow are never impeded.  The armour has all been careful polished or
burnished, either shining reflections, or a brilliant whiteness.  Some of these
weapons are fit only for heroes.

496.name: The Storeroom
desc: "   You are in a large storeroom.  There are piles of raw metal lumped in one
corner in large piles.  More carefully stored are the bags of crystal.  The bags
are of the smoothest velvet.  There is a strange feel from these uncut crystals
and yet you cannot understand why they are so prevalent in all Endarian armour.
All along one side of the storeroom you can see racks upon racks of swords.
Tugging at one, you cause a great rattling but they are all locked in place.
One of the apprentices glances over at you, scowling.

497.name: The Furnace
desc: "   You are in the furnace room of the tower.  There is a large window to provide
some air and for the smoke to escape.  Looking out the window you can see the
great cables that loop from the towers to the castle itself.  The room is
extremely hot.  There is some sort of machine that constantly blows air into the
furnace, each blast of fresh air causing huge flames to leap out of the furnace
entrance, licking at the air, grasping, before falling back into the coals once
more.  Carefully, you look into the furnace, there appears to be only a few
pieces of metal being worked upon at the moment.
"   The furnace is a great, cast-iron, oven.  There is a chute at the top for
releasing extra coal into the heart of the furnace, and a small machine
periodically forcing fresh air through the coals from the base of the furnace.
With every blast of air huge flames leap from the coals.  Looking at the metal
within, you can see that they are glowing red hot, ideal for working with.

498.name: Entrance to the Tower
desc: "   This room is full of wards engraved in the walls.  There is a
fantastic collection of energy on the other side of the wards.  You
discern that the wards are there to keep anything, real or magical,
from escaping.  There are more pictures of the young man here, now
dressed in the clothes of a wizard.

499.name: Home of Endar's Mad Prince
desc: "   You are now in one of the living rooms of the mad prince.  You can
feel magic rushing around the room, grabbing at you, tugging, out of
control.  There is hysterical laughter resounding through the rooms.
There is a large picture in pride of place upon one of the walls.  The
room is luxuriously furnished with couches, ornaments, tapestries.

500.name: Prince's Bedroom
desc: "   You are in the prince's sleeping quarters.  There is a large four
poster bed here, with about a dozen pillows.  There is a single mirror
in the room, cracked.  Looking into the mirror, you perceive a wizened
image back, your hair is greyer, your arms weaker, your eyes less
bright.  This is obviously the Mirror of Suliman, you see your
reflection back, as you may look at your death.  In front of the
mirror, there is a small basin and jug.  There is a small pile of
dust in the jug, and the basin looks as if it has seen water in years.

501.name: Mad Prince's Studio
desc: "   You are in a small room.  There is an easel and some paints in a
corner.  There is a small balcony, out of which you can look north
across the castle to the mountains beyond.  There are several half-
finished paintings scattered around the room.  They all seem to be
pictures of mythical creatures, the one currently on the easel depicts
a large wyvern flying over the mountain cliffs, as the sun sinks into
the sea, spreading a red glow over the waters.  It is a stunning work
of art, so lifelike, as if he could see it with his own eyes.

502.name: Upon some Stairs
desc: "   You are on the stairs up the southwestern tower.  There is a large sign on
the wall warning all that they proceed at their own risk, and scribbled in
pencil underneath was "I fear not magi, but an un-fed Alamoc is another thing!".
The stairs are winding and narrow.  Luminous globes light the way, but it seems
to be getting darker the higher you go.

503.name: Living Room
desc: "   You are in a large room, none of the globes seem to be working.  It is very
dark.  In one corner you can see a small pallet, with a tiny pillow.  That must
be for the afore-mentioned apprentice.  The only other thing out of the ordinary
is a large orb, and three crystal cones.  Apart from that there are only the
normal household items, such as a fireplace, table and chairs.
"   The cones are about six inches in length and four inches in diameter at the
base.  All but one seem to be quite dull and empty, but the other one glows
quite brightly.
"   The orb is quite large, about a foot in diameter.  There seems to be swirling
shapes within the orb, but when you look directly at the orb all you can see is
a translucent pale white orb, and yet is it?

504.name: A Small Library
desc: "   You are in a small library of books.  Scanning the titles you guess that this
is a very valuable collection of magic books.  You can spot titles referring to
necromancy and the old magics.  There are treatises about the magic required
to hold the great bridge across the Occam Straigths together once it had
smashed, during the Great Wars, and the power required to cure the land of wild magics.  Many of the titles have been penned by Alamoc himself.  The only other
item in the room apart from the books is a large comfy chair.

505.name: Alamoc's Bedroom
desc: "   You are in a large bedroom.  There is a closed glass window high up over
the bed.  The bed seems to be quite comfortable, but has yet to be made, the
bedclothes are scattered everywhere, and you can guess that the owner is grey-
haired from the lost hairs scattered over the pillow.  By the bed is a small
lampshade and a small desk.  There is an empty bottle of wine and a used glass
upon the desk.

506.name: The Garden Corridor
desc: "   You are in the small corridor behind the great hall.  You have reached
the base of the north-western tower.  There is a door leading up into the
tower but you can see that it has been locked shut for many years.  Still
you can see that there is another entrance on the far side of the tower.
Looking back down the hall, the light casts a beautiful aura down the hall.

507.name: The Garden Corridor
desc: "   You are in the small corridor behind the great hall.  There are no
decorations but the light let in by the great windows throw cast beautiful
shapes upon the marble walls.  Just to the west there is a small but beautifully crafted door.  Up ahead the corridor ends at the base of the
north-western tower.

508.name: The Garden Corridor
desc: "   You are in the small corridor behind the great hall.  There are no
decorations but the light let in by the great windows throw cast beautiful
shapes upon the marble walls.  Just beside you there is a door leading
outside, it is a petite door, beautiful decorated, and which swings open
with the gentlest of touches.

509.name: The Garden Corridor
desc: "   You are in a small private corridor behind the great Hall.  Looking
to the east you can see a small staircase leading up, and to the west
there is a small door.  The hallway ends at the base of the two towers
but there is no way into the towers from this hall, or rather no way
into this corridor except from above or the great hall.  The corridor
itself is quite plain, no carpets or other decorations , but there are
plenty of windows, which let in a gentle green tinted light, and the
sweet smell of lavender and lilac.

510.name: The Garden Corridor
desc: "   You are at the base of the north-eastern tower.  There is a staircase
here leading up to the rooms above.  Listening quietly you can hear the
sound of metal on stone upstairs.  Looking down the corridor, you can just
make out the other end, and the door, halfway down the corridor.  The
light casts a beautiful aura down the hall.

511.name: Out on a Narrow Cable
desc: "   You are out above the castle, the wind is very strong, you are partially
sheltered by the castle, but the eddies caused by the wind whipping around
the edge of the castle threaten to loosen your grip.  The cable is swaying
a lot more than it looked, before you left the window.  Your target window
is just a few steps away.  Looking down you can see the central dome off the
castle, the training guards and the walls, the gardens, way down, and down.....

512.name: Out upon a Narrow Cable
desc: "   You are out above the castle, the wind is very strong, blowing from the
harbour.  The cable is swaying a lot more than it looked, before you left the
window.  Your target window is just a few steps away.  Looking down you can see
the central dome off the castle, the training guards and the walls, way down,
and down.....

513.name: Out upon a Narrow Cable
desc: "   You are out above the castle, the wind is very strong, blowing from the
harbour.  The cable is swaying a lot more than it looked, before you left the
window.  Your target window is just a few steps away.  Looking down you can see
the central dome off the castle, the training guards and the walls, way down, and down.....

514.name: Out Upon a Narrow Cable
desc: "   You are out above the castle, the wind is very strong, you are partially
sheltered by the castle, but the eddies caused by the wind whipping around
the edge of the castle threaten to loosen your grip.  The cable is swaying
a lot more than it looked, before you left the window.  Your target window
is just a few steps away.  Looking down you can see the central dome off the
castle, the training guards and the walls, the castle gates, way down, and
down.....

515.name: Falling Through the Air
desc: "   You slip off the cable, you fall through the air.  The roof of the castle
is rushing to meet you.  You may be able to catch the lip of the roof if you
try just right.  You twist and contort body, pushing yourself towards to roof.

516.name: Falling Through the Air
desc: "   You slip off the cable, you fall through the air.  The roof of the castle
is rushing to meet you.  You may be able to catch the lip of the roof if you
try just right.  You twist and contort body, pushing yourself towards to roof.

517.name: Falling Through the Air
desc: "   You slip off the cable, you fall through the air.  The roof of the castle
is rushing to meet you.  You may be able to catch the lip of the roof if you
try just right.  You twist and contort body, pushing yourself towards to roof.

518.name: Falling Through the Air
desc: "   You slip off the cable, you fall through the air.  The roof of the castle
is rushing to meet you.  You may be able to catch the lip of the roof if you
try just right.  You twist and contort body, pushing yourself towards to roof.

519.name: Out on the Roof
desc: "   You bounce of the roof, it is very smooth.  Despite your injuries from the
first fall, you are beginning to slide down to the edge of the wall, and
beyond that an even greater fall...
"   You are sliding off the edge of the roof, you catch sight of a drainpipe,
running down from one of the gutters.  You make a leap for the pipe... you
catch the pipe and hold on for dear life.  The pipe creaks in protest at your
weight but holds firm. It is creaking ominously....  it breaks, you are falling
and falling ......

520.name: Games Room
desc: "   You are in the smaller half of the room, not occuppied by the great
board in the other half.  Here you can see two chairs facing each other,
and beyond them, a crowd of other chairs, and a drinks bar.  With a brief
examination of the board you can guess that this is the games room.  The
two opponents examine the board beforehand, and then, from memory, must
direct their attacks and defenses from these chairs, communicating by
written messages to servants who move the models.  Limited replies are
returned about what is happening.  It is a favoured way for training young
princes the ways of war, but between two well matched antagonists, it is
a great spectator sport.  Looking around the room you wish you could witness
a match.

521.name: Games Room
desc: "   You are in the upper living rooms of the royal family.  The room seems
to be totally devoted to a large model of some countryside.  The room is
warmed by a single fire, with a few small logs.  The model is very exact,
you can see hills molded with great detail, forests with hundreds of
individual trees.  At the edge of the board you can see hundreds of toy
soldiers.  Mostly common soldiers, gray and less detailed, others,
commanders, in white and greater detail, a few mages, robed in black.
It must be interesting to see what games can be played on this board.
On a board beside the model you can see some scores, Lyam 4, Nataichal 5.

522.name: The Spare Bedroom
desc: "   You are in the spare bedroom, there is a small two-poster bed there.
The sheets look freshly laid, but over the rest of the room there appears
to be covered in a fine layer of dust.  The only furniture in the room is
an old mirror.  The room looks maintained, but no-one seems to have gone
near the mirror in years, to estimate by the level of dust.
"   Brushing away the mirror you see a face deep within the mirror, a sad
face.  It looks back at you, staring through you, watching you as you move
away.

523.name: The Queen's Boudoir
desc: "   You are in the private boudoir of the queen.  You can see tall tapestries
hanging upon the walls.  A small, crackling, fire shimmers in the grate.
There are a few chairs in the room, beside one you can see the remains of
some unfinished cross-stitch.  The pattern being embroidered appears to be
that of an unfinished red rose.  Looking out through one of the narrow
windows, you look over the training yard, past the training soldiers, over
the walls, and on towards the city beyond, the horizon formed by the
irregular shapes of houses and spires.
"   The tapestry depicts a fierce battle between a knight, in shining white
armour, and that of a great golden dragon, with a volcano in the distance.
The colours have faded with age, but the figures are as bright as ever,
the knight fashioned with silver thread and the dragon of golden wire, as
fine as any hair.

extra.desc: "   It has the faint outline of a rose, the detail is exquisitively fine.

524.name: Her Royal Highness' Bedroom
desc: "   You are in the queen's bedroom.  The main object in the room is a
giant bed, the sheets slightly ruffled, as if recently vacated.  The air
in the room is slightly perfumed, with a faint lilac scent, and what with
the purple velvet funiture, the room emotes a shade of purple.  Looking
at the bed more closely, you see a four poster bed, with a large canopy.
Large billowing sheets of cloth drape from the canopy, covering all four
sides, the folds of cloth held back with tied tussels.  Examining the
cloth, you can see that it is very expensive, heavy, velvet, with sparkling
white linen on the bed.  On the pillows, you espy a motif, HRH.

525.name: The King's Antechamber
desc: "   You are in the small antechamber of the King's bedroom.  Emblazoned over the
bedroom door is a proclamation declaring Dolcain to be the most recent Hy of
Hyberia and Endar and to be a grand-duke of the Empire.  The room is comfortably
furnished with a small fireplace, some padded chairs, a long couch, and carpet
so thick that it's like walking on air.  The room is lit by some shimmering
candles at the back of the room.

526.name: The King's Bedroom
desc: "   The king has a great bed.  The sheets are white linen, with red initials,
depicting HRH.  The bed has a great canopy but all the draping folds have been
tied back.  Beside the bed you can see a scabbard, obviously the king sleeps
with his weapons close to hand at all times.  The room has a small back entrance
to the rear of the room.  It is looks like it leads to the servants' accesses,
very useful for meeting people that do not want to enter through the front
door.

527.name: A Small Classroom
desc: "   You are at the head of a small classroom.  There are no more than half a
dozen small desks.  there is a large blackboard at the head of the room, written
in chalk upon the board you can see that geography has been the last lesson.
There is a large desk at the head of the classroom, but nothing is visible on
the desk, and all the drawers are locked.
"   Written in now-smudged chalk you see the following:
THE MAIN CITIES OF ARANDIA
ARADOR
OLDPORT
NORPORT

528.name: At the back of the Classroom
desc: "   You are at the back of a small classroom, there is a large window in the
corner that overlooks the southwestern castle tower.  You are among the small
desks, the desks are larger at the back than the front, obviously the younger
students sit at the top, while the older ones go to the back, as they are taller
and can see over the heads of the smaller children.

529.name: The Map Room
desc: "   You are in a large room, there is a great table in the middle of the room.
There are lots of small maps hanging on the walls.  A large windows looks out
over one of the corner towers.  A large chain hangs droopingly between the tower
and the window's edge.  Looking at the table you can ascertain a very detailed
map of the world, with all the major cities marked on the map, Arador in the
centre of the map, Thelsha off to one side, Chressport and Golbatron at the top.
A lot of other features are included, such as Dragon's Eye, which has a little
flag identifying it as a location of mystery, noting that any opportunity to
obtain information on this spot should be followed.  Other flags mention Mythra,
Endar and the Spectral Isle's.  There are some flags identifying aspects of
some of the cities to the north of Arador, but you cannot see them from here.
One pattern you can notice is that the various cities each have a flag of a
certain colour, red for Arador and a couple of cities near it, blue for Oldport,
Norport and Chressport, and green for the rest of the cities, including the
Hyberian cities.
"   Newly developed ferry route, potential ally, large potential market, little
information on political situation, must be patient.
THE CONTINENT OF HYBERIA
'.__--'   |   '.    EN The Island of Endar
| MT |    MT The Island of Thelsa
_-------.    '._'     MT The Island of Mythra and city

530.name: The Map Room
desc: "   You are in a large room, there is a great table in the middle of the room.
There are lots of small maps hanging on the walls.  Looking at the table you
can ascertain a very detailed map of the world, with all the major cities
marked on the map, Arador in the centre of the map, Endar off to one side,
Norport and Golbatron at the top.  A lot of other features are included, such
as Point Pleasant, which has a little flag identifying it as a potential harbour
for military operation.  There are some flags identifying aspects of some of
the cities to the south of Arador, but you cannot see them from here.  One
pattern you can notice is that the various cities each have a flag of a certain
colour, red for Arador and a couple of cities near it, blue for Oldport, Norport
and Chressport, and green for the rest of the cities, including the Hyberian
cities.
"   You can maps of the major continents, in great detail, from here you can
see maps of Chressicaa, Glacia and Arandia.
THE CONTINENT OF ARANDIA
.-NP-___         .----____          AA Ancient Aqua.    OL Overlook
.'        '.     .-'  PB    '.        AK Agatar's Keep    OP Old Port
|           'SG.-'            '._     AR Arandor          PA Pill. of Anar.
'.             MK        HG    OP.   DR Dwarven Range    PB Pringle's Barrks
|         MM MM   MM  MM        |   FL Frozen Lake      PC Phul's Choice
'.ZH      MM HF MM MM MM        '. GC Grand Crater     PH Pharport
|      GC  MM MM MM MM          | GD Gasper's Dale    RL Ruins of Lanmyer
'--.        SF            88   | HF Highhold Fort.   SA Swamps of Amnos
TI 'OL  KM  AR  SA      88    | HG Hoiler's Grove   SF Shadowdale Forest
SM.-._.'            MF   888     | HR Hunter's Run     SG Stormqour
'._    GD  PC  HR  AA 88 HR    | KM Kor Multor       SM Stolthrun Monas.
|                 88        | MF Miller's Falls   SP MultagarSnowPlain
.'  MH     ST   DR          | MG Multagar         ST Stonewood Forest
___.'                   FL   PA.' MH Moherc's Gard.   TI Tower Isle
.PH      RL    SP             __'   MK Minton's Keep    TK Tosk
|  AK           ________MG---'      MM SleepGiantsMnts  ZH Zindhom Stronghold
'.__TK--------'                    NP Norport          88 Grand Chasm

531.name: The Balcony over the Court
desc: "   You are on the great balcony that hangs over the court below.  It seems
to be in need of some repair.  The carved, wooden, lattice work seems to be
full of woodworm and battered with age.  The varnish has peeled in many
places.  Looking carefully over the edge of the balcony you can see the
great fire that warms the great room.  Just to your right you can see the
throne itself.  Beside the fire you can see a set of double doors, and from
the smell arising on the heated air, which lead to the kitchen.  There is a
further stretch of the balcony leading out, but it is loosely restricted by
a red rope.

532.name: The Balcony over the Court
desc: "   You are on the great balcony that hangs over the court below.  It seems
to be in need of some repair.  The carved, wooden, lattice work seems to be
full of woodworm and battered with age.  The varnish has peeled in many
places.  Looking carefully over the edge of the balcony you can see the
throne right below you, both to the left and right you can see crowded
benches.  There is a further stretch of the balcony leading further out, but
it is loosely restricted by a red rope.

533.name: The Balcony over the Court
desc: "   You are on the great balcony that hangs over the court below.  It seems
to be in need of some repair.  The carved, wooden, lattice work seems to be
full of woodworm and battered with age.  The varnish has peeled in many
places.  Looking carefully over the edge of the balcony you can see the
throne just to the left and right below you, some benches and the doors
leading to the chapel and the rooms behind.  There is a further stretch of
the balcony leading out, but it is loosely restricted by a red rope.

534.name: Guard's Room
desc: "   You are in guards' room, there is only the stairs here.  A wide clear
area has been kept around the top of the stairs.  You can see two guards
talking near the top, the older pointing out with his sword how to defend
against invaders, telling him yarns of old, probably how he held the
entire castle against massive invasion, all by himself.  Old soldiers are
universal.  In the other half of the room you can see that some games have
been set up, though not everyone is playing.

535.name: Gaurd's Quarters
desc: "   You are in the guards' room.  It is a very comfortable room, considering
that its only for the guards.  The guards are busy playing dice, and a
board game.  A boisterous group in the corner seem to be playing some card
game, one of the players seems to be losing, and not liking it.  All the
guards have placed their weapons along the wall, within easy reach.  Despite
their gaming, you can see that these are elite guards, considering the
condition of their armour and the quality of their weapons.  From where
you stand you can see the entire hallway and the stairs leading up from
below.  They are well positioned to protect and defend this area.

536.name: A Marble Hallway
desc: "   You are walking along a wide marble hallway.  There is a deep red
carpet along the floor.  Just to one side you can see a small open room
where the palace guards wait in case of need.  On either side of the hallway
there are several large doors  Further up the hallway you can see a balcony.
There is hardly no sound as you walk along the carpet.

537.name: A Marble Hallway
desc: "   You are walking along a wide marble hallway.  There is a deep red
carpet along the floor.  One side of the hallway consists of a great
balcony that hangs over the great court below.  It does not look the
sturdiest.  On the other side of the hall you can see several large doors.

538.name: A Marble Hallway
desc: "   You are walking along a wide marble hallway.  There is a deep red
carpet along the floor.  One side of the hallway consists of a great
balcony that hangs over the great court below.  It does not look the
sturdiest.  On the other side of the hall you can see several large doors.

539.name: A Marble Hallway
desc: "   You are walking along a wide marble hallway.  There is a deep red
carpet along the floor.  One side of the hallway consists of a great
balcony that hangs over the great court below.  It does not look the
sturdiest.  On the other side of the hall you can see several large doors.

540.name: A Marble Hallway
desc: "   You are walking along a wide marble hallway.  There is a deep red
carpet along the floor. On either side of the hallway there are several large
doors  Further up the hallway you can see a balcony. There is hardly no sound
as you walk along the carpet.  It is very quite here.

541.name: A Marble Hallway
desc: "   You are walking along a wide marble hallway.  There is a deep red
carpet along the floor. On either side of the hallway there are several large
doors  Further up the hallway you can see a balcony. There is hardly no sound
as you walk along the carpet.  It is very quite here.

542.name: At the Edge of the Balcony
desc: "   You are standing out from the balcony, above the great Hall.  This
does not seem very steady.  You have a great view of all the people in
the hall, and they of you.  It is not very nice to have people looking
up to you in this exact manner.

543.name: In Mid Air
desc: "   You have just fallen off the balcony.   Nothing you can do can
stop you falling.  You try to grasp the edge of the balcony to no
avail, you fall off, with some pieces of the balcony to keep you
company.

544.name: In Mid Air
desc: "   You are falling through the air, the ground is approaching at a
very high speed.  Pink marble hides blood stains very well.  You
wonder does metal scratch....

545.name: Clinging to a Drainpipe
desc: "   You are sliding of the edge of the roof, you catch sight of a drainpipe,
running down from one of the gutters.  You make a leap for the pipe... you
catch the pipe and hold on for dear life.  The pipe creaks in protest at your
weight but holds firm.  You can make your way safely down the pipe, provided
that the pipe holds, it is creaking ominously....
"   You hold on to the drainpipe for dear life but it begins to buckle and
pull away from the wall, it looks like youre going to fall...

546.name: Falling off the Drainpipe
desc: "   You hold on tightly to the drainpipe, but it begins to pull away from the
wall.  The safe avenue no longer exists, the entire drainpipe is angling away
from the wall.  Suddenly the top stip of piping cracks and comes totally away
from the wall, you have nothing to grab, you are falling and falling.....

547.name: Falling down the Side of the of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
you fall. Several people spot you from an upper storey window.  The ground
is coming closer very quickly.

548.name: Falling down the Side of the of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
you fall. Several people spot you from an upper storey window.  The ground
is coming closer very quickly.

549.name: Falling down the Side of the of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
you fall. Several people spot you from an upper storey window.  The ground
is coming closer very quickly.

550.name: Falling down the Side of the of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
you fall. Several people spot you from an upper storey window.  The ground
is coming closer very quickly.

551.name: Falling down the Side of the of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as

552.name: Falling down the Side of the of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as

553.name: Falling down the Side of the of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
you fall. Several people spot you from an upper storey window.  The ground

554.name: Falling down the Side of the of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
you fall. Several people spot you from an upper storey window.  The ground
is coming closer very quickly.

555.name: Falling Through The Air
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
you fall.  Lots of people are watching you from upper storey windows.  The
ground is coming closer very quickly.  Some pieces of the drainpipe hit the
ground first, smashing on impact.

556.name: Falling Through The Air
desc: "   You slip off the cable, you fall through the air.  The roof of the castle
is rushing to meet you.  You may be able to catch the lip of the roof if you
try just right.  You twist and contort body, pushing yourself towards to roof.

557.name: Falling Through The Air
desc: "   You slip off the cable, you fall through the air.  The roof of the castle
is rushing to meet you.  You may be able to catch the lip of the roof if you
try just right.  You twist and contort body, pushing yourself towards to roof.

558.name: Falling Through The Air
desc: "   You slip off the cable, you fall through the air.  The roof of the castle
is rushing to meet you.  You may be able to catch the lip of the roof if you
try just right.  You twist and contort body, pushing yourself towards to roof.

559.name: Falling Through The Air
desc: "   You slip off the cable, you fall through the air.  The roof of the castle
is rushing to meet you.  You may be able to catch the lip of the roof if you
try just right.  You twist and contort body, pushing yourself towards to roof.

560.name: On the Castle's Roof
desc: "   You bounce of the roof, it is very smooth.  Despite your injuries from the
first fall, you are beginning to slide down to the edge of the wall, and
beyond that an even greater fall...  But to one side there is a drainpipe, you
may be able to grab that and climb down.
"   You are sliding off the edge of the roof, you catch sight of a drainpipe,
running down from one of the gutters.  You make a leap for the pipe... you
catch the pipe and hold on for dear life.  The pipe creaks in protest at your
weight but holds firm. It is creaking ominously....  it breaks, you are falling
and falling ......

561.name: CLinging to a Drainpipe
desc: "   You are sliding of the edge of the roof, you catch sight of a drainpipe,
running down from one of the gutters.  You make a leap for the pipe... you
catch the pipe and hold on for dear life.  The pipe creaks in protest at your
weight but holds firm.  You can make your way safely down the pipe, provided
that the pipe holds, it is creaking ominously....
"   You hold on to the drainpipe for dear life but it begins to buckle and
pull away from the wall, it looks like youre going to fall...

562.name: Falling off the Drainpipe
desc: "   You hold on tightly to the drainpipe, but it begins to pull away from the
wall.  The safe avenue no longer exists, the entire drainpipe is angling away
from the wall.  Suddenly the top stip of piping cracks and comes totally away
from the wall, you have nothing to grab, you are falling and falling.....

563.name: Falling down off the roof of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
you fall. Several people spot you from an upper storey window.  The ground
is coming closer very quickly.

564.name: Falling down off the roof of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
you fall. Several people spot you from an upper storey window.  The ground
is coming closer very quickly.

desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.

desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.

569.name: Falling down off the roof of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
