570.name: Falling down off the roof of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
you fall. Several people spot you from an upper storey window.  The ground
is coming closer very quickly.

571.name: Falling down off the roof of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
you fall.  Lots of people are watching you from upper storey windows.  The
ground is coming closer very quickly.  Some pieces of the drainpipe hit the
ground first, smashing on impact.

572.name: Falling down off the roof of the Castle
desc: "   You fall off the drainpipe, it is at least fourty feet to the ground.
The air rushes by, some pieces of the drainpipe are keeping you company as
you fall.  Lots of people are watching you from upper storey windows.  The
ground is coming closer very quickly.  Some pieces of the drainpipe hit the
ground first, smashing on impact.

580.name: Near the Prison Entrance
desc: "   You are on the steps towards the dungeons.  It is very dark here, the
darkness being broken only by some spluttering burning torches, stuck
in the wall.  Take a brief look over the whole dungeons, you can see that
they are actually not that big, only about a dozen cells, and a small set
of torture equipment.  You can see the glowing coals of the brander.  As
you stand at the entrance, you can smell the putrid stench of the dungeon,
highlighted by the fresh air leaking in from the outside.

581.name: The Deep Dungeons
desc: "   Looking around you can see the stairs that lead out of the dungeons.
The walls are smeared with excrement and blood.  Manacles hang from the
walls.  At the base of the walls you can see an open sewer, cockroaches
climbing in and out of their holes, as big as your hand they are.  From
here you can see the entrances to some of the cells.  They do not appear
to be locked, just bolted from the outside.  Despite the cell doors not
being locked, you can see a set of padlocks hanging on the wall, just
in case they need to lock the door.

582.name: The Deep Dungeons
desc: "   You are in the castle's dungeons.  You are standing beside a rack of
glowing coals.  Some glowing red pokers are sticking out of the coals,
ready for use.  Hanging, locked to the walls, you see a newly killed body,
you can see many burn marks to the backs and thighs, but none to the face
or hands.  One of the prisoners spots you, and starts yelling, the place
is now full of yelling prisoners, begging you to release them.

583.name: The Deep Dungeons
desc: "   You are in the dungeons, you can see some glowing coals just behind
you.  The prisoners are creating a hell of a racket, shouting, begging
you to free them.  There is not much to see, a putrid sewer, rotting
straw, the foul stench of stale air and the noisy spluttering of the
torches.
"   The door slams shut behind you, the warder laughs at your surprise,
He cackles at you, saying "teach you not to interfere where you are not
wanted , Maybe he'll let you out in a while.

584.name: The Deep Dungeons
desc: "   You are in one corner of the dungeons.  You can see many cell doors.
The prisoners are yelling for you to release them.  One of the doors here
is locked with a brass padlock.  Resting up against a rock, you try to
gather your senses as the smell of urine, and excrement overpowers you.

585.name: A Prison Cell
desc: "   You are in a cell, it is filthy. There are no toilet facilities and
the evidence is visible everywhere.  The prisoners seem to have taken
great pleasure out of smearing excrement all over themselves and the walls.
There are several piles of dirty straw which are used as beds and there is
a barrel of dirty water, with scum floating over the surface.  From the
inside the room is just a four sided cold stone room with a heavy oak door.
The door is extremely heavy, if it ever were to close there would be no
way for you to open it again.

586.name: A Prison Cell
desc: "   You are in a cell, it is filthy. There are no toilet facilities and
the evidence is visible everywhere.  The prisoners seem to have taken
great pleasure out of smearing excrement all over themselves and the walls.
There are several piles of dirty straw which are used as beds and there is
a barrel of dirty water, with scum floating over the surface.  From the
inside the room is just a four sided cold stone room with a heavy oak door.
The door is extremely heavy, if it ever were to close there would be no
way for you to open it again.

587.name: A Dirty Prison Cell
desc: "   You are in a cell, it is filthy. There are no toilet facilities and
the evidence is visible everywhere.  The prisoners seem to have taken
great pleasure out of smearing excrement all over themselves and the walls.
There are several piles of dirty straw which are used as beds and there is
a barrel of dirty water, with scum floating over the surface.  From the
inside the room is just a four sided cold stone room with a heavy oak door.
The door is extremely heavy, if it ever were to close there would be no
way for you to open it again.  There is a thick pile of straw bunched
together in the far corner.
"   You examine the pile of straw, it stinks even worse now that you've
moved it, it was covering a sewer grating, and the smell is atrocious.

588.name: A Dirty Cell
desc: "   You are in a cell, it is filthy. There are no toilet facilities and
the evidence is visible everywhere.  The prisoners seem to have taken
great pleasure out of smearing excrement all over themselves and the walls.
There are several piles of dirty straw which are used as beds and there is
a barrel of dirty water, with scum floating over the surface.  From the
inside the room is just a four sided cold stone room with a heavy oak door.
The door is extremely heavy, if it ever were to close there would be no
way for you to open it again.  There is a thick pile of straw bunched
together in the far corner.

extra.desc: "  You slide down the slippery tunnel revealed by the loose flagstone.

desc: "   The thick pile of straw is covering a loose flagstone.  Looking at the
flagstone more closely, you can see that is very loose and that there is
an exit down, out of the cell.

589.name: Prison entrance
desc: "   The jailer grabs you and pulls you out of the cell, he maliciously throws
you against some coals, again and again, burning you.  Eventually he grabs you
up the stairs, throwing you down at the entrance to the prison, yelling
"get out and stay out, or else your next visit will be more permanent!

590.name: Palace Gardens
desc: "   You are at the entrance to a small but beautiful walled garden.  There
are gravel paths leading in several directions between the manicured
plants.  There is a strong smell of lavender and lilac drifting through
the air.  You can hear the sound of gentle laughter being carried on the
air.

591.name: Palace Gardens
desc: "   You are walking along the edge of the garden.  A tall hedge marks the
boundary.  Despite the limited space, the garden offers privacy, with its
tall hedges, tree lined walks and carefully sculptured walkways.  Looking
ahead you can see the path bend as it passes through some more hedges.
You can here the sound of bubbling water somewhere nearby.

592.name: Palace Gardens
desc: "   You are walking down a tree covered boulevard.  Up ahead there is a
small rose garden.  The trees consist of larch and oak.  The oak giving
a sense of strength and longevity to the youthfulness of youth.  Among
the trees you see poppies and fuschias, giant daisies and a few delicate
weeping violets.

593.name: Palace Gardens
desc: "   You are walking along the edge of the garden.  A tall hedge marks the
boundary.  Despite the limited space, the garden offers privacy, with its
tall hedges, tree lined walks and carefully sculptured walkways.  Looking
ahead you can see the path bend as it passes through some more hedges.

594.name: Palace Gardens
desc: "   You are in a small miniature garden, the trees are all pixie height,
and the flowers are a collection of the smallest and sweetest smelling
to be found, snowdrops, tiny daisies, bluebells, all surrounded by tiny
oaks towering over them.  The garden gives an impression of immenseness,
within its enclosed space.  Now and then, you think you can see a pixie
tending these plants, and who else could tend them, considering their
size.

595.name: Rose Garden
desc: "   You are in the castle's rose garden.  You can see nothing but roses, and
of course the bees that go with them.  There are predominantly red, though
of various different hues, but you can see one red rose which blazes with
redness, a red rose which you'd give to the co-habiter of your heart.
Looking between the roses you can see some tulips and violets.  The grass
here is so smooth that is like glass.  This is a beautiful place.

596.name: Palace Gardens
desc: "   You are in a small enclosed garden, with a large pond.  There are giant
lily pads floating in the water, with reeds all around the edges.  There
is a little brook babbling down the side of the hill, leading to the pond.
A weeping willow droops over the edge, leaving a gently shaded area by the
pond to which to sit.  You can see a small garden seat already there.

608.name: Entrance to Forest
desc: "   You are at the border between the mountains and the forest.  It is still
very rocky but the further south you look, the more the trees flourish.  The
wind is quite breezy here, the trees not dense enough to form a strong wind-
break, but enough of one to prevent the wintry gales so famously frequent
upon the mountains.  There is a twisty trail wending its way both northward
into the mountains.  Looking towards the forest it is hard to see where the
trail originates, lost in a sea of trees.

680.name: " At the Base of Some Cliffs
desc: "   You are on a small beach.  The cliff walls protect this little cove from the
fierce elements of the ocean.  From your current vantage point you can see a
small section of the ocean beyond.  Looking back up the cliffs you wonder how
you survived the fall at all.  You can see where there is an outlet for a
river several hundred feet up, but the water flows away from the cove.  There
is nothing here to eat or drink, and absolutely no shelter from the wind or
rain.  There is absolutely no way out... the water is visibly infested with
sharks and probably a lot worse and civilisation is miles away.  It seems as
if you are here to stay.
You are hungry.
You are getting thirsty.

681.name: " At the Base of Some Cliffs
desc: "   You are on a small beach.  The cliff walls protect this little cove from the
fierce elements of the ocean.  From your current vantage point you can see a
small section of the ocean beyond.  Looking back up the cliffs you wonder how
you survived the fall at all.  You can see where there is an outlet for a
river several hundred feet up, but the water flows away from the cove.  There
is nothing here to eat or drink, and absolutely no shelter from the wind or
rain.  There is absolutely no way out... the water is visibly infested with
sharks and probably a lot worse and civilisation is miles away.  It seems as
if you are here to stay.

682.name: Docked to the Northern Pier
desc: "   You are on an old boat.  It is tied up against the end of the pier.  The
sailors are busy unloading the fish.  The workers from the wharf have brought
boxes of ice to throw over the fresh fish.  You are pushed out of the way
as the fish are unloaded and fresh stores are brought aboard.

extra.desc: "   Get off my ship you vagabond.... I have to sail!!!

683.name: On A Ship nearing Harbour
desc: "   You are on an old rickety boat.  The captain is busy heckling the sailors
and nursing the rudder.  It is a tricky job steering into the main traffic
lanes between the two great towers at the entrance to the main harbour.  The
Lighthouse and the Mages' Tower soar overhead, the great sea walls reaching
out from them.  Once past the towers the effect of the sea walls is obvious,
the water is much calmer and the wind no more than a gentle breeze.  The
ship is travelling at a snail's pace but up ahead you can see the pier
and the wharf beyond.

684.name: On A Ship Sailing Along the Cliffs
desc: "   You are on an old rickety boat.  The ship is obviously a fishing boat, the
smell is overpowering.  The captain is busy heckling the sailors and nursing
the rudder.  The sails flap in the wind, a strong steady southerly breeze.
Looking to shore all you can see are the immense cliffs that you so recently
escaped from.  Straining your eyes yon can just make out some of the tall towers
that signify civilisation.

685.name: Upon A Slippery Rock Bridge
desc: "   You are on a narrow bridge.  It is very slippy, every now and then you lose
your footing and with only the best of luck do you manage to stay on.  You can
hear, much louder now, the rushing water below, the mist being raised by the
water causes the secreted limestone to glisten and shimmer.  The bridge is not
very long, either bank is only a few strides away.

686.name: Upon A Slippery Rock Bridge
desc: "   You are on a narrow bridge.  It is very slippy, every now and then you lose
your footing and with only the best of luck do you manage to stay on.  You can
hear, much louder now, the rushing water below, the mist being raised by the
water causes the secreted limestone to glisten and shimmer.  The bridge is not
very long, either bank is only a few strides away.

687.name: Upon A Slippery Rock Bridge
desc: "   You are on a narrow bridge.  It is very slippy, every now and then you lose
your footing and with only the best of luck do you manage to stay on.  You can
hear, much louder now, the rushing water below, the mist being raised by the
water causes the secreted limestone to glisten and shimmer.  The bridge is not
very long, either bank is only a few strides away.

688.name: Above a Deep Cavern
desc: "   You are on a narrow bridge.  It is very slippy, every now and then you lose
your footing and with only the best of luck do you manage to stay on.  You can
hear, much louder now, the rushing water below, the mist being raised by the
water causes the secreted limestone to glisten and shimmer.  The bridge is not
very long, either bank is only a few strides away.

689.name: In A Shallow but Freezing River
desc: "   You are at the bottom of the gorge, standing knee deep in freezing water.
You can feel the heat of your body being sapped literally by the very second.
It isn't far up, but you will have to climb the rock walls, and with all the
water being splashed the rocks glisten, and in parts are covered with a green
moss.  You can hear a great roaring as the river escapes the cave system.
"   You go with the flow of the river, it is freezing.  The river pulls
you along, out through a narrow opening, shot out into the air beyond,
falling, falling....

690.name: In A Shallow but Freezing River
desc: "   You are at the bottom of the gorge, standing knee deep in freezing water.
You can feel the heat of your body being sapped literally by the very second.
It isn't far up, but you will have to climb the rock walls, and with all the
water being splashed the rocks glisten, and in parts are covered with a green
moss.  You can hear a great roaring as the river escapes the cave system.
"   You go with the flow of the river, it pulls you around the rocks,
and suddenly under a large rock outcrop.  The water gushes out of the
cliff face, shooting you out into the air, and there is only one way
to go... down and down and down....

691.name: In A Shallow but Freezing River
desc: "   You are at the bottom of the gorge, standing knee deep in freezing water.
You can feel the heat of your body being sapped literally by the very second.
It isn't far up, but you will have to climb the rock walls, and with all the
water being splashed the rocks glisten, and in parts are covered with a green
moss.  The river flows from a underground stream, the tunnel is quite large
but it is very cold.

692.name: An Underwater Tunnel
desc: "   You are in a totally underwater water tunnel.  The water is very fierce and
cold, it takes most of your strength just to hold your place.  It is strangely
bright in this small tunnel.  The walls of the tunnel are very smooth with
small, regular, ripples in the surface.  The tunnel isn't very long, you can
feel that air is close by.

693.name: In a deep Cold Gorge
desc: "   You are at the bottom of the gorge, standing knee deep in freezing water.
You can feel the heat of your body being sapped literally by the very second.
You can see that the river falls down a sheer cliff, now and then revealing the
rock face behind, a collection of closely packed stalactite and stalagmites that
look like a mouthful of teeth, filed to sharp points.  On the other side the
river flows over a large rock plateau.  It isn't far up, but you will have to
climb the rock walls, and with all the water being splashed the rocks glisten,
and in parts are covered with a green moss.
"   You see a fierce looking waterfall, the teeth of the terrifying face are
made up of stalactites and stalagmites.  The water flows over them from just
below the roof, as if coming from within the mouth.

694.name: Falling down the Cliff
desc: "   You are falling down the side of the cliff.  You twist and turn trying to
control your fall.  You pull at the few bushes, having no more success than
having a few leaves accompany you as you fall down.  Glancing down you can
see a small cove.  The cove is protected upon three sides by the huge cliffs,
but if you land there, though you may survive... you may never escape.

695.name: At the Base of the Cliffs
desc: "   You are on a small beach.  The cliff walls protect this little cove from the
fierce elements of the ocean.  From your current vantage point you can see a
small section of the ocean beyond.  Looking back up the cliffs you wonder how
you survived the fall at all.  You can see where there is an outlet for a
river several hundred feet up, but the water flows away from the cove.  There
is nothing here to eat or drink, and absolutely no shelter from the wind or
rain.  There is absolutely no way out... the water is visibly infested with
sharks and probably a lot worse and civilisation is miles away.  It seems as
if you are here to stay.
"   A ship pulls into view, the captain seeing your plight whisks you
aboard and offers to take you to the city.

696.name: On A ship Just off from the Shore
desc: "   You are on an old rickety boat.  The ship is obviously a fishing boat, the
smell is unbelievable, though the captain and his two shiphands do not seem to
notice it.  The ship master is friendly enough.  He says the fishing is good
along the north coast of the island but that the travelling there eats up a
lot of good fishing time.  That's about all you can get out of him as he is
busy heckling the sailors and nursing the rudder.  The sails flap in the wind,
a strong steady southerly breeze.  looking to shore all you can see are the
immense cliffs that you so recently escaped from.

700.name: Falling down the Cliff
desc: "   You are falling down the edge of the cliff.  You pull at the few bushes
that manage to grow on the sheer face of the cliff but to no avail.  Also
at this level there is an underground river flowing out of the cliff face,
making it cold and slippy.  The ground is not that far below, maybe you will
be able to stop yourself in time, before you make a big impact.

701.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees clinging to the rock face,
but up ahead you can see that they soon die out, leaving only barren rock
to grace the view.  The going is difficult as the trail winds its way up
through the forests and over small riverlets.

702.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.  Just ahead you can see a
small trail branching off.

703.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.

704.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees clinging to the rock face,
but up ahead you can see that they soon die out, leaving only barren rock
to grace the view.  The going is difficult as the trail winds its way up
through the forests and over small riverlets.

705.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees clinging to the rock face,
but up ahead you can see that they soon die out, leaving only barren rock
to grace the view.  The going is difficult as the trail winds its way up
through the forests and over small riverlets.

706.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a mountain trail.  There are only rocks and boulders as
far as the eye can see.  The trails splits just ahead, leading in
different directions up the hill.  There is no evidence to help you
determine which is the most travelled by.

707.name: Cliff Face
desc: "   You can see the cliffs of Endar now.  The trail is very rocky and
the wind is beginning to chill you.  Looking over the edge you can see
some caves just a few hundred yards from the top of the cliff.  Looking
further down you can see the ocean breaking against the cliffs, throwing
plumes of spray hundreds of feet into the air.

708.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees clinging to the rock face,
but up ahead you can see that they soon die out, leaving only barren rock
to grace the view.  The going is difficult as the trail winds its way up
through the forests and over small riverlets.

709.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees clinging to the rock face,
but up ahead you can see that they soon die out, leaving only barren rock
to grace the view.  The going is difficult as the trail winds its way up
through the forests and over small riverlets.

710.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a mountain trail.  If is very difficult, and with the
forbidding clouds high up in these hills, you pray to the gods that it
doesn't rain, as it would make the trail even more dangerous.  The land
is very barren, but here and there, you spot a splash of colour as some
wild flowers brave the elements.

711.name: Cliff Face
desc: "   You are by the cliffs now.  The wind is very cold.  You can see some
animal trails leading along the cliff edge.  The cliffs are not actually
very steep up here, but consist of steep slopes of shale and gravel.  The
sound of seagulls squawking and the wind rushing over the cliffs is all
you can hear, it is deafening.

712.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees clinging to the rock face,
but up ahead you can see that they soon die out, leaving only barren rock
to grace the view.  The going is difficult as the trail winds its way up
through the forests and over small riverlets.

713.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees clinging to the rock face,
but up ahead you can see that they soon die out, leaving only barren rock
to grace the view.  The going is difficult as the trail winds its way up
through the forests and over small riverlets.

714.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees clinging to the rock face,
but up ahead you can see that they soon die out, leaving only barren rock
to grace the view.  The going is difficult as the trail winds its way up
through the forests and over small riverlets.

715.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.

716.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.

717.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a mountain trail.  There are only rocks and boulders as
far as the eye can see.  The trails splits just ahead, leading in
different directions up the hill.  There is no evidence to help you
determine which is the most travelled by.

718.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are at a mountain river ford.  There are stepping stones to help
you cross the river.  You look at the stones, as the river splashes up
and over them.  The river is very fast and very cold.  The trail continues
on the other side.

719.name: River Ford
desc: "   You are at a mountain river ford.  There are stepping stones to help
you cross the river.  You look at the stones, as the river splashes up
and over them.  The river is very fast and very cold.  The trail continues
on the other side.

720.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are at a mountain river ford.  There are stepping stones to help
you cross the river.  You look at the stones, as the river splashes up
and over them.  The river is very fast and very cold.  The trail continues
on the other side.

721.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a mountain trail.  If is very difficult, and with the
forbidding clouds high up in these hills, you pray to the gods that it
doesn't rain, as it would make the trail even more dangerous.  The land
is very barren, but here and there, you spot a splash of colour as some
wild flowers brave the elements.

722.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.

723.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats and foolish adventurers.
There are strange rumours of vicious animals and great treasure hidden
in these hills.

724.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a mountain trail.  To the far east you can see the smoking
top of the volcano.  The trail is very difficult here, and the stones
are sliding from beneath your feet.  If you are not careful you could
easily break a leg.  Rumour has it that trolls live in these mountains,
and it would be like them to love this barren rock-filled land.

725.name: Mountain Top
desc: "   You are on top of the mountain.  It is cold and the air is thin,
but there is a fantastic view, of the City of Endar, in all its
majesty, the volcanic ranges to the south, the great forests, and
the shipyards which depend on them.  The air whistles by, invigorating
you.

726.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees clinging to the rock face,
but up ahead you can see that they soon die out, leaving only barren rock
to grace the view.  The going is difficult as the trail winds its way up
through the forests and over small riverlets.

727.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees all around, living
precariously on the mountain side.  The trail splits up ahead, as it
bends around a particularly large rock.  The trees block the view ahead.

728.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.  Just ahead you can see a
small trail branching off.

729.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.

730.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a mountain trail.  If is very difficult, and with the
forbidding clouds high up in these hills, you pray to the gods that it
doesn't rain, as it would make the trail even more dangerous.  The land
is very barren, but here and there, you spot a splash of colour as some
wild flowers brave the elements.

desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between

735.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees clinging to the rock face,
but up ahead you can see that they soon die out, leaving only barren rock
to grace the view.  The going is difficult as the trail winds its way up

736.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail.  The stones are slipping from beneath your
feet with every step.  The sound of crunching stones is accompanied only
by the whistling of the wind, as it chills the very stones you walk upon.

737.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You have reached a slightly more level stretch.  The going is easier.
The rocks break the force of the wind, and it seems slightly warmer here
as a result.  There are some small plants here, some even have berries,
though few look ripe enough to eat.

738.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing river.  There is a
large rock fallen across the gorge.  A fast flowing river lies at the
bottom of the gorge.  You can see no way down to the base or any other
way, up or down, river for you to cross the river.  The rock is covered
with greeny blue moss, from all the water splashing onto it.  The water
flowing underneath the rock is crystal blue clear, and you can taste its
sparkling cleanness in the air.  In the distance you can see the old
volcano summit, snow covered.

739.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a slippery rock over the fast flowing river.  It is very
slippy, you'd need to be very agile to be able to keep your balance.  The
rushing water roars under the rock, the spray feels almost warm.

740.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing river.  There is a
large rock fallen across the gorge.  A fast flowing river lies at the
bottom of the gorge.  You can see no way down to the base or any other
way, up or down, river for you to cross the river.  The rock is covered
with greeny blue moss, from all the water splashing onto it.  The water
flowing underneath the rock is crystal blue clear, and you can taste its
sparkling cleanness in the air.  In the distance you can see the old
volcano summit, snow covered.

desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between

743.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a mountain trail.  If is very difficult, and with the

745.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.  Just ahead you can see a
small trail branching off.  In the distance you can see the snow covered
top of Endar's sole volcano.

746.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a steep incline, there is a split in the path up ahead, but
they all look twisty and a very hard climb, even the paths leading down
hill.  Now and then you can spot where some animals have been eating the
few hardy plants that live up here, as well as avoiding their droppings.

747.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are struggling along on this mountain trail.  The wind has the
bite of winter in it, and there is the beginning of a flutter of snow.
Looking around, you can see that most of the mountain tops are covered
with a thick layer of snow, it must be cold up there.

748.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a mountain trail.  There are only rocks and boulders as
far as the eye can see.  The trails splits just ahead, leading in
different directions up the hill.  There is no evidence to help you
determine which is the most travelled by.

749.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a mountain trail.  To the far east you can see the smoking
top of the volcano.  The trail is very difficult here, and the stones
are sliding from beneath your feet.  If you are not careful you could
easily break a leg.  Rumour has it that trolls live in these mountains,
and it would be like them to love this barren rock-filled land.

750.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a deep, but narrow, gorge.  There is a tree
fallen across the gorge.  A fast flowing river lies at the bottom of
the gorge.  You can see no way down to the base or any other way, up or
down, river for you to cross the river.  The tree looks very old, and
is covered in thick green moss.  It is about five feet wide and over
forty feet long.

751.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing river.  There is a
large tree fallen across the river.  A fast flowing river lies at the
bottom of the gorge.  You can see no way down to the base or any other
way, up or down, river for you to cross the river.  The rock is covered
with greeny blue moss, from all the water splashing onto it.  The water
flowing underneath the rock is crystal blue clear, and you can taste its
sparkling cleanness in the air.

752.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees all around, living
precariously on the mountain side.  The trail splits up ahead, as it
bends around a particularly large rock.  The trees block the view ahead.
You can hear the sound of rushing water echoing off the mountain walls.
There must be a river nearby.

757.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing river.  There is a

bottom of the gorge.  You can see no way down to the base or any other

772.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees clinging to the rock face,
but up ahead you can see that they soon die out, leaving only barren rock
to grace the view.  The going is difficult as the trail winds its way up
through the forests and over small riverlets.  Looking south, trees extend
as far as the eye can see, but dissappear quite quickly to the north.

773.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a deep, but narrow, gorge.  There is a tree
fallen across the gorge.  A fast flowing river lies at the bottom of
the gorge.  You can see no way down to the base or any other way, up or
down, river for you to cross the river.  The tree looks very old, and
is covered in thick green moss.  It is about five feet wide and over
forty feet long.

774.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on the tree trunk.  It is quite large, a good old redwood.
Strange to find it so far up the tree line, but lacking the problem
of its location it forms a strong bridge to cross the river.  The water
down below looks beautifully fresh and sparkling clear as the tourqoise
torrent flows into the forest.

775.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing river.  There is a
large tree fallen across the river.  A fast flowing river lies at the
bottom of the gorge.  You can see no way down to the base or any other
way, up or down, river for you to cross the river.  The rocks are covered

776.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.  Just ahead you can see a
small trail branching off.

777.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are near the entrance of a small cave, it looks dark and musty.
The cave seems to stretch deep within the mountain.  The trail continues
on past the cave.  There is a strong smell of bear in the air. Looking
around, you can see that most of the mountain tops are covered with a
thick layer of snow, it must be cold up there.

778.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are in a dark, tunnel-like, portion of the cave.  The smell of bear
is very powerful and fresh.  The cave walls are smooth and polished, with a
smooth bubbly pattern on the roof.  There is a gentle breeze flowing down
the cave, towards the entrance.  Now and then you see pieces of fluorescent
slime growing on the damp walls, but they don't provide enough light for
you to see by.

779.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail.  The stones are slipping from beneath your
feet with every step.  The sound of crunching stones is accompanied only
by the whistling of the wind, as it chills the very stones you walk upon.
There is a light covering of snow now, leaving a trail of footsteps
behind you, which are being slowly erased by the shifting of the snow in
the wind.

780.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are struggling along on this mountain trail.  The wind has the
bite of winter in it, and there is the beginning of a flutter of snow.
Looking around, you can see that most of the mountain tops are covered
with a thick layer of snow, it must be cold up there.

782.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail, there are trees all around, living
precariously on the mountain side.  The trail splits up ahead, as it
bends around a particularly large rock.  The trees block the view ahead.
You can hear the sound of rushing water echoing off the mountain walls.
There must be a river nearby.

783.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are  near the edge of a small mountain stream.  Looking up towards
its source you spy a small melting ice flow.  There are a few small green
shoots at the edge of the stream.  The path leads along a gentle incline
down to the edge of the water.  The river is following a small gully in
the mountains.  The gully is too narrow and rocky for you to be able to
walk along but you can see that the trail continues on, on the other side
of the stream.

784.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing stream.  The water is
only a few inches deep but yet you can feel the strength of the stream as it
tries to pull you downstream.  The rocks around the rivers edge are covered
with greeny blue moss, from all the water splashing onto it.  The flowing
water flowing is crystal blue clear, and you can taste its sparkling
cleanness in the air.  The water is freezing cold, you can feel your toes
turn blue as you stand in the water.

785.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are the entrance of a small cave, there is a small trail leading
from the entrance down through the mountains.  The smell of fresh air as
compared to the musty air coming from the case is immense, one has the
smell of bear, the other of mountain flowers and fresh snow.  For a trail
leading to a cave with potentially a bear's den, it seems strangely well
maintained.

786.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are in a dark, tunnel-like, portion of the cave.  The smell of bear

slime growing on the damp walls, but they don't provide enough light for
you to see by.

806.name: An Old mine
desc: "   You have stumbled upon what looks to be an old mine, of some sort.
Looking around you can see an old rundown shack, with the roof half-ripped
off, and the walls more there as a statement, that there were once walls.
Peering into what used to be the mineshaft, you can see that it only
extends for a few yards, before a rockfall blocks any further passage.
A little stream is flowing through this small valley, the ice along its
edges cracking under your feet.  It is very cold here, the wind whistling
through the gap.  Looking up towards the cold clear sky, you can see some
smoke escaping from the volcano top, blowing strongly to the south.
"   The rockfall seems to have occured quite recently, the rocks are still loose
and are apt to fall on you if you try to move them.

extra.desc: "   You are still too far away to make any of the details out.

807.name: An old mine
desc: "   You have stumbled upon an old deserted mine, the shaft entrance is further
south but you can see that the living quarters are no longer really habitable.
The walls of the house are more holed than solid, and the roof has mostly
been ripped off.  It is an amazing feat in itself that this much of the hut
is still standing, considering the fierce wind that is in it, the cold and the
hail, slamming into it day after day.  There is a little stream gurgling
gently to the south, slightly encrusted in ice.

808.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail.  The stones are slipping from beneath your
feet with every step.  The sound of crunching stones is accompanied only
by the whistling of the wind, as it chills the very stones you walk upon.
There is a light covering of snow now, leaving a trail of footsteps
behind you, which are being slowly erased by the shifting of the snow in
the wind.

809.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.

810.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.

811.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.  Just ahead you can see a
small trail branching off.  In the distance you can see the snow covered
top of Endar's sole volcano.

812.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats and foolish adventurers.
There are strange rumours of vicious animals and great treasure hidden
in these hills.

813.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You can see the cliffs of Endar now.  The trail is very rocky and
the wind is beginning to chill you.  Looking over the edge you can see
some caves just a few hundred yards from the top of the cliff.  Looking
further down you can see the ocean breaking against the cliffs, throwing
plumes of spray hundreds of feet into the air.  There are seagulls soaring
high in the wind, surfing the updrafts of wind racing from the cliffs.
The cacophony of screeches and crashes waves forms a symphony of noise
that is overwhelming.

815.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are near the edge of a small mountain stream.  Looking up towards
its source you spy a small melting ice flow.  There are a few small green
shoots at the edge of the stream.  The path leads along a gentle incline
down to the edge of the water.  The river is following a small gully in
the mountains.  The gully is too narrow and rocky for you to be able to
walk along but you can see that the trail continues on, on the other side
of the stream.

816.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing stream.  The water is
only a few inches deep but yet you can feel the strength of the stream as it
tries to pull you downstream.  The rocks around the rivers edge are covered
with greeny blue moss, from all the water splashing onto it.  The flowing
water flowing is crystal blue clear, and you can taste its sparkling
cleanness in the air.  The water is freezing cold, you can feel your toes
turn blue as you stand in the water.

817.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing stream.  The water is
only a few inches deep but yet you can feel the strength of the stream as it
tries to pull you downstream.  The rocks around the rivers edge are covered
with greeny blue moss, from all the water splashing onto it.  The flowing
water flowing is crystal blue clear, and you can taste its sparkling
cleanness in the air.  The water is freezing cold, you can feel your toes
turn blue as you stand in the water.

818.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are near the edge of a small mountain stream.  Looking up towards
its source you spy a small melting ice flow.  There are a few small green
shoots at the edge of the stream.  The path leads along a gentle incline
down to the edge of the water.  The river is following a small gully in
the mountains.  The gully is too narrow and rocky for you to be able to
walk along but you can see that the trail continues on, on the other side
of the stream.

819.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing river.  The trail leads
along the edge of the river and its gorge.  A fast flowing river lies at the
bottom of the gorge.  You can see no way down to the base or any other
way, up or down, river for you to cross the river.  The rocks are covered
water flowing is crystal blue clear, and you can taste its sparkling
cleanness in the air.

820.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing river.  The trail leads
along the edge of the river and its gorge.  A fast flowing river lies at the
bottom of the gorge. The rocks are covered with greeny blue moss, from all
the water splashing onto it.  The flowing water flowing is crystal blue
clear, and you can taste its sparkling cleanness in the air.  The trail is
now even more windy than ever before.

821.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing river.  The trail leads
along the edge of the river and its gorge.  A fast flowing river lies at the
bottom of the gorge. The rocks are covered with greeny blue moss, from all

clear, and you can taste its sparkling cleanness in the air.  The trail is

desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing river.  The trail leads

825.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are near the entrance of a small cave, it looks dark and musty.
The cave seems to stretch deep within the mountain.  The trail continues
on past the cave.  There is a strong smell of bear in the air. Looking
around, you can see that most of the mountain tops are covered with a
thick layer of snow, it must be cold up there.

826.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are in a dark cave.  The smell of bear is very powerful and fresh.
The cave walls are smooth and polished, with a smooth bubbly pattern on the
roof.  There is a gentle breeze flowing down the cave, towards the entrance
Now and then you see pieces of fluorescent slime growing on the damp walls,
but they only provide enough light so as to accentuate the shadows.  The
cave is very quiet and warm in comparison to outside.

827.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are in a dark, tunnel-like, portion of the cave.  The smell of bear
is very powerful and fresh.  The cave walls are smooth and polished, with a
smooth bubbly pattern on the roof.  There is a gentle breeze flowing down
the cave, towards the entrance.  Now and then you see pieces of fluorescent
slime growing on the damp walls, but they don't provide enough light for
you to see by.

828.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are in a dark cave.  The smell of bear is very powerful and fresh.
The cave walls are smooth and polished, with a smooth bubbly pattern on the
roof.  There is a gentle breeze flowing down the cave, towards the entrance
Now and then you see pieces of fluorescent slime growing on the damp walls,
but they only provide enough light so as to accentuate the shadows.  The

Now and then you see pieces of fluorescent slime growing on the damp walls,

832.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are near the entrance of a small cave, it looks dark and musty.
The cave seems to stretch deep within the mountain.  The trail continues
on past the cave.  There is a strong smell of bear in the air. Looking
around, you can see that most of the mountain tops are covered with a
thick layer of snow, it must be cold up there.

833.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a mountain trail.  If is very difficult, and with the
forbidding clouds high up in these hills, you pray to the gods that it
doesn't rain, as it would make the trail even more dangerous.  The land
is very barren, but here and there, you spot a splash of colour as some
wild flowers brave the elements.

834.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.  Just ahead you can see a
small trail branching off.  In the distance you can hear the crashing of
waves.

835.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are by the cliffs now.  The wind is very cold.  You can see some
animal trails leading along the cliff edge.  The cliffs are not actually
very steep up here, but consist of steep slopes of shale and gravel.  The
sound of seagulls squawking and the wind rushing over the cliffs is all
you can hear, it is deafening.

836.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You can see the cliffs of Endar now.  The trail is very rocky and
the wind is beginning to chill you.  Looking over the edge you can see
some caves just a few hundred yards from the top of the cliff.  Looking
further down you can see the ocean breaking against the cliffs, throwing
plumes of spray hundreds of feet into the air.  There are seagulls soaring
high in the wind, surfing the updrafts of wind racing from the cliffs.
The cacophony of screeches and crashes waves forms a symphony of noise
that is overwhelming.

desc: "   You can see the cliffs of Endar now.  The trail is very rocky and

838.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are by the cliffs now.  The wind is very cold.  You can see some
animal trails leading along the cliff edge.  The cliffs are not actually
very steep up here, but consist of steep slopes of shale and gravel.  The
sound of seagulls squawking and the wind rushing over the cliffs is all
you can hear, it is deafening.  You can feel the rushing of the wind as it
strikes the cliffs and is forced straight up.  Leaning into the wind you can
see some small animal trails leading down the side.

839.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are by the cliffs now.  The wind is very cold.  You can see some
animal trails leading along the cliff edge.  The cliffs are not actually
very steep up here, but consist of steep slopes of shale and gravel.  The
sound of seagulls squawking and the wind rushing over the cliffs is all
you can hear, it is deafening.  You can feel the rushing of the wind as it

840.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are by the cliffs now.  The wind is very cold. The cliffs are not
actually very steep up here, but consist of steep slopes of shale and
gravel.  The sound of seagulls squawking and the wind rushing over the
cliffs is all you can hear, it is deafening.  You can feel the rushing of
the wind as it strikes the cliffs and is forced straight up.  Leaning into
the wind you can see some small animal trails leading down the side.
Looking more closely at a distant spot, halfway down the cliff, you spy
a goat, eat some grass, on an almost vertical stretch of cliff-face.

841.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are by the cliffs now.  The wind is very cold. The cliffs are not

843.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are by the cliffs now.  The wind is very cold. The cliffs are not
actually very steep up here, but consist of steep slopes of shale and

cliffs is all you can hear, it is deafening.  You can feel the rushing of
the wind as it strikes the cliffs and is forced straight up.  Leaning into
the wind you can see some small animal trails leading down the side.
Looking more closely at a distant spot, halfway down the cliff, you spy
a goat, eat some grass, on an almost vertical stretch of cliff-face.

844.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are by the cliffs now.  The wind is very cold. The cliffs  seem
to consist of steep slopes of shale and gravel.  The sound of seagulls
squawking and the wind rushing over the cliffs is all you can hear, it is
deafening.  You can feel the rushing of the wind as it strikes the cliffs
and is forced straight up.  Leaning into the wind you can see some small
animal trails leading down the side.  Leaning carefully over the edge you
can make out some caves a few hundred feet down from the clifftop.

845.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You can see the cliffs of Endar now.  The trail is very rocky and
the wind is beginning to chill you.  Looking over the edge you can see
some caves just a few hundred yards from the top of the cliff.  Looking
further down you can see the ocean breaking against the cliffs, throwing
plumes of spray hundreds of feet into the air.  There are seagulls soaring
high in the wind, surfing the updrafts of wind racing from the cliffs.
The cacophony of screeches and crashes waves forms a symphony of noise
that is overwhelming.

846.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are by the cliffs now.  The wind is very cold. The cliffs are not
actually very steep up here, but consist of steep slopes of shale and
gravel.  The sound of seagulls squawking and the wind rushing over the
cliffs is all you can hear, it is deafening.  You can feel the rushing of
the wind as it strikes the cliffs and is forced straight up.  Just ahead
cliff path comes to a end, just at a small outcrop of the cliff, the cliff
juts out about a further couple of yards.

847.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a narrow outcrop on the cliff-face.  On three sides there
is a massive drop of hundreds of feet, to the crashing waves below.
The little strip of land leading back to the comfort of the cliff-top seems
precariously narrow.  Out here you are exposed to the force of the wind,
every gust threatening to blow you off your feet, to the rocks below.
Bracing yourself against the wind you can look right out over the cliff
edge.  From here you can see that the cliff is actually dotted quite densely
with small stringy bushes, some of which come quite close to the top of
the cliff.  Looking out over the ocean, there is nothing but blue skies
and blue water.  Looking a little more to the south and east, you can
see some specks of white travelling towards Endar's Harbour.
"   Looking at the bushes that dot the cliff-face, you can see that they
are all within a few feet of each other, leading all the way down the cliff
face, stopping about fifthy feet short of the bottom.  The bushes seem to
be stubbornly rooted to the cliff, as your tugging of one near you attests.
"   Looking at the bushes that dot the cliff-face, you can see that they
are all within a few feet of each other, leading all the way down the cliff
face, stopping about fifthy feet short of the bottom.  The bushes seem to
be stubbornly rooted to the cliff, as your tugging of one near you attests.

desc: "   You can see the cliffs of Endar now.  The trail is very rocky and

desc: "   You are  near the edge of a small mountain stream.  Looking up towards

852.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.  Just ahead you can see a

853.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail.  The stones are slipping from beneath your
feet with every step.  The sound of crunching stones is accompanied only
by the whistling of the wind, as it chills the very stones you walk upon.
There is a light covering of snow now, leaving a trail of footsteps
behind you, which are being slowly erased by the shifting of the snow in
the wind.

854.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on top of the mountain.  It is cold and the air is thin,
but there is a fantastic view, of the City of Endar, in all its
majesty, the volcanic ranges to the south, the great forests, and
the shipyards which depend on them.  The air whistles by, invigorating
you.  There is a hint of salt as the wind rushes from the ocean over
the land.  There are some large birds flying in the updrafts to the west.

855.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a mountain trail.  To the far east you can see the smoking
top of the volcano.  The trail is very difficult here, and the stones
are sliding from beneath your feet.  If you are not careful you could
easily break a leg.  Rumour has it that trolls live in these mountains,
and it would be like them to love this barren rock-filled land.

856.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a mountain trail.  If is very difficult, and with the
forbidding clouds high up in these hills, you pray to the gods that it
doesn't rain, as it would make the trail even more dangerous.  The land
is very barren, but here and there, you spot a splash of colour as some
wild flowers brave the elements.

857.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You can see the cliffs of Endar now.  The trail is very rocky and
the wind is beginning to chill you.  Looking over the edge you can see

The cacophony of screeches and crashes waves forms a symphony of noise
that is overwhelming.

858.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are by the cliffs now.  The wind is very cold.  You can see some
animal trails leading along the cliff edge.  The cliffs are not actually
very steep up here, but consist of steep slopes of shale and gravel.  The
sound of seagulls squawking and the wind rushing over the cliffs is all
you can hear, it is deafening.  You can feel the rushing of the wind as it
strikes the cliffs and is forced straight up.  Leaning into the wind you can
see some small animal trails leading down the side.

859.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing river.  There is a
large rock fallen across the gorge.  A fast flowing river lies at the
bottom of the gorge.  You can see no way down to the base or any other
way, up or down, river for you to cross the river.  The rock is covered
with greeny blue moss, from all the water splashing onto it.  The water
flowing underneath the rock is crystal blue clear, and you can taste its
sparkling cleanness in the air.  In the distance you can see the old
volcano summit, snow covered.

860.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a slippery rock over the fast flowing river.  It is very
slippy, you'd need to be very agile to be able to keep your balance.  The
rushing water roars under the rock, the spray feels almost warm.

861.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on one side of a small but fast flowing river.  There is a
large rock fallen across the gorge.  A fast flowing river lies at the
bottom of the gorge.  You can see no way down to the base or any other
way, up or down, river for you to cross the river.  The rock is covered

862.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail.  The stones are slipping from beneath your
feet with every step.  The sound of crunching stones is accompanied only
by the whistling of the wind, as it chills the very stones you walk upon.
There is a light covering of snow now, leaving a trail of footsteps
behind you, which are being slowly erased by the shifting of the snow in
the wind.

863.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are struggling along on this mountain trail.  The wind has the
bite of winter in it, and there is the beginning of a flutter of snow.
Looking around, you can see that most of the mountain tops are covered
with a thick layer of snow, it must be cold up there.

864.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You have reached a slightly more level stretch.  The going is easier.
The rocks break the force of the wind, and it seems slightly warmer here
as a result.  There are some small plants here, some even have berries,
though few look ripe enough to eat.

865.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail.  The stones are slipping from beneath your
feet with every step.  The sound of crunching stones is accompanied only
by the whistling of the wind, as it chills the very stones you walk upon.
There is a light covering of snow now, leaving a trail of footsteps
behind you, which are being slowly erased by the shifting of the snow in
the wind.

desc: "   You are on a rocky trail.  The stones are slipping from beneath your
feet with every step.  The sound of crunching stones is accompanied only
by the whistling of the wind, as it chills the very stones you walk upon.
There is a light covering of snow now, leaving a trail of footsteps
behind you, which are being slowly erased by the shifting of the snow in
the wind.

873.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail.  The stones are slipping from beneath your
feet with every step.  The sound of crunching stones is accompanied only
by the whistling of the wind, as it chills the very stones you walk upon.
There is a light covering of snow now, leaving a trail of footsteps
behind you, which are being slowly erased by the shifting of the snow in
the wind.

874.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are struggling along on this mountain trail.  The wind has the
bite of winter in it, and there is the beginning of a flutter of snow.
Looking around, you can see that most of the mountain tops are covered
with a thick layer of snow, it must be cold up there.

875.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a twisty, rocky, trail.  The wind whistles down between
the large boulders, the odd pebble rattling down the side of the
steep mountain sides.  There are small trails leading off this path,
though many look fit for only agile goats.  Just ahead you can see a
small trail branching off.  Just ahead you can see the snow covered
top of Endar's sole volcano.

876.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are on a rocky trail.  The stones are slipping from beneath your
feet with every step.  The sound of crunching stones is accompanied only
by the whistling of the wind, as it chills the very stones you walk upon.
There is a light covering of snow now, leaving a trail of footsteps
behind you, which are being slowly erased by the shifting of the snow in
the wind.

877.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You have reached a slightly more level stretch.  The going is easier.
The rocks break the force of the wind, and it seems slightly warmer here
as a result.  There are some small plants here, some even have berries,
though few look ripe enough to eat.

878.name: Mountain Trails
desc: "   You are the entrance of a small cave, there is a small trail leading
from the entrance down through the mountains.  The smell of fresh air as
compared to the musty air coming from the case is immense, one has the
smell of bear, the other of mountain flowers and fresh snow.  For a trail
leading to a cave with potentially a bear's den, it seems strangely well
maintained.

879.name: A Dark Cave
desc: "   You are in a dark, tunnel-like, portion of the cave.  The smell of bear
is very powerful and fresh.  The cave walls are smooth and polished, with a
smooth bubbly pattern on the roof.  There is a gentle breeze flowing down
the cave, towards the entrance.  Now and then you see pieces of fluorescent
slime growing on the damp walls, but they don't provide enough light for
you to see by.

880.name: A Dark Cave
desc: "   You are in a dark, tunnel-like, portion of the cave.  The smell of bear
is very powerful and fresh.  The cave walls are smooth and polished, with a
smooth bubbly pattern on the roof.  There is a gentle breeze flowing down
the cave, towards the entrance.  Now and then you see pieces of fluorescent
slime growing on the damp walls, but they don't provide enough light for
you to see by.

890.name: Rushing River Waters
desc: "   You are in a small but very fast flowing river.  You are passing through
the mountains at a very brisk rate.  Soon you'll be out of them.  Looking
around you can see that you will pass reasonable close to the edge of the
forests to the south of the island.

891.name: Rushing River Waters
desc: "   You are in a small but very fast flowing river.  You are passing through
the mountains at a very brisk rate.  Soon you'll be out of them.  Looking
around you can see that you will pass reasonable close to the edge of the
forests to the south of the island.

892.name: Under a Green-Leafed Canopy
desc: "   You are in a gradually widening river.  You are passing through the
edges of the great forests.  If you are lucky you may be able to get on to
dry land.  The forests themselves are immense, the trees tower fifty feet
if not more into the sky.  The river flows totally beneath their canopy,
letting a gentle green light to filter through.

893.name: Under a Green-Leafed Canopy
desc: "   You are in a gradually widening river.  You are passing through the
edges of the great forests.  If you are lucky you may be able to get on to
dry land.  The forests themselves are immense, the trees tower fifty feet
if not more into the sky.  The river flows totally beneath their canopy,
letting a gentle green light to filter through.

894.name: Flowing through Eastern Farmlands
desc: "   You are passing though the farms that are close to the forest.  You
can't see much of what they are growing but considering the state of the
houses by the river side you gather that they mustn't be doing too well.
The river is no longer flowing as violently as before, it has now broadened
out to being over twelve feet wide, a veritable river.

895.name: Flowing through Eastern Farmlands
desc: "   You are passing though the farms that are close to the forest.  You
can't see much of what they are growing but considering the state of the
houses by the river side you gather that they mustn't be doing too well.
The river is no longer flowing as violently as before, it has now broadened
out to being over twelve feet wide, a veritable river.

896.name: Under a Bridge
desc: "   You are passing under a wide bridge.   Looking from below you can see
that the bridge was made of small shaped rocks, carefully chosen so that
with the weight of the bridge it would all hold together without any
cement.  The underside of the bridge is covered in moss as are the banks
near the bridge, but now that the river is flowing quite leisurely, you
may be able to clamber up the banks.  To the east you can recognise some
of the spires of the city and in the east you know that the great forests
can be found.

897.name: Flowing through the Southern Farmlands
desc: "   You are passing though the farms that are close to the forest.  You
can't see much of what they are growing but considering the state of the
houses by the river side you gather that they seem to be very prosperous,
the houses are all gaily decorated and quite large, some with more than one
chimney.  The river is now flowing quite leisurely, meandering along in
gentle curves.

898.name: Flowing along the River Liffey
desc: "   You are passing though the farms that are close to the forest.  You
can't see much of what they are growing but considering the state of the
houses by the river side you gather that they seem to be very prosperous,
the houses are all gaily decorated and quite large, some with more than one
chimney.  The river is now flowing quite leisurely, meandering along in
gentle curves.  Just ahead you can make out the sea, and to the west you
can see the tops of some tall ships and further of some spires of the city.

899.name: Flowing along the River Liffey
desc: "   You are passing though the farms that are close to the forest.  You
can't see much of what they are growing but considering the state of the
houses by the river side you gather that they seem to be very prosperous,
the houses are all gaily decorated and quite large, some with more than one
chimney.  The river is now flowing quite leisurely, meandering along in
gentle curves.  Just ahead you can make out the sea, and to the west you
can see the tops of some tall ships and further of some spires of the city.
There is a bank nearby that you will enable you to climb out of the river

900.name: Ronan's Bay
desc: "   You are in the rarely visited Ronan's Bay.  It is a small bay, with the
southern headlands sweeping westward to enclose a small beach and a gentle
lagoon.  Looking out over the bay you can see the fierce waves of the ocean
crashing against the breakers, letting only the gentlest of waves through,
to lap against the shore.  The beach itself is composed of silvery sands,
sloping gently from the forest to the lapping waters of the bay.  Over in
the distance there is a small hut, with an old man sitting outside it.  The
man looks weather beaten, tanned and wrinkled from the sea air, and yet he
has a look of wisdom about him, a look that bids you come closer.
"   It is a small house consisting of driftwood.  Looking inside you can
see that it has only one room, containing a simple sleeping mat.  There
are no comforts or luxuries in its construction.  There is something
strange about the hut, and it takes you a while to notice, though the house
it strongly built, and clearly water-tight, not a simple piece of wood has
been broken, split, or cut in its construction... what a marvel!

extra.keywords: _ex3  You wind your way between the trees

extra.desc: You wind your way between the trees.

exits.desc: You wind your way between the trees.

901.name: The Deep Forests
desc: "   You are in the middle of a large forest.  The trees tower above you,
blocking out the sky, and letting only a dull gray light through.  There
are no trails here, but the trees are far enough apart so as to enable
you to walk anywhere you like.  There is plenty of animal life in the
forest, you can hear birds in the trees and every now and again you
spot a deer leaping in the distance.

902.name: The Deep Forests
desc: "   You are in the middle of a large forest.  The trees tower above you,
blocking out the sky, and letting only a dull gray light through.  There
are no trails here, but the trees are far enough apart so as to enable
you to walk anywhere you like.  There is plenty of animal life in the
forest, you can hear birds in the trees and every now and again you
spot a deer leaping in the distance.

903.name: The Deep Forests
desc: "   You are amongst a horde of trees.  This forest must be ancient.  The
trees all look healthy and well tended.  There is a sense of magic in the
air, a healthiness, a greeness, it is as if nature was more than just
being, but is actively alive here.

927.name: A Quiet Pool
desc: "   You are in a small glen, there is a small silvery pool here.  You
can spot out of the side of you eye some sprites playing at the water's
edge, but they always seem to dissappear as soon as you look at them.
This is a peaceful spot, and you notice the many old campfires, this is
a place where many have stayed to rest.  The trees are cloaked in a silent
grey moss, which glistens with every breath of wind.  The birds seem to be
singing more sweetly here, as if in celebration of life.

928.name: The Deep Forests

blocking out the sky, and letting only a dull gray light through.  There

937.name: The Deep Forests
desc: "   You are outside a small run-down cottage.  There are some small piles
of chopped wood lying at one end of the building, they have been there
for so long, that saplings have begun to grow between the logs.  The house
is situated in a small clearing, the trees do not seem to want to encroach
any closer on the house, but share their branches to provide a green
canopy for the little clearing, a green light filters through.  The canopy
is so dense that not even the fiercest of storms would bother this little
cottage.  The birds have stopped singing, and the air is silent.

950.name: A Forest Cottage
desc: "   You are in the the small cottage.  There is a well maintained fireplace
and there is a little cot in the corner.  It looks a lot better maintained
than the outside suggests.  In the corner you can see some pots and pans,
blackened with soot.  You can see an old kettle on the grate over the fire.
The fire has died down to some glowing coals.  Over the fireplace you can
see a row of small jars, with little inscriptions written on them.
"   The jars of various sizes, some large, some small.  They seem to mainly
contain plant leaves.  The inscriptions are written with a flowing, elven-like
hand and name the contents as Winter Snowbells, red rose petals, dandelion
pollen.

951.name: Forest Source Rooms
951.desc: Where all the forest monsters come from... will wander from here to forest

952.name: Forest Source Rooms
952.desc: Where all the monsters come from :)

953.name: Forest Source Rooms
953.desc: Where all the monsters come from :!

954.name: Out on the Sea
desc: "   You are out upon the sea, the waves are quite mild, hardly hampering
your efforts at swimming.  Nearby you can make out the pier and quite a
bit beyond that the harbour shore.  In the distance you can make out the
twin towers at the entrance to the harbour, and the sunken ship to the
north.

955.name: Out on the Sea
desc: "   You are out upon the sea, the waves are quite mild, hardly hampering
your efforts at swimming.  Nearby you can make out the pier and quite a
bit beyond that the harbour shore.  In the distance you can make out the

956.name: Out on the Sea
desc: "   You are out upon the sea, the waves are quite mild, hardly hampering
your efforts at swimming.  Nearby you can make out the pier and quite a
bit beyond that the harbour shore.  In the distance you can make out the
twin towers at the entrance to the harbour, and the sunken ship to the
north.

957.name: Out on the Sea
desc: "   You are out upon the sea, the waves are mild but now are hampering
your efforts at swimming.  You are getting quite a distance away from
the shore.  In the distance you can make out the twin towers at the
entrance to the harbour, the piers beside the wharf.

958.name: Out on the Sea
desc: "   You are out upon the sea, the waves are quite mild, hardly hampering
your efforts at swimming.  Nearby you can make out the sunken ship and
beyond that the northern sea wall.  In the distance you can make out the
twin towers at the entrance to the harbour, the piers to the south
and beyond those the wharf.

959.name: Out on the Sea
desc: "   You are out upon the sea, the waves are mild but now are hampering

960.name: Out on the Sea
desc: "   You are out to sea, the waves are quite large and the currents are
pulling you out further to sea.  With the size of the waves you are
finding it extremely difficult to make progress in any one direction.
Over the tops of the waves you can make out the Lighthouse Tower at the
entrance to the harbour, but you can't seem to keep an eye on it.

961.name: Out on the Sea
desc: "   You are out to sea, the waves are quite large and the currents are

962.name: Out on the Sea
desc: "   You are out to sea, the waves are quite large and the currents are
pulling you out further to sea.  With the size of the waves you are
finding it extremely difficult to make progress in any one direction.
Over the tops of the waves you can make out the Mages' Tower at the
entrance to the harbour, but you can't seem to keep an eye on it.  Not
too far off you can see some ships travelling through the waves, as if
this choppy sea is calm water.  If you are not careful you may get caught
in their wake, or even worse pulled under with their passage.

970.name: Ambassadorial Suite - Chressport
desc: "   You are in an ambassadorial residence.  It is well decorated, a quick
appraisal reveals a large bedroom, a dining room, a kitchen and a well furnished
bathroom.  The room you are currently in the most used, there is a large desk
with a comfortable leather chair.  In one corner you can spot a large safe,
with a massive lock.  Upon the safe's crest, you recognise the trademark of one
of the few famous locksmiths, secure.

971.name: " Ambassadorial Suite - Oldport
desc: "   You are in an ambassadorial residence.  It is well decorated, a quick

974.name: Ambassadorial Halls
desc: "   You are in a large white marble hall.  There are few decorations, but plenty
of seats, some in public view, some secluded, hidden by some potted plants.  You
can see several distinguished looking fellows chatting together.  The main
feature of the hall are the many doors, leading to the ambassadorial suites.
There is a small plaque in the middle of the hall.
For your interest, the following cities are represented in the
following rooms:
Doora       Golbatron
Doorb       Norport
Doorc       Oldport
Doord       Chressport

989.name: Falling from the Ledge
989.desc: "   You are falling through the air, the wind rushes by, the ground ever closer.

990.name: The Entrance to a Large House
desc: "   You are in the middle of a lovely shady grove of trees.  The trees
tower above you, beautifully manicured by nature into pillars of green
and silver.  Behind you lies a large gate and in front a massive house,
partially hidden by the trees.  The house is front by several large
pillars, with a wide veranda in front of the house.  The house seems
to be made of a white marble, with some pink sandstone mixed in for
effect.  It is a stunningly beautiful house in serene surroundings.
The entrance to the house can be reached via a series of marble steps,
surrounded with potted plants and creeping ivy.

991.name: A Large Living Room
desc: "   You are in a large living room.  There is a large crystal chandelier
hanging in the centre of the ceiling, the light playing of the crystal,
shattering into a million and one different colours.  There are several
rooms leading off from here and a large stairs leading up to other rooms.
The stairs has been blocked off for some reason, whether to keep someone
upstairs or to prevent people from go up.  You shrug.. not any chance
of finding out really.  There are several comfortably overpadded chairs
in the room just inviting to sit down and relax in these peaceful
surroundings.

993.name: A Quiet Study
desc: "   The study was a fine room, large bookcases surround the room, but
the adjective has to be in the past tense for this room has been
destroyed beyond repair.  The books have been torn from the walls, the
drawers of the desk ripped open, papers thrown everywhere, books ripped
asunder.  Someone has been in here recently searching for something.
Not a single page has been left unturned or rather unripped.  There is
a sense of foreboding in the air.

994.name: A Cosy bedroom
desc: "   You are in a small cosy bedroom.  The room is actually that small
but with the massive bed it looks small and cosy.  The bed has white
silk sheets with four massive.  A small door leads into an ensuite
toilet and a small bath.  There is a small table to one side of the
bed with a large candle on it.  The candle looks well used as the
rivulets of wax run down the side of the holder and onto the desk
itself.  There are no windows in this room but that doesnt seem to
stop the light sneaking in from somewhere, to give this room a nice
comfortable half-light feel to it.

995.name: A Large living room
desc: "   You are in the living room of the Realm Protector.  The realm
protector is a honorary title given to a citizen who has served the
kingdom well.  With the title comes some benefits, a small annual
remuneration and this house.  The room you are in is sparsely furnished,
just a few chairs and a small table.  To one side you can see the
entrance to the kitchen and the bedroom.  The insulation between this
room and the main road outside is not the greatest, but I suppose the
noise is one of the drawbacks of living along the Royal Mile.

996.name: A Small Residence
desc: "   You are in a small residence.  There are few furnishings
but a small bed in the corner and a table.  off one one side of the room you
can see a small kitchen, partially hidden by a small protruding wall.  There
is only one window in the room.  It leads out onto the street. It is
only about two feet by two, and from here you can make out Illiad's Restuarant
and the corner of the street where it turns just before the park.  Once
nice thing about this house is the constant smell of baking coming from
Gregi's down the road.  The door looks secure, with a good lock.

998.name: Fionn's Jail
desc: "   You are in a dark cell, there is no light, there is no exit, no-one can
hear you shout.....
998.flags: dark, no_mob, indoors, peaceful, nosteal, no_magic, rent_room, dispel_magic
